item.title: Connect @ Macy's Coordinator, Full Time: Buford, GA - Macy’s Mall Of Georgia
item.description: Details: OVERVIEW: The Macy's Personal Shopper is an exceptional Sales Associate whose primary function is to connect with clients and provide one on one service and demonstrates MAGIC selling throughout the store. They create an enhanced shopping experience and drive repeat sales by creating relationships, leveraging the My Client tool. They utilize product knowledge tools, technology and superior selling skills to drive sales. They are an expert on the merchandise they sell, highly knowledgeable and conversant in current trends and customer reviews. The personal shopper is proficient in using mobile devices and leveraging digital content. They eagerly embrace new technologies and use them to drive incremental sales. The Personal Shopper reports directly to the Service Hub Lead and proactively advocates for the customer. In addition they communicate customer opportunities to store and district team as needed. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: - Drive sales by consistently demonstrating exceptional MAGIC Selling skills, leveraging technology to optimize inventories across all channels and provide a relevant, seamless and fun one to one customer experience - Develop repeat business using My Client to regularly communicate: upcoming events, new merchandise receipts and product replenishment to generate incremental sales, whether the client is in the store or not - Provide an exceptional customer experience by ensuring the customer is always the priority, whether or not it culminates in a sale - Proactive in assisting customers who are using devices to shop and compare, whether Macy's devices or their own - Leverage product knowledge and digital resources (product descriptions, customer reviews, etc.) to increase sales by educating and assisting the customer and expanding their merchandise options to enable the best choices - Communicate regularly with District Merchant (DM) and Planners (DP) regarding stock needs to drive sales - Collaborate with Sales Manager, DM, RDM and vendors for support on driving sales promotion, optimizing technology and product knowledge - Utilize My Customer feedback log to communicate assortment opportunities - Serve as role model for peers and mentor for new hires on Product Knowledge, My Client and use of mobile devices to generate incremental sales - Achieve Scorecard goals; must be results oriented - Demonstrate a professional, can-do attitude - Maintain high customer readiness standards: deliver a clean, neat and east-to- shop store environment - Be proficient in POS and MPOS systems including Search and Send, My Client and More@Macy's tablet app - Ensure shortage prevention initiatives are executed - Perform other customer-facing, duties as needed - Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality QUALIFICATIONS: - Education/Experience: High School degree or equivalent. Minimum 1 year previous Selling or retail experience required. - Communication Skills: Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management. - Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction and calculating percentages coupled with ability to use a calculator fluidly. - Reasoning Ability: Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills. Demonstrates ability to build relationships and convert customers into a client. - Physical Demands: This position involves constant moving and standing. Involves standing a minimum of two hours. Involves lifting at least 30 lbs. May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders. May have to reach above eye level. - Other skills: Ability to follow through on projects in a timely manner. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment. - Work Hours: Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays. This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy's, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

item.title: CNC Operator
item.description: Details: Take an idea. Make it a product. Get it into the pipeline. Share it with the world. Sounds simple, but, of course, the devil's in the details. At Nike's In-House Manufacturing and Distribution Divisions , we manage every detail, making sure great ideas become great products for athletes everywhere. What does this mean for you? In the best situations it means you'll push your colleagues to do their best work, and they'll turn around and do the same for you. And the details? Take a look and see for yourself. As our CNC Operator , you’ll work with our talented mold and tooling team in the overall set-up and operation of CNC machines. You’ll prepare material and tooling following set-up sheets and verbal instructions, as well as follow detailed set-up sheets to program CNC machines for the production of precision molds and tooling used in our plastics manufacturing. You’ll use a variety of hand tools, saws, drill presses, lathes, and manual mills to perform manual machining, in addition to monitoring the CNC machines for proper operation and to ensure a quality product. Skills you need… 2 years of work experience in the set-up and operation of CNC machines (via set-up sheets) Basic understanding of Fanuc G-codes Ability to use common machine tools, such as band saws, vertical saws, drill presses, pedestal grinders, basic hand tools, and measurement instruments such as calipers and micrometers Experience operating a lathe and manual mill preferred Ability to lift and move tools and molds up to 30 pounds Ability to meet physical requirements of stooping, bending, kneeling, crouching, pushing, hearing, reaching, and movement around work areas to accomplish job tasks Strong verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated ability to convey ideas and solutions to machining changes Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines and adapt to changing priorities and projects Strong attention to detail High School Diploma/GED or equivalent

item.title: Project Administrator
item.description: Details: DH Pace Company,located in Olathe, Kansas has a great opportunity for an AdministrativeAssistant. If you enjoy multi-tasking and have a high degree of urgency, thismay be the job for you! Job Responsibilities: Project Files- set up and maintain files on sold projects Prepare customer requested price estimates Process customer orders and create purchase requisitions for processing Billing- prepare and submit monthly progress billings for current projects Contract Documents- process project related paperwork to include contracts, subcontracts, lien waivers etc. Closeout Documents- prepare and submit required closeout documents included O&M manuals Provide excellent customer service, including but not limited to technical trouble shooting and resolution. Project Audits- prepare project audits for management review at project completion

item.title: Senior Traffic Engineer
item.description: Details: Are you a Traffic Engineer that is no longer challenged with your current company? Are you in a role that feels like a “dead end" with no professional growth potential? Would you like to lead a highly skilled team of professionals on exciting projects? If you answered “yes" to any of these questions then this is the opportunity for you. The Construction & Engineering Services Search Team of The Richmond Group USA (TRG) is actively seeking a Senior Traffic Engineer to join a highly successful Engineering Firm that provides transportation-engineering services. This amazing company has continued to grow rapidly year over year in both public and private sectors. This outstanding opportunity is best suited for an individual with a strong traffic engineering background who can handle multiple large projects simultaneously. Our client has plans to expand their operations through the addition of new offices and with proven success this person will serve as a managing engineer in one of their new offices. This highly visible role will report directly to the Vice President of the company and will be a key member of their team. The ideal candidate will be a degreed Civil Engineer with an emphasis in transportation/ traffic engineering. This is truly an exciting opportunity for a Traffic Engineer to join an amazing organization in a highly visible role with opportunities to take on a lead role as the company continues to expand. Background: Degreed Civil Engineer with a transportation/ traffic emphasis Ability to manage outstanding team on all projects Must be a P.E. (Professional Engineer) Strong communication skills with all internal and external stakeholders PM experience is a plus If you are interested in this or future opportunities in your area, please send a Word-Formatted resume to and we will contact you when opportunities arise that match your geography and experience. All inquiries are kept confidential and your information will not be shared without your prior approval. *Be sure to Include a reference to the Position you are applying for (posting ID or position number) All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to the individual's race, color, sex, national origin, religion, age, disability, genetic information, status as a military veteran or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

item.title: Analytical Auditor
item.description: Details: Joulé has an opening for a contract Analytical Auditor at a pharmaceutical manufacturing company in the Brick, NJ area. Job Description: Will solely review analytical data from the chemistry lab and provide approval for product to be released. Will not be conducting any off-site customer audits, and will not be performing any bench chemistry work. Needs a very experienced candidate who is familiar with reviewing documents that a Supervisor/Manager would have exposure to. Won’t be running samples through Empower, but must know how to navigate Empower to collect data and review.

item.title: Senior Cost Accountant
item.description: Details: Job is located in Dallas, TX. Sandvik Mining , the leading global supplier of equipment and tools, service and technical solutions for the mining industry, is currently looking for a Senior Cost Accountant. Relocation to Alachua, Florida will be provided. The Role The Senior Cost Accountant is responsible for establishing standard costing on all components and the preparation of inventory valuations at the plant. The incumbent will assist the Business Controller in overseeing the daily financial operations of the facility and perform related support functions. This includes review of ongoing work in process and completed jobs for costing completeness, preparation of customer invoices and review of all paperwork for export shipments. Also, the Senior Cost Accountant will participate in the preparation of financial statements including P&L, Balance Sheet and all required analysis of both. The Senior Cost Accountant will work with the Business Controller in budget preparation and monthly financial closing and all required reporting. The role is internally focused and concentrates on strengthening the financial reporting and to help initiate additional internal controls for the facility. Internal reporting will be increased to give facility personnel additional tools to ensure more efficient operations.

item.title: Maintenance Technician
item.description: Details: 3rd shift The responsibilities include: -Working with electrical, mechanical maintenance and pneumatic schematics -Troubleshoot PLC's and electronic drives -Mostly work with Allen Bradley -Troubleshoot 480V 3 phase -Troubleshoot hydrualic and pneumatics About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. item.title: Leader, Shop Floor
item.description: Details: The Shop Floor Leader is accountable to help facilitate the successful management of the company shop. All actions will be in support of increasing line of business satisfaction, lowering the cost of repairs, and increasing equipment availability. This includes effectively working with the Shop Manager, managing the shop in his/her absence, and training to become a Shop Manager. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Reinforce and demonstrate Schneider’s core values and in so doing, support Schneider’s Union Free philosophy. This includes supporting and leading Schneider’s core value of safety first and always. Addressing any unsafe behaviors, auditing for safety compliance, and ensuring all visitors in the shop are safe. May include taking the lead on the safety team. 2. Accountable for equipment availability and repair decisions for fleet units. This includes communication with the Line of Business to understand the business needs in order to maximize the equipment availability and prioritize the work. 3. On the job (live) work order audits and performance audits of associates. This includes giving performance feedback during the audit on the floor, ensuring the associates are using the checklists, and reinforcing the Schneider established work processes. 4. Assign work to associates, matching the skill needed to complete the task to the associate who appropriately has that skill. 5. Develop associates’ skills. Ensure that everyone has completed their training on-time including vendor based training. 6. Audit the work of the shop champions. Ensure that they are being effective in their roles and leading those efforts in the shop. 7. Support the Shop Manager in enforcing parts processes. This includes inventory controls, meeting parts key factors, maintaining appropriate inventory, ensuring accuracy of cycle counts, and reinforcing the use of Schneider parts processes with associates. 8. Support the Shop Manager in controlling the level of tire spend in the shop. This includes ensuring that proper tire stances are being followed in the shop, supporting the tire champion, and reinforcing Schneider tire processes with associates. 9. Appropriately maintain vendor relationships. This includes managing what work gets vended, ensuring quality of the vended work, performing follow up when needed, and managing the costs associated with vended work. 10. Responsible for regular communication with associates to include sharing the team’s performance metrics, and corporate updates. 11. Help to set performance goals both for the shop as a whole and for individuals. Help create and execute action plans associated with those goals. 12. Complete performance assessments of associates that include Performance Assessments (PA), Business Partnerships (BP), and Individual Development Plans (IDP). 13. Responsible for quickly addressing performance related problems. This could include disciplinary action, administering Performance Improvement Plans (PIP), or termination. 14. Resolve associate issues appropriately and timely. 15. Responsible for the accuracy of payroll submissions. 16. Manage associate schedules (vacations, time off, hours) 17. Give goal –oriented recognition to the associates. 18. Ensure shop tooling is working and that associates have the tools they need to perform their job 19. Annually, assist Shop Manager with completing focal merit review for associates. 20. Support the shop staffing plan by working with recruiters, conducting interviews, coming to consensus, making offers, giving start dates, and on-boarding new associates. Attend college career fairs when appropriate. 21. When appropriate, prepare for and participate in Fair and Equitable boards. 22. Use Manager Self Service as a tool to make associate changes (pay, shift, hire, term) 23. Required to work a minimum of one weekend day (Sat or Sun) shift per month

item.title: Senior Internal Auditor
item.description: Details: Job is located in Vernon Hills, IL. Role title: Senior Internal Auditor Location: Vernon Hills, IL Company Description: BCU is a $2 billion asset full service not-for-profit financial institution that provides SEG and community banking to over 187,000 members in all 50 states and Puerto Rico. Founded in 1981, BCU is currently the fastest growing credit union charted in the past 30 years and the fourth largest in Illinois. Known for providing unparalleled service, competitive rates, low fees, and innovative accessibility, BCU is regarded as having set new standards for bringing together technology and member service in the fast-changing world of financial services. As an organization, BCU is committed to improving our members’ financial wellbeing in everything we do and lives by the brand promise, We’ve Got Your Back.™ Role Description: As part of the Internal Audit Department, the Senior Auditor will assist in the completion of the Annual Audit Plan of BCU, and will play a key supporting role to enable the Department to achieve its goals. This position will oversee financial and operational audits to assess the effectiveness of internal controls. Working both independently and leading small audit teams, the Senior Auditor will review audit work performed by audit staff to determine that the work adequately fulfills the scope of the audit, and that written analyses, conclusions, findings and recommendations are based on the audit work performed. The Senior Auditor will also be responsible for managing the department’s Guest Auditor program. • The Senior Auditor will also be responsible for monitoring various projects and governance committees (as assigned) to identify potential internal control concerns. The Senior Auditor will be responsible for advising management on potential risks and providing appropriate recommendations to mitigate the risk. The Senior Auditor will also be responsible for providing periodic reporting of the team’s activities to Audit Management. • Participate in engagement planning for assigned audit projects; • Function as lead auditor for financial, operational and compliance audits, including reviews of service centers located in US and Puerto Rico; • Monitor the progress of audits to ensure timely and efficient completion of audit work; • Supervise and review the work of others (including staff auditors, guest auditors, and contract auditors), ensuring that the scope of audits is adequately fulfilled, risks are appropriately addressed, and that the work performed is documented appropriately; • Review and evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls, and compliance with policies and procedures, and state and federal regulations; • Prepare recommendations that address deficiencies identified. Validate and discuss recommendations with appropriate management, ensuring their buy-in; • Assist in the development of staff by providing on the job coaching, identifying training opportunities and by assigning challenging tasks that further their skills and abilities; • Monitor or participate in major BCU projects or committees to monitor goals, operational issues, technical issues, risk mitigation matters, or compliance issues faced by the project teams; • Assist with reviewing various monitoring reports designed to detect improper account maintenance, or other fraudulent activity; • Assist with the development and ongoing administration of audit software. • Participate in special investigations as required; and • Perform other special projects as needed.

item.title: VITA Assistant
item.description: Details: Duties will include support of the regional Volunteer Income Tax Assistance program, such as placing and scheduling volunteers, making deliveries to tax sites, and assisting in tax preparation on a as needed basis. Place, schedule, and manage VITA volunteers in tax site locations using volunteer management software. Attend VITA training and obtain IRS certification at a minimum of the basic level. Assist in the delivery of equipments and supplies throughout tax season. Assist with tax preparation on an as needed basis. Other duties as assigned by the FFSI Coordinator

item.title: Commodities Operations Analyst
item.description: Details: Summary The Commodities Operations Analyst will partner with the Commodities sales and trading desks. Client Details Our client is a top-tier global investment firm within Financial Services. This position is housed in their Manhattan branch. Description The Commodities Operations Analyst will be responsible for: Ensuring accuracy and integrity of trading risks Implement strategies to streamline processes and reduce risk Investigate and monitor process failures Resolve booking discrepancies Understanding regulatory guidelines Profile The successful candidate for the Commodities Operations Analyst position will have: A Bachelor's degree 3+ years' experience in operations Attention to detail and the ability to work in a high-stress environment Strong oral and written communication skills Proficiency in Excel Project management experience preferred Job Offer A competitive hourly wage.

item.title: Display Assistant/DOT Delivery Assistant
item.description: Details: SPECIFIC DUTIES: Helps Display Coordinator with floor moves and processing of new accessories. Assists Display Coordinator by aiming lighting on furniture and/or accessories. Must be able to move and help arrange heavy merchandise on the showroom floor. Responsible for placement of POP material including hanging banners and placing signs. Assists customers in carrying heavy merchandise to their vehicles. Keeps merchandise on the floor in functional condition, including by ordering parts and repairing when necessary. May be required to provide housekeeping support as needed. Maintains stockroom in an orderly fashion, including sweeping and mopping. Keep exits lit and free of obstruction. Assists in maintenance of the grounds. May be required to provide back‐up to the delivery team(s) as needed by meeting the requirements and duties of a DOT‐Delivery Driver, DOT Delivery Assistant,

item.title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker / Licensed Professional Counselor
item.description: Details: WES Health System is a health service organization that promotes the total wellness of its patients. Based in Philadelphia, it is currently Pennsylvania’s largest African American-managed behavioral health provider, impacting more than 30,000 patients. WES Health System affords accredited health care programs and services for adults, adolescents, and children. These programs include community-based behavioral health care and social services in outpatient settings in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Illinois, Georgia and Delaware. We offer a competitive benefits package and are an EEO. WES is in need of licensed therapists such as licensed psychologists, licensedprofessional counselors (LPC) or licensed clinical social workers (LCSW) to work part-timeas a fee for service contractor in our Wilmington, Delaware location. Candidates can expect up to 10 hours per week and must be credentialed with the insurance providers in Delaware. We are also seeking licensed therapists who are looking to start their own practice but need space. In this model, the licensed therapist provides services to their clients but compensates WES for the use of our space and any clinical/operational support.

item.title: SEO Analyst
item.description: Details: We are looking for a web professional to join our client's Web Services and Usability team. Do you understand how to manage it and make it searchable? Are you detail oriented, collaborative, and energetic? If you have experience growing and optimizing SEM and SEO channels including analyzing performance metrics to drive future action, this may be your next career opportunity. In this exciting role, the responsibilities include: Increase traffic to the site by using technologies and best practices to raise awareness of pieces of the site and upgrade Search Engine results related to the content Statistically measure responses to changes in the code-base as it affects SEO. Ability to modify the code-base to perform A/B Testing for SEO. Ability to modify the code-base to initiate an SEO-based project. Make certain that all pages have an applicable title element. Analyze what we are currently coding, and how this is negatively affecting SEO. Inspecting and resolving HTML code and content, link architecture and navigation issues. Train edit and production to properly tag and optimize content for SEO purposes Translate business goals into successful search engine optimization strategies Create a feedback loop for various Search Engines monitor changes to SEO, and then makes changes, which then is represented by changes to the metrics.

item.title: Systems Administrator
item.description: Details: We are growing and we're passionate about success, with strong values and a focus on life balance. We are looking for other team players who are passionate about our vision and who want to be part of our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a breadth of experience including experience maintaining document management system and server infrastructure. This includes installing, configuring, patching, upgrading, testing, supporting and maintaining the purchases and/or internally configured document imaging solutions.This person will play a pivotal role in ensuring IT’s understanding of business requirements as it pertains to the system. The successful candidate will have a background in Network Administration in supporting Microsoft Windows server operating systems (2003-2012) with multiple types of servers and operating system tools to include, but not limited to Active Directory. The candidate must possess a working knowledge of VMware virtual host environments. Required Education, Skills, & Experience Experience with configuration, management and support of document management software (ie ImageNow, FileNet, etc) and Workflow. Microsoft Sever 2008/2012 DHCP, DNS, TCP/IP Networking Active Directory Management/Group Policies Highly self-motivated and directed. Proven problem-solving abilities. Responsibilities: Installation, administration, and maintenance of Linux and Windows servers Implement small projects for software and hardware infrastructure Maintains and monitors existing systems and infrastructure. Researches and recommends innovative, and where possible automated, approaches for system administration tasks. Performs daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes. Reviews system and application logs, and verifies completion of scheduled jobs such as backups. Assists with regular security monitoring to prevent possible intrusions. Performs periodic performance reporting to assist with capacity planning and makes recommendations for future upgrades. Responsible for documenting the configuration of all supported systems. Manages and implements technical solutions. Tracks troubleshooting and outage information in addition to providing fully detailed root cause analysis. Participate in on-call rotation for after-hours support

item.title: Weblogic Administrator
item.description: Details: If you are a Subject Matter Expert who is talented in providing project planning and technical support to internal and external candidates then this may the ultimate opportunity for you! Ideal candidates will be responsible for managing the Weblogic infrastructure. The Weblogic Administrator is responsible for providing expertise in all aspects of middleware platform design implementation, troubleshooting and administrator. This individual will work closely with the other team members in the DBA team, project managers and application developers in creating the functional and scalable applications from design and development through implementation for business clients. This position will be providing support to security and develop appropriate audit controls and procedures to ensure the integrity of applications. Additional tasks will include: monitor and manage daily system operations tasks including system connectivity, resource allocation, incident and problem management, and the implementation of changes to the Weblogic operational infrastructure. Responsibilities: Install, configure, tune and deploy Weblogic in non-clustered/ clustered J2EE environment(s) Adjust load balancer settings to distribute and balance traffic Configure and deploy application code sets in a shared hosting environment Evaluate, test, and deploy software patches, fixes, and upgrades in accordance with Automated Notification Reports (ANR) and testing procedures used to notify end users of pending change in status/ availability of servers Must be able to work with Developers who design, develop, code test and implement procedures to load the data warehouse according to the approved design and technical models incorporating the business rules and data requirements Examine system error logs, monitor jobs and tasks Troubleshoot application problems, check server configurations, and analyze log file entries, using WebLogic Admin Console utilities as well as manual monitoring methods Use Operating System (OS) functions to find and resolve performance issues Adjust Weblogic settings such as file descriptors, targets and cluster configurations Schedule and perform after hour software maintenance to keep the system operational. Support Disaster Recovery activities

item.title: .NET Developer
item.description: Details: As an Application Developer, you will provide high quality technology solutions that address business needs within mature technology environments. You will utilize mature programming methodologies and languages and adhere to coding standards, procedures and techniques while contributing to the technical code documentation. You will participate in the analysis of business requirements and outline the proposed IT solutions. You will participate in design reviews and provide input to the design recommendations; provide input to information/data flow, and understand and comply to Software Development Life Cycle Methodology in all planning steps. You will also adhere to IT Control Policies throughout design, development and testing into application design specifications. Additionally, you will document the detailed application specifications, translate technical requirements into programmed application modules and develop/Enhance software application modules. You will participate in code reviews and ensure that all solutions are aligned to pre-defined architectural specifications; identify/troubleshoot application code-related issues; and review and provide feedback to the final user documentation. Responsibilities: Responsible for building .NET web application user interfaces using Single Page Application (SPA) paradigm Designing, coding, and supporting leading-edge web applications Designing and implementing improvements to the performance, usability, scalability, and maintainability of our software products Mentoring and coaching less experienced/skilled team members Continuous improvement to processes and practices with new ideas, concepts, methods, and technologies

item.title: Java Programmer
item.description: Details: Are you an experienced Object Oriented Programmer with experience in the entire development life cycle? If so then this position is for you! The Java Programmer will develop, enhance, debug, support, maintain, and test software applications that support business units or supporting functions. These application program solutions may involve diverse development platforms, software, hardware, technologies, and tools. The Java Programmer will participate in the design, development and implementation of complex applications, often using new technologies. They may provide technical direction and system architecture for individual initiatives. You will serve as a fully seasoned/proficient technical resource. While you will not have direct reports, you may lead projects and direct activities of a team related to special initiatives or operations. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with external programmers to coordinate delivery of software applications. The programmer will be a key player on our applications development team. This individual will need to have a good background in developing, testing, and implementing applications. This is a chance to enhance your application development skills! Responsibilities: Codes, tests, debugs, documents, and installs new applications and programs Develop and implement solutions for web applications by utilizing development languages and tools Participation in SDLC using an agile scrum methodology Delivers quality code that meets requirement Participates in agile scrum teams to design, write, and test new functionality Responsible for contributing to the ongoing improvement of the teams processes and development practices Provide 24/7 support in problem resolution to resolve software and hardware problems Ability to communicate effectively to different levels of management and different departments

item.title: Senior Cost Accountant
item.description: Details: Sandvik Mining , the leading global supplier of equipment and tools, service and technical solutions for the mining industry, is currently looking for a Senior Cost Accountant. Relocation to Alachua, Florida will be provided. The Role The Senior Cost Accountant is responsible for establishing standard costing on all components and the preparation of inventory valuations at the plant. The incumbent will assist the Business Controller in overseeing the daily financial operations of the facility and perform related support functions. This includes review of ongoing work in process and completed jobs for costing completeness, preparation of customer invoices and review of all paperwork for export shipments. Also, the Senior Cost Accountant will participate in the preparation of financial statements including P&L, Balance Sheet and all required analysis of both. The Senior Cost Accountant will work with the Business Controller in budget preparation and monthly financial closing and all required reporting. The role is internally focused and concentrates on strengthening the financial reporting and to help initiate additional internal controls for the facility. Internal reporting will be increased to give facility personnel additional tools to ensure more efficient operations.

item.title: Software Engineering Intern
item.description: Details: Vantiv (one of the 20 fastest-growing technology firms in America) is seeking engineering interns who are inquisitive and want to build software development, analytical and methodology skills in a highly distributed transaction volume processing environment. The Vantiv Cloud Solutions Engineering team develops leading edge distributed technologies intent upon recreating the payment experience. We develop scalable software solutions through an open and collaborative working environment. We are transforming payments through service oriented solutions and value added services which enable third-party developers to integrate to Vantiv's Software as a Service Cloud platform. Our platforms enable everyone from a single mobile application developer to the largest national merchant to effectively manage the payment processing data they care about. This is a unique opportunity to join a team that works across many functional areas including cloud computing, user experience, algorithms, computer architecture, computer networks, distributed computing, high performance computing, parallel processing, database systems and software engineering. QUALIFICATIONS: * Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship DESIRED SKILLS: * Experience with algorithm design * Object Oriented Programming * Experience with data structures * Java or C# development * Familiar with TCP/IP and networking * Database modeling is a plus Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

item.title: Account Executive - Indirect Sales Commercial Finance
item.description: Details: EverBank is more than just a bank; it's the evolution of an idea. Traditional financial institutions had become wasteful, inflexible and stuck in the past. We thrive because we adapt, transform and push forward despite the ever-changing financial environment. From our headquarters in Jacksonville, FL, we continue to gauge our success on that of our clients' while seeking new opportunities to help them reach and surpass their goals. Location of position is flexible within territory but preferred to be in Redmond, WA, Philadelphia, PA, Washington DC, or Baltimore, MD . Description of Principal Duties and Accountabilities: Meets and develops the commercial real estate capital needs of mortgage brokers and other select referral sources that cater to small to middle-market businesses. The Senior Account Executive applies sales expertise and market knowledge to drive market share with these mortgage brokers and sources by originating and closing single tenant and owner occupied commercial real estate loan transactions for EverBank Commercial Finance. Coordinates activities with the overall business development objectives of Everbank Commercial Finance. Carries out the Marketing Plan by studying the demographics and economics of the assigned territory. Identifies new sources of transactions by assembling and prioritizing data and information on potential origination sources that fit the profile of serving customers that EverBank can deliver product to. Solicits business aggressively through constant dialog with brokers, in-person meetings, professional networking, and follow-up calls. Maintains and grows existing customer base for generation of future sales of EverBank's commercial finance products. Performs preliminary credit review, assembles and submits information required for loan evaluation, approval, and processing. Recommends transactions to Credit Department for approval. Prepares and presents proposals and pricing, negotiates final terms directly with company officials based upon credit and real estate factors and ensures the transactions meet EverBank Commercial Finance investment parameters. Assists with documentation to ensure orderly processing of the transactions. Creates cross-selling opportunities with other EverBank products. Keeps fully informed on techniques, practices, and trends in the commercial real estate industry and shares knowledge with the entire team. Maintains a good working knowledge of real estate lending procedures, federal tax laws and IRS regulations. Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Requirements) : Prior indirect debt/sales lending experience in the commercial real estate industry Deep knowledge and understanding of commercial real estate fundamentals and underwriting. Ability to interact with high level executives, investors and real estate professionals Strong database of contacts within the assigned territory is preferred Customer focused and self directed Strong ability to influence and work in a team environment Excellent listening, verbal and written communication skills Training and Experience : Bachelor's Degree in Business, Accounting, marketing or finance, or equivalent HS Diploma and 10+years work experience in direct financial services sales. Minimum 7 years direct financial services sales experience, including demonstrated success with an indirect, wholesale approach to the market. Understanding of single tenant and owner occupied commercial real estate financial structures Understanding and experience utilizing CRM to manage accounts/territory Previous completed transactions, including prior experience with financial and credit analysis CCIM, NAIOP and other relevant real estate training experiences are value Pre-Employment Screening Includes: Credit Check Criminal Background Check Drug Screen-after offer of employment is extended and before start date Past Employment Verification Social Security Verification Note: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required of personnel so classified, and they may change at any time. EverBank is an equal opportunity employer. No employee or applicant for employment will be discriminated against because of race, color, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, gender, sexual orientation, genetic information, veteran's status or status as a protected veteran. EverBank is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for employment or contractor opportunities. Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at EverBank via e-mail, the Internet, or directly to hiring managers at EverBank in any form without valid written search agreements executed by the VP, Talent Acquisition for that specific position will be deemed the sole property of EverBank, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by EverBank as a result of the referral or through other means.

item.title: CAFE CHEF MANAGER
item.description: Details: The Café Manager for Bon Appetit Management Company is responsible for the overall success of the Café. This means adhering to the Client’s culture and guidelines, the Health Department’s regulations, and Bon Appétit’s standards and expectations of food quality, freshness and presentation. This position oversees the daily administrative and operational tasks, including financial management and analysis, sanitation and safety. This position also motivates trains, develops and directs all employees to accomplish the objectives of the operation to the satisfaction of the customers, and maintains a working relationship with the Client. Responsibilities: In the performance of their respective tasks and duties all employees are expected to conform to the following: Perform quality work within deadlines with or without direct supervision. Interact professionally with other employees, customers and suppliers. Work effectively as a team contributor on all assignments. Work independently while understanding the necessity for communicating and coordinating work efforts with other employees and organizations.

item.title: Tax Senior Accountant
item.description: Details: A growing CPA firm in Addison has an opening for a full time Tax Senior Accountant with recent tax preparation experience and advanced skills in QuickBooks. The practice consists of small and medium size business clients for which all aspects of tax and accounting are handled -- periodic accounting, business, franchise, payroll, sales, and property taxes, along with a large individual tax practice. We share a strong work ethic and encourage all of our employees to stretch and grow in their roles with our firm. You will prepare tax returns for all entity types and individuals, review QB files and make adjustments prior to tax preparation. You will be responsible for developing strong working relationships with clients that are built on understanding their businesses and challenges. Based on your demonstrated proficiency you may also begin to review tax returns prepared by others and assist with training of junior staff.

item.title: MACY'S IS HIRING: Seasonal Loss Prevention Security Guard - San Antonio, TX - North Star
item.description: Details: Overview: As a Loss Prevention Seasonal Security Guard, you will be an integral part of bringing the magic of Macy's to life. Seasonal Seasonal Security Guard work as part of a team to meet department and store objectives, and your individual responsibilities will include deterring theft and maintaining a safe business environment. Seasonal Security Guard will have work schedules that can flex and may include working early mornings, late evenings, weekends, and holidays. The summary below may not include all the essential functions and qualifications for this position. For more information, we encourage you to review the complete job description by clicking here. Essential Functions:- Visually monitor customer traffic entering and exiting the store - Communicate suspicious activity to Loss Prevention - Provide exceptional customer service by ensuring that customers do not leave with a security tag on their purchases - May perform audit functions in high shortage areas - Promptly prepare professional and complete reports relative to all theft incidents, merchandise recoveries, accident investigations, audits, and other activities as assigned by the Loss Prevention Manager - Have knowledge of and maintain strict compliance with company policies - Must be able to work Thanksgiving Day (11/27), the day after Thanksgiving (11/28), Saturday after Thanksgiving (11/29) and December 14th thru December 24th - Perform other duties as assigned - Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality Qualifications: Education/Experience: High School degree or equivalent. Complete all Seasonal Security training requirements Prior retail loss prevention experience preferred but not required. Communication Skills: Ability to read,write, and interpret instructional documents such as reports and proceduremanuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Mathematical Skills : Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction,multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator. Reasoning Ability: Ability to adapt to possible stressful and hostilesituations. Ability to remain calm under pressure and exhibit good judgment. Physical Demands: Thisposition involves regular walking, standing, hearing, and talking. Extendedperiods of standing are also involved. Some kneeling, stooping, crouching, or crawling may be involved. Ability to move and/or lift at least 30 lbs. Specific vision abilities involved include close vision, distance vision, color vision,peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Other Skills: Ability to interact with customers positively and ina friendly and accommodating manner. Ability to collaborate andfunction as a member of a team. Must possess a strong sense of urgency. Diplay consistent good judgement and decsision making skills. Work Hours: Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include early morning, day, late evening, weekends, holidays, and major sales events based on department and store/company needs. Work schedules may begin with minimal hours and will increase throughout the holiday season. This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy's, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

item.title: .NET Engineers Needed in Columbia, MD Area
item.description: Details: .NET Engineers Needed in MD Our client in the Columbia, MD area is looking to add .NET Engineers to their team on long-term contracting assignments. Please review the details below and contact me directly if you or someone you may know would be interested. Populus Group can also assist with H-1B transfers and Green Card sponsorship for those that require these services. Please note, Populus Group must sponsor or employ candidates directly for this position. No third party vendors. Top Three Skills: 1. Development experience with Entity Framework 2. Development Experience with MVC 3. 5+ years' experience with .NET/C# Web Development 4. SQL Development Skills Job Description: The Software Engineer must have the ability to work individually as well as in small teams. Experience utilizing version/source code control software is necessary. A Software Engineer will have strong technical analysis and programming skills. The Software Engineer is required to understand the business and technical requirements, architecture and design specifications and develop the associated application code. The Software Engineer must be able to function well in a high-growth business that is technologically sophisticated, high performance and high demand and understand the effect of business changes to the business and the technology environment. The technology environment is an integrated solution on multiple physical systems with both packaged and custom software. The Software Engineering process uses the latest Microsoft .NET Framework technologies, adheres to a formalized Software Development Lifecycle in a complex technical environment requiring around the clock reliability and availability. Automated notifications are used extensively across the n-tier architecture. Multiple parallel development tracks are necessary to meet the changing business needs of the fast growing business. Essential Functions: * Estimates schedule of delivery for own work effort and provides input into work plans, status reports and issues. * Consults with supervisor, business analysts, other engineers, and end users to gather information about program intent, functions, features, data requirements, input and output requirements, internal and external checks and controls, hardware and operating system environment and interfaces with other systems. * Designs or writes program specifications based on consultations with supervisor, systems analysts, other programmers and end users. * Converts designs and specifications into high quality, reliable and resilient computer code. * Analyzes code to find causes of errors and revises programs. * Demonstrates pre-production version of the program to users for feedback. * Provides system documentation and unit testing results. * Writes and maintains documentation of changes to computer code, programs, and specifications. * Designs and codes layout for onscreen user interfaces, printed outputs and interfaces with other systems. * Reviews user and technical documentation written by others to confirm consistency with program operations. * Provides technical assistance by responding to inquiries regarding errors, problems or questions with programs. * Revises program for corrections, enhancements or system environment changes. * Trains end users or technical support staff to use and support programs. * Coordinates with other programmers about program revisions. * Modifies and maintains software programs written by others. * Supports day-to-day production application systems as directed. * Performs other tasks as assigned. Required Experience * Entity Framework Experience * MVC Experience * A minimum of five years in a professional development environment having participated in all facets of the application development life cycle. * Exposure to object-oriented analysis and design, n-tier Architecture, COM, UML and the Microsoft .NET Framework. * Experienced developing stored procedures and relational database programming. * Three years of experience modifying systems for enhanced accessibility. Interested candidates please send resume in Word format Please reference job code 223608 when responding to this ad.

item.title: Mortgage Servicing Quality Control Reviewer
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for analyzing and reviewing mortgage loan servicing processes to determine if the loan has been serviced to the standards established by FNMA, FHLMC, USDA, VA and FHA and the regulatory bodies. This is a senior level role that works under moderate guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Performs monthly delinquency reviews to ensure that the collection letters went out accordingly and that collection calls were made, that appropriate reporting to the credit agencies has taken place. 2. Perform quarterly reviews to include such things as complaints, escrow analysis, release of lien, appropriate payment of escrows, loans being transferred, loans boarded correctly, force placed insurance was done correctly, ARM adjustments, flood insurance review, etc 3. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 4. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • 5 or more years of related work experience in mortgage servicing • Verbal and written communications skills • Strong working relationships with internal and external customers • Ability to independently evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions • General knowledge of Mortgage products and processes • Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business • Knowledge of FiServ’s LoanServ product desired but not required Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): N/A We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Loan Officer*
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. Join us and work for a high performance culture that rewards and recognizes entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. We like to hire talented people and empower them. Our cultural pillars are People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun. Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and staff work under minimal supervision. This position has no direct reports. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Solicits residential mortgages through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 3. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 4. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Performs additional duties as required Job Requirements: • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • Attendance and punctuality required in accordance with Bank practices Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for managing the branch team activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to guidelines. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads the branch loan officers (LO) and other team members in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Builds new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Builds relationship and takes steps to enhance the CTM brand throughout the community. 4. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. If managing Remote Loan Officers, the following would also apply: 8. Requires that initial training of loan officer is done on-sight at the main branch office with processing team present (if applicable). Additional future training may be done through the use of technology and Retail Training team. 9. Schedules and maintain weekly conference calls between leader, processing team (if applicable) and the remote loan officer to ensure consistency in process for both inside and outside of the branch originations. Maintain a log of all discussions with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. 10. Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Funds a minimum of two (2) loans per month. 3. Maintain customer information by scanning into CTM’s loan origination system and then shredding, utilizing the CTM-provided shredder and/or shredding service. As a result, customer information will not be maintained at the personal residence of the loan officer. Act registration at the time of employment. item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for managing the branch team activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to guidelines. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads the branch loan officers (LO) and other team members in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Builds new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Builds relationship and takes steps to enhance the CTM brand throughout the community. 4. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. If managing Remote Loan Officers, the following would also apply: 8. Requires that initial training of loan officer is done on-sight at the main branch office with processing team present (if applicable). Additional future training may be done through the use of technology and Retail Training team. 9. Schedules and maintain weekly conference calls between leader, processing team (if applicable) and the remote loan officer to ensure consistency in process for both inside and outside of the branch originations. Maintain a log of all discussions with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. 10. Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage Business Data Analyst
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for sourcing data through various application systems working with business managers to create analytics to identify risks and opportunities to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of internal workflows. Assist business managers with creating reports and analysis to improve the risk management of the company. The level of work is considered lead level working under minimal supervision. This position is a subject matter expert that generally is not responsible for managing subordinates but is responsible for communicating with managers in all areas of the company, collaborating to gain access to data and tools necessary for performing business data analysis. Essential JOB DUTIES: 1. Identify the application systems, gather and organize data to use for preparing reports and analysis. Acquire and abstract primary or secondary data from existing internal or external data sources. 2. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets 3. Prepare risk analytics that work as key risk indicators assisting business managers in risk identification and management. 4. Provide leadership in analyst discussions/meetings to encourage the analysts in other teams to create and improve their risk analysis reports 5. Write code for database access and modifications including stored procedures. 6. In collaboration with others, interpret data and develop recommendations based upon findings 7. Develop graphs, reports, dashboards and presentations of project results with the ability to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner. 8. Generate routine and ad hoc reports 9. Performs additional duties as required Job Requirements: • College degree – concentration in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, or Computer Science • Technical expertise regarding data models and database design utilizing SQL query and web tools • Knowledge of statistics • Proficient in Excel and Access • Experience in data mining techniques • Strong analytical skills with an ability to gather data from various sources concerning the appraisal process and build key performance/risk indicators that help monitor and identify risks in the process/operations • Financial services industry experience preferred • Excellent customer service skills and verbal and written communication skills. • 5 or more years of related work experience We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage Servicing Quality Control Reviewer
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for analyzing and reviewing mortgage loan servicing processes to determine if the loan has been serviced to the standards established by FNMA, FHLMC, USDA, VA and FHA and the regulatory bodies. This is a senior level role that works under moderate guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Performs monthly delinquency reviews to ensure that the collection letters went out accordingly and that collection calls were made, that appropriate reporting to the credit agencies has taken place. 2. Perform quarterly reviews to include such things as complaints, escrow analysis, release of lien, appropriate payment of escrows, loans being transferred, loans boarded correctly, force placed insurance was done correctly, ARM adjustments, flood insurance review, etc 3. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 4. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • 5 or more years of related work experience in mortgage servicing • Verbal and written communications skills • Strong working relationships with internal and external customers • Ability to independently evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions • General knowledge of Mortgage products and processes • Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business • Knowledge of FiServ’s LoanServ product desired but not required Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): N/A We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.
