item.title: Mortgage Servicing Business Controls Analyst
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Participate in a complex group that oversees operational risk by monitoring and reviewing all mortgage servicing operations. Responsible for assisting in the implementation of appropriate business controls, procedures, and processes to ensure appropriate testing, improvements, and ongoing adherence to company, federal, and state requirements. Work effectively with internal servicing functional departments, Compliance, Legal and other teams to understand and implement changes to comply with developments in laws and regulations Essential Job Duties: 1. Recommend and assist with creating testing programs and protocols that ensure compliance with regulatory agencies, investors and bank policy/requirements/guidelines. 2. Complete scheduled testing of departmental functions, evaluating compliance with written procedures. 3. Validate stated control activities identified within departmental procedures are completed as stated with evidence retained. 4. Review departmental procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory, investor, and bank policy/requirements/guidelines. 5. Work with the individual business departments to update procedures and processes as necessary based on review. 6. Review regulatory, investor, and bank announcements and provide a summary to affected departments within the servicing operation. Follow up when necessary to ensure procedural updates have occurred and implemented. 7. Update Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) to ensure Business Controls and the associated risk(s) are effectively managed through data and information. 8. Work closely with and relate well to all levels of team members. 9. Perform additional responsibilities as necessary and requested. Job Requirements: • Bachelors degree or equivalent work experience. • Minimum of 3 years mortgage experience, preferably within mortgage servicing. • Ability to facilitate communication with internal teams and departments. • Analytical, detailed and results oriented with excellent organizational skills. • Excellent verbal and written communication skills We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for managing the branch team activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to guidelines. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads the branch loan officers (LO) and other team members in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Builds new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Builds relationship and takes steps to enhance the CTM brand throughout the community. 4. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. If managing Remote Loan Officers, the following would also apply: 8. Requires that initial training of loan officer is done on-sight at the main branch office with processing team present (if applicable). Additional future training may be done through the use of technology and Retail Training team. 9. Schedules and maintain weekly conference calls between leader, processing team (if applicable) and the remote loan officer to ensure consistency in process for both inside and outside of the branch originations. Maintain a log of all discussions with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. 10. Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Branch Sales Manager
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development in the mortgage industry? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends with Cole Taylor Mortgage. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural values? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. In addition, works on mortgage business development initiatives for the Branch through recruiting mortgage loan officers and development of marketing plans. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Funds a minimum of two (2) mortgage loans per month. 3. Solicits residential mortgages through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 4. Grows the branch through development of marketing initiatives for all loan officers. Develops mortgage loan officers through training in selling techniques, marketing ideas, lead generation and closing mortgages. 5. Recruits mortgage loan officers for the branch. 6. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a mortgage loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 7. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential mortgages and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with mortgage applicants. 8. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 9. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 10. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • Bachelors degree or equivalent work experience • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred. Mortgage industry experience highly preferred. • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self-motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers. We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Processor I*
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for obtaining, processing and reviewing all required loan documentation needed for loan approval which includes all applicable income, asset, property information, federal and state disclosures, etc. Facilitates order of all third party services including but not limited to appraisal, title, flood, etc. May originate loans in addition to functions of processor according to the duties listed for a loan officer This is an associate level role that works under moderate guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Processes and/or originates mortgage loan applications and reviews all documentation necessary for loan approval for accuracy and completeness, and enters all data in the Mortgage Loan Origination System. 2. Places third party vendor orders for all appraisal, title and other loan specific requirements pertaining to federal and state guidelines. 3. Ensures the adequacy and accuracy of all consumer loan documentation necessary for loan approval and closing. 4. Assists in responding to questions from consumers throughout the loan process and facilitates scheduling of loan closing. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position • 0 to 2 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Customer service skills and verbal and written communications skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business • Enthusiastic, self-motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Loan Officer*
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and staff work under minimal supervision. This position has no direct reports. If you have 3+ years of experience in mortgage origination, please read on and apply. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Solicits residential mortgages through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 3. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 4. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Performs additional duties as required Job Requirements: • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • Attendance and punctuality required in accordance with Bank practices Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. MB Financial Bank is seeking experienced Mortgage Branch Managers with the ability to either build or bring a successful team of originators to our mortgage division. If you have 5+ years of experience in mortgage origination, please read on and apply. Job Summary: Responsible for managing branch staff activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to Corporate and Division guidelines. The level of work is considered management and staff work under limited supervision. This position has direct reports. Essential Job Duties: 1. Manages the branch staff in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Solicits new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 4. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 5. Performs additional duties as required. Job Requirements: • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership and management skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers. We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage Servicing Document Release Processor II
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Processes documents for release on all paid-out loan files for Mortgage loans. Quotes payoffs for Mortgage loans. Provides superior customer service to both internal and external customers. This is an associate level role that works under moderate guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Handles payoff quoting, faxing, mailing, and retention for all loan types, on all servicing systems. 2. Disburses recording checks for Mortgage loans and mails them to the County Recorder. 3. Mails escrow refunds. 4. Supports external and internal customers in a timely manner. Demonstrates excellent customer service skills both in person and phone. Answers phone within 3 rings and returns calls or responds to request and/or questions within 24 hour turn around. 5. Maintains customer confidence and protects operations by following the Privacy Policy and keeping information confidential. 6. Complies with CTM procedures and follows regulatory, operational, and security guidelines. 7. Pulls legal files when release is returned from Recorder and mails release to borrower with appropriate letter. 8. Stays current with industry knowledge and regulations by completing training sessions as scheduled. 9. Becomes familiar with and/or cross-trains in different aspects of fellow team members’ duties. 10. Completes payoff CITs and emails. 11. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 12. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required. • Minimum of 1 year data entry/office experience or training required, Mortgage banking/Real Estate background and/or familiarity with legal documents preferred. • Ability to communicate verbally and in writing, provide superior customer service, and work well with others is required. • Demonstrated ability to work independently under time constraints on multiple tasks and be detail oriented. • Ability to adapt to changing situations and have strong organizational skills is required. • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage Business Systems Analyst
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: The Requirements Analyst is a non-technical position responsible significant portions of the design, functionality, documentation and implementation of functionality for core IT systems supporting mortgage operations. He or she will work with the users, stakeholders and customers to gather specifications and requirements for IT system design and development, and produce detailed specifications, mock-ups, wireframes, and UI design proposals. The level of work is considered professional in nature and staff work under limited supervision. This position has no direct reports. Essential Job Duties: 1. Analyze business requirements from business operations and customers for UI impact and rapidly iterate through UI design proposals to meet these requirements. 2. Develop high level and/or detailed storyboards, mockups, use case scenarios, and task flows to effectively communicate design ideas and interactions based on product and business requirements. 3. Work with management and developers to implement approved designs. 4. Write clear, concise, thorough, detailed UI requirements. 5. Work with development team to manage implementation of proposals from requirements sign-off through Development & QA cycles to production. 6. Advocate usability standards and customer experience in all areas. 7. Work with cross functional teams to conduct usability testing and inspections. 8. Assist in development of techniques to conduct user centered research: focus groups, observations, and interviews. 9. Assist in development of aesthetic standards for all applications. 10. Work directly with customers to define requirements, test completed products, perform user acceptance testing (UAT), and coordinate beta program for designated projects. 11. Responsible for testing on all assigned projects to ensure that finished product meets all of the requirements outlined during design phase. 12. Prepare documentation for internal programs, includes creating training programs and documentation to be used to launch new product or feature across organization. 13. Prepare documentation for external customers, includes quick reference guides, user / help documentation, training programs, etc. 14. Performs other job-related duties as may be required. Job Requirements: • 2-5 years of professional experience in requirements analysis. • 2-5 years of professional experience in the mortgage industry preferred. • 2-5 years of professional experience writing user stories and use cases. • Very strong written and verbal communication skills. • Ability to rapidly conceptualize new designs impacting multiple platforms. • Writing detailed user interface design specifications. • Creating user interface design prototypes from storyboards to interactive prototypes • Understanding of current Web trends, browsers, and Web usability best practices. • Desire to significantly and positively impact a rapidly growing, forward thinking business. Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): N/A

item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for managing the branch team activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to guidelines. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads the branch loan officers (LO) and other team members in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Builds new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Builds relationship and takes steps to enhance the CTM brand throughout the community. 4. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. If managing Remote Loan Officers, the following would also apply: 8. Requires that initial training of loan officer is done on-sight at the main branch office with processing team present (if applicable). Additional future training may be done through the use of technology and Retail Training team. 9. Schedules and maintain weekly conference calls between leader, processing team (if applicable) and the remote loan officer to ensure consistency in process for both inside and outside of the branch originations. Maintain a log of all discussions with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. 10. Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Loan Officer
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. Join us and work for a high performance culture that rewards and recognizes entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. We like to hire talented people and empower them. Our cultural pillars are People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun. Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and staff work under minimal supervision. This position has no direct reports. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Solicits residential mortgages through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 3. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 4. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Performs additional duties as required Job Requirements: • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • Attendance and punctuality required in accordance with Bank practices Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and you will work independently and with minimal guidance. This position has no formal leadership responsibility. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Funds a minimum of two (2) loans per month. 3. Builds residential mortgage business by working through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 4. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 5. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 6. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 7. Meets with customers in locations other than the personal residence of the loan officer. 8. Acts as a role model and professionally represents Cole Taylor Mortgage at work and in the community; takes action to establish and build our brand. 9. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 10. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. For Remote Loan Officers, the following also applies: 11. Maintain customer information by scanning into CTM’s loan origination system and then shredding, utilizing the CTM-provided shredder and/or shredding service. As a result, customer information will not be maintained at the personal residence of the loan officer. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • This position requires S.A.F.E. item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. Job Summary: Responsible for managing the branch team activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to guidelines. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads the branch loan officers (LO) and other team members in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Builds new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Builds relationship and takes steps to enhance the CTM brand throughout the community. 4. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. If managing Remote Loan Officers, the following would also apply: 8. Requires that initial training of loan officer is done on-sight at the main branch office with processing team present (if applicable). Additional future training may be done through the use of technology and Retail Training team. 9. Schedules and maintain weekly conference calls between leader, processing team (if applicable) and the remote loan officer to ensure consistency in process for both inside and outside of the branch originations. Maintain a log of all discussions with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. 10. Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. Job Summary: Responsible for analyzing and reviewing mortgage loan servicing processes to determine if the loan has been serviced to the standards established by FNMA, FHLMC, USDA, VA and FHA and the regulatory bodies. This is a senior level role that works under moderate guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Performs monthly delinquency reviews to ensure that the collection letters went out accordingly and that collection calls were made, that appropriate reporting to the credit agencies has taken place. 2. Perform quarterly reviews to include such things as complaints, escrow analysis, release of lien, appropriate payment of escrows, loans being transferred, loans boarded correctly, force placed insurance was done correctly, ARM adjustments, flood insurance review, etc 3. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 4. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • 5 or more years of related work experience in mortgage servicing • Verbal and written communications skills • Strong working relationships with internal and external customers • Ability to independently evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions • General knowledge of Mortgage products and processes • Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business • Knowledge of FiServ’s LoanServ product desired but not required Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): N/A We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Loan Officer
item.description: Details: Chicagoland Loan Officers wanted to move to the next level of success! In August 2014, Cole Taylor Mortgage, along with its parent Cole Taylor Bank, merged with MB Financial Bank N.A. The merger resulted in an incredible opportunity for the Mortgage group to partner with MB’s 90 banking centers in the Chicagoland area and generate mortgage leads from a pool of existing customers. If you are interested in becoming a loan officer within a vibrant and growing organization, have some self-sourced business, and have a desire to significantly increase your monthly loan closings, apply now! Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and staff work under minimal supervision. This position has no direct reports. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Solicits residential mortgages through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 3. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 4. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Performs additional duties as required Job Requirements: • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • Attendance and punctuality required in accordance with Bank practices Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. Job Summary: Responsible for various document processing tasks within mortgage operations unit. Tasks to include but not limited to: third party order processing, scanning and filing electronic images into document management system, electronic loan file review for required documentation, data entry, letter notification processing, re-verification of employment and asset information. This is an associate level role that works under direct guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Reviews incoming orders for accuracy prior to placing order with third party vendor. Communicates order status to requestor and handles all follow up until order is received. 2. Verifies all completed orders are uploaded into Mortgage Loan Origination System triggering notification to the loan officer and processor involved in the loan transaction. 3. Scans, uploads and files electronic images of new file submissions into document management system. 4. Prepares Mortgage Loan Servicing letters for outgoing mail. 5. Performs pre-closing check for required closing documentation. 6. Performs various duties throughout Post Closing Team to include but not limited to: scanning and filing closed loan packages, trailing document tracking, insurance mail processing, file room management. 7. Manages re-verification of employment and asset information for QC review. 8. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 9. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • 1 to 3 years of related work experience • Customer service skills and verbal and written communication skills • Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and you will work independently and with minimal guidance. This position has no formal leadership responsibility. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Funds a minimum of two (2) loans per month. 3. Builds residential mortgage business by working through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 4. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 5. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 6. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 7. Meets with customers in locations other than the personal residence of the loan officer. 8. Acts as a role model and professionally represents Cole Taylor Mortgage at work and in the community; takes action to establish and build our brand. 9. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 10. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. For Remote Loan Officers, the following also applies: 11. Maintain customer information by scanning into CTM’s loan origination system and then shredding, utilizing the CTM-provided shredder and/or shredding service. As a result, customer information will not be maintained at the personal residence of the loan officer. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. item.title: Mortgage Underwriter I
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for analyzing and rendering credit dispositions on mortgage loan applications consistent with internal policies and investors guidelines as established by FNMA, FHLMC and FHA. This is an intermediate role that works under moderate guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1 Performs pre-closing analysis on borrower’s employment profile, credit strength, financial documentation and all other information pertinent to the credit decision on each mortgage application. 2 Submits loan applications to AUS and validate findings to ensure internal and investor guidelines (FNMA, FHLMC and FHA) are met. 3 Analyzes collateral appraisals to determine value is supported. 4 Reviews documentation for compliance with internal and regulatory guidelines. 5 Ensures all third party resources are reviewed to validate critical risk components of the mortgage credit file. Reviews AVM, IRS tax transcripts and any other third party resource utilized to validate accuracy of data in the mortgage credit file. 6 Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our MB culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7 Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • 2 to 5 years of related work experience in underwriting residential mortgage loans • Maintains government underwriting designation, if applicable • Customer service skills and verbal and written communications skills • Strong working relationships with internal and external customers • Ability to independently evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions • Proven analytical and organizational skills and demonstrated ability to prioritize and multi-task • General knowledge of mortgage products and processes • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • Attendance and punctuality required in accordance with Bank practices We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Loan Officer
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and you will work independently and with minimal guidance. This position has no formal leadership responsibility. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Funds a minimum of two (2) loans per month. 3. Builds residential mortgage business by working through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 4. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 5. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 6. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 7. Meets with customers in locations other than the personal residence of the loan officer. 8. Acts as a role model and professionally represents Cole Taylor Mortgage at work and in the community; takes action to establish and build our brand. 9. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 10. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. For Remote Loan Officers, the following also applies: 11. Maintain customer information by scanning into CTM’s loan origination system and then shredding, utilizing the CTM-provided shredder and/or shredding service. As a result, customer information will not be maintained at the personal residence of the loan officer. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage DPA Program Specialist
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Manage and approve down payment assistance (DPA) programs for MB Financial. Analyze specific down payment assistance programs to determine organizational viability. The DPA Program Specialist provides support throughout the organization regarding approved down payment assistance programs including underwriting, closing, client services, etc. This position requires overall mortgage knowledge, as well as understanding of underwriting and closing. Works within guidelines set by MB Financial, Private Investors, FNMA, FHLMC, FHA, VA and USDA. This is an intermediate role that works under minimal guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Researches Down Payment Assistance program product parameters and guidelines. 2. Serves as single point of contact for all DPA questions and supports any team members involved with these loans. 3. Develops and maintains tracking mechanism for DPAs. 4. Coordinates communication on changes or updates related to MB Financial approved DPA programs. 5. Ensures products comply with MB Financial products, policies, procedures and standards. 6. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork and Fun) on a daily basis. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of mortgage industry experience • Strong knowledge of mortgage lending products • Strong customer service, organization, verbal and written communication skills • Ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently and self-prioritize workload to meet deadlines • General knowledge of bank mortgage products and processes • Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business • Strong working relationships with internal and external customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for managing the branch team activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to guidelines. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads the branch loan officers (LO) and other team members in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Builds new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Builds relationship and takes steps to enhance the CTM brand throughout the community. 4. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. If managing Remote Loan Officers, the following would also apply: 8. Requires that initial training of loan officer is done on-sight at the main branch office with processing team present (if applicable). Additional future training may be done through the use of technology and Retail Training team. 9. Schedules and maintain weekly conference calls between leader, processing team (if applicable) and the remote loan officer to ensure consistency in process for both inside and outside of the branch originations. Maintain a log of all discussions with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. 10. Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage Processor Assistant
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for various document processing tasks within mortgage operations unit. Tasks to include but not limited to: third party order processing, scanning and filing electronic images into document management system, electronic loan file review for required documentation, data entry, letter notification processing, re-verification of employment and asset information. This is an associate level role that works under direct guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Reviews incoming orders for accuracy prior to placing order with third party vendor. Communicates order status to requestor and handles all follow up until order is received. 2. Verifies all completed orders are uploaded into Mortgage Loan Origination System triggering notification to the loan officer and processor involved in the loan transaction. 3. Scans, uploads and files electronic images of new file submissions into document management system. 4. Prepares Mortgage Loan Servicing letters for outgoing mail. 5. Performs pre-closing check for required closing documentation. 6. Performs various duties throughout Post Closing Team to include but not limited to: scanning and filing closed loan packages, trailing document tracking, insurance mail processing, file room management. 7. Manages re-verification of employment and asset information for QC review. 8. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 9. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • 1 to 3 years of related work experience • Customer service skills and verbal and written communication skills • Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage HR Specialist
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Coordinates the culture, engagement and other human resource activities for the mortgage division. This role has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Coordinates culture and engagement functions, especially those in the mortgage group. 2. Works in coordination with MB HR, Wilmington (and other mortgage locations) and the MB Rosemont and Ann Arbor culture Teams. 3. Assists with internal and external communications that relate to human resources, for the mortgage division human resources team. 4. Maintains the schedule and timelines for team member culture events, team building, contests, and recognition including budget tracking. 5. Assists with the monthly WOW Award presentation by preparing the award, communications, weekly trivia and award winner luncheons. 6. Assists with the Annual Service awards and MB Excellence award by preparing the award and coordinating award activities. 7. Coordinates human resources and leadership training registrations including agenda, meals, materials, room and equipment needs, etc. 8. Assists with special HR projects such as open enrollment, recruiting, performance reviews, policy writing, audits, etc. 9. Helps administer human resources policies and procedures in accordance with policies as written in the Team Member Handbook. 10. Performs HR data reporting for standard HR reports. Manages the processes to perform these reporting duties on the frequency required and with a high degree of confidentiality. 11. Provides the highest level of customer service to leaders and team members. 12. Promotes our culture by living-out the MB values and cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 13. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required with a focus on Human Resources. • 1 to 2 years of related work experience. HR internship preferred. • Listening and verbal communication skills. • Ability to effectively manage multiple projects with overlapping tasks and work independently with minimal guidance. . • Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment. • Detail oriented with excellent organization skills. Experience with event planning and/or engagement and culture initiatives preferred. • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software used in support of the business. • Flexible, innovative in a fast paced, growth-oriented and time-critical environment. • Knowledge of recruitment and selection techniques. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Ability to travel to remote locations on occasion We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.
