item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for managing the branch team activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to guidelines. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads the branch loan officers (LO) and other team members in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Builds new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Builds relationship and takes steps to enhance the CTM brand throughout the community. 4. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. If managing Remote Loan Officers, the following would also apply: 8. Requires that initial training of loan officer is done on-sight at the main branch office with processing team present (if applicable). Additional future training may be done through the use of technology and Retail Training team. 9. Schedules and maintain weekly conference calls between leader, processing team (if applicable) and the remote loan officer to ensure consistency in process for both inside and outside of the branch originations. Maintain a log of all discussions with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. 10. Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and you will work independently and with minimal guidance. This position has no formal leadership responsibility. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Funds a minimum of two (2) loans per month. 3. Builds residential mortgage business by working through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 4. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 5. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 10. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Maintain customer information by scanning into CTM’s loan origination system and then shredding, utilizing the CTM-provided shredder and/or shredding service. As a result, customer information will not be maintained at the personal residence of the loan officer. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • This position requires S.A.F.E. item.title: Mortgage Servicing Customer Care Specialist*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Are you looking to take a serious step towards a rewarding career in customer service? Have you been looking for a company that rewards the person who goes above and beyond the call of duty? Does having a leader who is truly committed to your development as a professional sound appealing? Look no further than MB Financial Bank. -Wages starting at $14.43/hr -401(k) with match, bonuses, profit sharing, health, life, disability -Formal training -Casual dress code Currently, we have second shift opportunities available (10-7) and may have future first shift opportunities. Job Summary: As a Customer Care Representative for MB Financial Bank you will manage customer-initiated requests relating to loan servicing. These requests may be managed through phone, correspondence or other means and may involve coordination with our business partners to achieve full resolution. The Customer Care Representative will be expected to manage multiple functions so that the result is a positive experience for the customer and overall satisfaction with the MB brand. Additionally, routing, maintaining and tracking outstanding service requests will be required to ensure all customer initiated requests receive complete, accurate and timely solutions. This position will entail both inbound and outbound contact with the customer. The level of work is considered associate level and staff work under immediate supervision. This position has no direct reports. Essential JOB DUTIES: 1. Answer incoming inquiries and acts as liaison between the customer and the subservicer. 2. Processes requests received via email and regular mail. 3. Facilitate new loan submission and communication with sub-servicer on daily basis. 4. Perform additional duties as required. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or equivalent • 1+ years of customer service experience • 1+ years of financial industry or mortgage experience • Ability to diffuse stressful situations with customers and create a positive customer experience • Excellent verbal and written communication skills • General knowledge of Bank products and processes • Ability to adapt quickly to change • Proven ability to meet and exceed productivity and quality monitoring goals • Excellent PC skills • Ability to independently evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions in a fast-paced environment • Attendance and punctuality required in accordance with Bank practices We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage Area Manager
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. Job Summary: Responsible for sourcing, on-boarding, training and managing wholesale and retail branches. The majority of the work is conducted away from and outside of corporate offices. The level of work is considered senior level and staff work under general supervision. This position has no direct reports. Essential Job Duties: 1. Builds quality customer relationships. Sources and maintains highly active wholesale accounts and retail branch offices within residential geographical area. Trains accounts on all aspects of doing business with MB Financial Bank. Creates a regular schedule of account visits and communication to continually reinforce the company’s differentiators and leverage them for quality volume. 2. Works in concert with operations partners. Gains a complete understanding of the file flow process. Knows the people and roles involved in each step and establishes rapport with them. Continually updates operations partners with the wants and needs of customers in the evolving marketplace. 3. Manages the business pipelines. Maintains continuous knowledge of files in process and overall volume standing. Communicates as needed to brokers and affiliates. Consistently prospects for new accounts and new business within current accounts. 4. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 5. Performs additional duties as required Job Requirements: • Bachelors Degree or equivalent work experience • Minimum 5 years of experience in the mortgage and banking industries, including strong knowledge of wholesale sales. Requires significant experience in third party origination (TPO) lending, market knowledge and relationships with top tier accounts in their respective territories. • Demonstrated ability to work within established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Processor I
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for obtaining, processing and reviewing all required loan documentation needed for loan approval which includes all applicable income, asset, property information, federal and state disclosures, etc. Facilitates order of all third party services including but not limited to appraisal, title, flood, etc. May originate loans in addition to functions of processor according to the duties listed for a loan officer This is an associate level role that works under moderate guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Processes and/or originates mortgage loan applications and reviews all documentation necessary for loan approval for accuracy and completeness, and enters all data in the Mortgage Loan Origination System. 2. Places third party vendor orders for all appraisal, title and other loan specific requirements pertaining to federal and state guidelines. 3. Ensures the adequacy and accuracy of all consumer loan documentation necessary for loan approval and closing. 4. Assists in responding to questions from consumers throughout the loan process and facilitates scheduling of loan closing. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position • 0 to 2 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Customer service skills and verbal and written communications skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business • Enthusiastic, self-motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

Meets with customers in locations other than the personal residence of the loan officer. 8. Acts as a role model and professionally represents Cole Taylor Mortgage at work and in the community; takes action to establish and build our brand. 9. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 10. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. For Remote Loan Officers, the following also applies: 11. Maintain customer information by scanning into CTM’s loan origination system and then shredding, utilizing the CTM-provided shredder and/or shredding service. As a result, customer information will not be maintained at the personal residence of the loan officer. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Truck Driver CDL A/Touch Freight - $1k Sign On Bonus
item.description: Details: Description Position Summary: Penske Logistics is looking for qualified CDL A truck drivers to become part of an excellent team. This is a great opportunity to continue your career with one of the nation’s largest logistics companies. This is a touch Freight position $1000 Sign On Bonus Route/Activity – Drivers are responsible for delivering product to customers Complete vendor backhauls as directed. Unloading tires. Shift – Primarily Monday-Friday, 2-3 nights out per week, home on weekends. Equipment – 48’ & 53’ Dry Vans Compensation – Hourly & Activity Based Benefits - Penske values the well-being of our employees and their families. That’s why we offer competitive wages and a wide range of benefits, including medical and dental insurance, 401K and pension plans, flexible dependent care and medical spending accounts, spouse and child life insurance, employee referral bonus, and discounts with Penske partners. Responsibilities: -Loading, unloading, or assisting in loading and unloading truck. -Maintain driver logs according to I.C.C regulations. -Compliance with safety & DOT Regulations, continuous training and customer service. -Ensuring compliance with applicable federal and/or state laws, regulations, and/or agency rules, standards and guidelines. -Report vehicle defects, accidents, traffic violations, or damage to the vehicles before and after route. Qualifications -At least 23 years of age required -2 years of verifiable tractor-trailer driving experience in the last 5 years required -2 years DMV/MVR record with 2 or less moving violations -High School Diploma or equivalent required -Driving school and or safety certifications preferred -Dealing with people skills, reliable and customer oriented, and ability to work independently required -Ability to work in non-climate controlled environments required -Willingness to travel as necessary, work the required schedule, work at the specific location required, complete Penske employment application, submit to a background investigation (to include past employment, education, and criminal history) and drug screening -The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The associate must regularly lift and /or move up to 25lbs/12kg, frequently lift and/or move up to 50lbs/23kg and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100lbs/45kg. Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision, Distance vision, Peripheral vision, Depth perception and Ability to adjust focus. While performing the duties of this Job, the associate is regularly required to stand; walk; sit and talk or hear. The associate is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. Headquartered in Reading, Pa., Penske Logistics is a wholly owned subsidiary of Penske Truck Leasing. With operations in North America, South America, Europe and Asia, Penske Logistics provides supply chain management and logistics services to leading companies throughout the world. Penske Logistics delivers value through design, planning and execution in transportation, warehousing, international freight forwarding and carrier management. Visit www.PenskeLogistics.com to learn more. Penske is an Equal Opportunity Employer

item.title: Retail Branch Operations Manager
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Acts as team lead and main point of escalation for the centralized processing group. Responsible for the supervision and time management of all centralized processors. Responsible for managing incoming processing requests from remote branches and distributing workload appropriately across the entire processing team. Ensures consistent processing procedures across entire team and consistent service levels to all branches using this service. Also performs loan processing transactions and is responsible for obtaining, processing and reviewing all required loan documentation needed for loan approval which includes all applicable income, asset, property information, federal and state disclosures, etc. Facilitates order of all third party services including but not limited to appraisal, title, flood, etc. This is a lead level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads Centralized Processing group including time management, workload balancing, maintaining consistency in process and service levels, and main point of contact for internal and external escalations. 2. Processes mortgage loan applications, reviews all documentation necessary for loan approval for accuracy and completeness, and enters all data in the Mortgage Loan Origination System. 3. Places third party vendor orders for all appraisal, title, and other loan specific requirements pertaining to federal and state guidelines. 4. Ensures the adequacy and accuracy of all consumer loan documentation necessary for loan approval and closing. 5. Assists in responding to questions from consumers throughout the loan process and facilitates scheduling of loan closing. 6. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position • 5+ years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Customer service skills and verbal and written communications skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for managing the branch team activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to guidelines. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads the branch loan officers (LO) and other team members in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Builds new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Builds relationship and takes steps to enhance the CTM brand throughout the community. 4. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. If managing Remote Loan Officers, the following would also apply: 8. Requires that initial training of loan officer is done on-sight at the main branch office with processing team present (if applicable). Additional future training may be done through the use of technology and Retail Training team. 9. Schedules and maintain weekly conference calls between leader, processing team (if applicable) and the remote loan officer to ensure consistency in process for both inside and outside of the branch originations. Maintain a log of all discussions with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. 10. Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Loan Officer*
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. Join us and work for a high performance culture that rewards and recognizes entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. We like to hire talented people and empower them. Our cultural pillars are People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun. Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and staff work under minimal supervision. This position has no direct reports. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Solicits residential mortgages through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 3. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 4. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Performs additional duties as required Job Requirements: • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • Attendance and punctuality required in accordance with Bank practices Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage Senior Fair Lending Data Specialist
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: At MB Financial Bank, we’re committed to fairness and we’re investing in it. Our fair lending team is growing and the opportunity to contribute is enormous! The leader of the team, a former Fair Lending Economist for the Chicago Federal Reserve with a University of Chicago PhD, is looking to teach his craft. We’re looking for a technically-skilled problem-solver with a work ethic. Someone who can bring clarity to complex problems, then share them in a thorough report or a time-crunched powerpoint. Have you spent a few years in the financial services industry and you’re ready to charge forward with your career? You’re a litigation consultant and SAS whiz looking for a change of pace? Don’t hesitate. Apply now! Essential Job Duties: 1. Designs and completes statistical analyses to monitor risk for pricing, redlining, underwriting, and other areas in compliance with the Bank’s Fair Lending Policy and Fair Lending Laws and regulations. 2. Develops and employs methods for validating analyses. 3. Authors written reports to communicate findings to internal and external stakeholders. 4. Maintains documentation for analyses to facilitate internal and external reviews. Assists in the ongoing development of documentation standards. 5. Presents progress updates and issue summaries to SVP Fair Lending Program Manager and other bank staff to clarify issues and gain guidance and input. 6. Exercises and develops problem solving skills in a complex technical, business, and regulatory environment. 7. Works with other teams to obtain data and periodically participates on well-defined projects. Projects may include working collaboratively with other data analysts within the organization. 8. Completes required online training and attends webinars and teleconferences on regulatory changes. 9. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (Integrity, High Performance, Customer Focus, Mutual Respect, Open Communication and Enthusiasm) on a daily basis. 10. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent. • Two years of experience in applied data analysis and/or statistics preferably in SAS, SPSS, R, or CRA/Fair Lending Wiz. • Demonstrated problem-solving ability and technical skill, excellence in written and oral communication, eagerness to learn, and a drive to get things right. • Ability to manipulate and analyze large databases. • Ability to self-manage and meet competing deadlines. • Knowledge of the mortgage loan origination process and related regulations, particularly Fair Lending regulations, is a plus. A fair lending background is not required to be considered for this position. • Ability to work cooperatively on a team and produce excellent work under time pressure. We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Loan Officer
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and you will work independently and with minimal guidance. This position has no formal leadership responsibility. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Funds a minimum of two (2) loans per month. 3. Builds residential mortgage business by working through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 4. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 5. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 6. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 7. Meets with customers in locations other than the personal residence of the loan officer. 8. Acts as a role model and professionally represents Cole Taylor Mortgage at work and in the community; takes action to establish and build our brand. 9. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 10. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. For Remote Loan Officers, the following also applies: 11. Maintain customer information by scanning into CTM’s loan origination system and then shredding, utilizing the CTM-provided shredder and/or shredding service. As a result, customer information will not be maintained at the personal residence of the loan officer. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for managing the branch team activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to guidelines. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads the branch loan officers (LO) and other team members in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Builds new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Builds relationship and takes steps to enhance the CTM brand throughout the community. 4. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. If managing Remote Loan Officers, the following would also apply: 8. Requires that initial training of loan officer is done on-sight at the main branch office with processing team present (if applicable). Additional future training may be done through the use of technology and Retail Training team. 9. Schedules and maintain weekly conference calls between leader, processing team (if applicable) and the remote loan officer to ensure consistency in process for both inside and outside of the branch originations. Maintain a log of all discussions with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. 10. Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage Underwriter I
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for analyzing and rendering credit dispositions on mortgage loan applications consistent with internal policies and investors guidelines as established by FNMA, FHLMC and FHA. This is an intermediate role that works under moderate guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1 Performs pre-closing analysis on borrower’s employment profile, credit strength, financial documentation and all other information pertinent to the credit decision on each mortgage application. 2 Submits loan applications to AUS and validate findings to ensure internal and investor guidelines (FNMA, FHLMC and FHA) are met. 3 Analyzes collateral appraisals to determine value is supported. 4 Reviews documentation for compliance with internal and regulatory guidelines. 5 Ensures all third party resources are reviewed to validate critical risk components of the mortgage credit file. Reviews AVM, IRS tax transcripts and any other third party resource utilized to validate accuracy of data in the mortgage credit file. 6 Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our MB culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7 Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • 2 to 5 years of related work experience in underwriting residential mortgage loans • Maintains government underwriting designation, if applicable • Customer service skills and verbal and written communications skills • Strong working relationships with internal and external customers • Ability to independently evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions • Proven analytical and organizational skills and demonstrated ability to prioritize and multi-task • General knowledge of mortgage products and processes • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

If you have 3+ years of experience in mortgage origination, please read on and apply. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Solicits residential mortgages through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 3. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 4. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Performs additional duties as required Job Requirements: • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • Attendance and punctuality required in accordance with Bank practices Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

Job Summary: Responsible for preliminary review and set up of new loan file and underwriting condition submissions. Works within guidelines set by MB Financial Bank, investors, standard guidelines established by FNMA, FHLMC, FHA, VA and USDA. This is an associate level role that works under direct guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Performs cursory review of new file submissions and conditions. Prepares new file submissions for registration including uploaded document review and appropriate categorization. 2. Ensures accuracy and completeness of minimum required documentation and compliance disclosure. 3. Performs data entry, queue management and prioritization, as well as initial client communication of file submission deficiencies, errors and omissions. 4. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 5. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • 1 to 2 years of related work experience including data entry • Ability to maintain high level of attention to detail in data integrity and file quality • Experience working in a production environment including meeting or exceeding daily production quotas • Demonstrated proficiency in business software including Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Word, Excel) We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

Job Summary: Responsible for analyzing and rendering dispositions on mortgage loan credit applications. Works within guidelines set by the CTM, investors, standard guidelines established by FNMA, FHLMC and FHA. This is a senior level role that works under moderate guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Performs pre-closing credit analysis on loan documentation submitted for underwriting. Ensures all required documentation is present to validate AUS findings. Performs detailed analysis of property valuation and ensures all additional CTM and investor requirements are met on each loan transaction. Ensures all compliance guidelines and documentation requirements are met. 2. Ensures all third party resources are reviewed to validate critical risk components of the mortgage credit file. Reviews AVM, IRS tax transcripts and any other third party resource utilized to validate accuracy of data in the mortgage credit file. 3. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 4. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • 5 or more years of related work experience in underwriting residential mortgage loans • Maintains government underwriting designation, if applicable • Customer service skills and verbal and written communications skills • Strong working relationships with internal and external customers • Ability to independently evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions • General knowledge of mortgage products and processes • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. MB Financial Bank is seeking experienced Mortgage Branch Managers with the ability to either build or bring a successful team of originators to our mortgage division. Job Summary: Responsible for managing branch staff activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Essential Job Duties: 1. Manages the branch staff in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Job Summary: Responsible for preparation of documents related to a mortgage closing and the pre-funding review of documents executed at a mortgage loan closing. Performs pre-closing review of documentation needed to prepare closing package. Ensures all required closing documentation is present prior to preparing documents. Performs validation of loan data prior to preparing closing documents. Ensures Reg Z requirements and high cost filters are met. 2. Prepares loan closing package utilizing appropriate software. Ensures accuracy of all prepared closing documents. 3. Performs pre-funding review of required documents. Works with settlement agent on review of select closing documents executed at closing table. Reviews required settlement documents for accuracy. Issues funding authorization number after review of pre-funding documentation. 4. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 5. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • 5 to 7 years of related work experience, preparing mortgage closing documents • Customer service skills and verbal and written communication skills • Strong working relationships with internal and external customers • Ability to independently evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions • General knowledge of Mortgage products and processes • Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. item.title: Mortgage Technical Writer and Content Manager
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for the development and execution of editorial projects for internal and external audiences. Will work collaboratively with management throughout the Mortgage division to develop, document, and maintain written processes, procedures, manuals, and other related content across the business. Documentation may variously take the form of procedures manuals, product manuals, and internal and/or external communications. Role will facilitate adoption and usage of appropriate Content Management solution for distribution and management across multiple platforms, databases, and applications. This is a specialist role that works under minimal guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1 Works with a wide range of stakeholders, including operations management, retail management, Legal, IT, etc., to understand, clarify, create, and update document contents. 2 Prepares written text, and designs/coordinates the layout and organization of manuals and other documents/media. 3 Develops policy and procedure documents with leaders, utilizing their expert knowledge to create a clear, comprehensive, and yet comprehensible products for others. 4 Designs content assets to maximize reuse and minimize effort to manage the content. 5 Utilizes effective project management tools, including planning, scheduling, researching, and following-up, while using sound judgment to allow flexibility and change where appropriate. 6 Researches, designs, proposes, and implements IT solutions as appropriate. 7 Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 8 Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (e.g., computer science) or in English, Professional Writing, or other language-related field, or equivalent work experience • 5+ years of relevant work experience in technical writing and/or content management • Strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills • Project management skills • Experience writing technical documentation • Very strong MS Office skills, especially MS Word • A plus if candidate has knowledge of: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SharePoint, SQL We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for managing the branch team activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to guidelines. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads the branch loan officers (LO) and other team members in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Builds new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Builds relationship and takes steps to enhance the CTM brand throughout the community. 4. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. If managing Remote Loan Officers, the following would also apply: 8. Requires that initial training of loan officer is done on-sight at the main branch office with processing team present (if applicable). Additional future training may be done through the use of technology and Retail Training team. 9. Schedules and maintain weekly conference calls between leader, processing team (if applicable) and the remote loan officer to ensure consistency in process for both inside and outside of the branch originations. Maintain a log of all discussions with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. 10. Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

The level of work is considered senior-level and you will work independently and with minimal guidance. This position has no formal leadership responsibility. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Funds a minimum of two (2) loans per month. 3. Builds residential mortgage business by working through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 4. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 5. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 6. Meets with customers in locations other than the personal residence of the loan officer. 8. Acts as a role model and professionally represents Cole Taylor Mortgage at work and in the community; takes action to establish and build our brand. 9. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 10. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. For Remote Loan Officers, the following also applies: 11. Maintain customer information by scanning into CTM’s loan origination system and then shredding, utilizing the CTM-provided shredder and/or shredding service. As a result, customer information will not be maintained at the personal residence of the loan officer. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • This position requires S.A.F.E. Data /document review and verification 5. Letter / mail processing 6. Data entry 7. Document file room management 8. Train other team members on various tasks 9. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 10. item.title: Mortgage Servicing Loan Boarding Processor I
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Proficient in handling all tasks pertaining to the auditing of Residential Mortgage loans, to ensure adherence to all government guidelines and the ability to accurately determine (and limit or avoid) repercussions or any future cost to Cole Taylor Mortgage. This is an associate level role that works under regular guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Possesses a complete understanding of all servicing area procedures and policies for loan auditing using Loan Complete. 2. Uses Loan Complete to audit pre-defined aspects of a Cole Taylor Mortgage originated loan. 3. Communicates professionally with internal contacts to resolve outstanding issues and to ensure accurate loan set up. 4. Learns new technology and utilizes Internet sites to complete all team tasks. 5. Utilizes and updates various software packages daily. 6. Provides superior customer service and upholds customer satisfaction to internal customers by answering questions and requests and providing information in a timely manner. 7. Maintains customer confidentiality and protects operations by following the Privacy Policy. 8. Complies with bank procedures and follows regulatory, operational, and security guidelines. 9. Becomes familiar with and/or cross trains in different aspects of fellow team members’ duties for support when there is an absence. 10. Completes training sessions as scheduled to remain current on industry procedures, knowledge, and regulations. 11. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 12. Performs additional responsibilities as needed Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required. • Minimum of 1 year industry related experience and strong knowledge of consumer mortgage documents required. • Must be able to change priorities quickly and maintain high level of performance within specified time constraints. • Demonstrated abilities in organization, accuracy, and thoroughness required. • Ability to communicate with all types of individuals, provide superior customer service and work well with others is required. • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for managing the branch team activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to guidelines. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads the branch loan officers (LO) and other team members in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Builds new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Builds relationship and takes steps to enhance the CTM brand throughout the community. 4. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. If managing Remote Loan Officers, the following would also apply: 8. Requires that initial training of loan officer is done on-sight at the main branch office with processing team present (if applicable). Additional future training may be done through the use of technology and Retail Training team. 9. Schedules and maintain weekly conference calls between leader, processing team (if applicable) and the remote loan officer to ensure consistency in process for both inside and outside of the branch originations. Maintain a log of all discussions with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. 10. Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Loan Officer
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and you will work independently and with minimal guidance. This position has no formal leadership responsibility. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Funds a minimum of two (2) loans per month. 3. Builds residential mortgage business by working through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 4. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 5. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 6. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 7. Meets with customers in locations other than the personal residence of the loan officer. 8. Acts as a role model and professionally represents Cole Taylor Mortgage at work and in the community; takes action to establish and build our brand. 9. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 10. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. For Remote Loan Officers, the following also applies: 11. Maintain customer information by scanning into CTM’s loan origination system and then shredding, utilizing the CTM-provided shredder and/or shredding service. As a result, customer information will not be maintained at the personal residence of the loan officer. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.
