item.title: Mortgage Servicing Customer Care Supervisor
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Leads, monitors, and controls the daily activities involving all aspects of mortgage and consumer loan customer service. This position strives to communicate effectively and efficiently with mortgagors and lenders, insurance agents, taxing authorities, vendors, credit reporting agencies, investors, title company representatives, legal representatives, and MB Financial Bank employees. The level of work is considered managerial, and staff work under minimal supervision. This position has direct reports. Essential JOB DUTIES: 1 Oversees daily operations of Customer Service Department functions, to ensure superior customer service is provided to each customer. 2 Assists in researching, resolving, and responding to difficult customer inquiries. 3 Develops and implements training for new hires and existing staff members. 4 Maintains the department procedure and policy manuals. 5 Maintains an acceptable call abandonment rate. 6 Communicates with all areas of MB Financial Bank to resolve customer inquiries in a detailed, timely manner 7 Provides statistical data on department to managers as scheduled. 8 Maintains customer satisfaction and confidence by representing MB Financial Bank in a positive manner, maintaining confidentiality and MB Financial Bank's integrity. 9 Mentors/develops staff by providing regular feedback on performance, providing opportunities for development, writing performance development reviews, conducting call monitoring, and handling employee disciplinary issues in a professional, objective, and impartial manner. 10 Ensures operational and staffing levels are adequate to meet departmental needs by conducting interviews and hiring staff, complying with federal, state, and local employment laws. 11 Supports and promotes MB Financial Bank’s commitment to equal employment opportunity and harassment free workplace, as set forth in the Employee Handbook. 12 Maintains regular attendance and punctuality. 13 Developments and implements department policies and procedures. 14 Performs additional duties as required Job Requirements: • Education equivalent to high school diploma required. • Excellent written/verbal communication skills required. • Excellent analytical, organizational and supervisory skills required. • Two year’s supervisory experience in a banking environment is required, three preferred or equivalent experience in customer service in a mortgage-banking environment. • One to two years escrow analysis experience required. • Call center experience preferred. • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • Attendance and punctuality required in accordance with Bank practices We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage Fair Lending Regulatory Analyst
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! At MB Financial Bank, we’re committed to fairness and we’re investing in it. Our fair lending team is growing and the opportunity to contribute is enormous! The leader of the team, a former Fair Lending Economist for the Chicago Federal Reserve with a University of Chicago PhD, is looking to teach his craft. We’re looking for a problem-solver with a work ethic. Someone who can bring clarity to complex problems, then share them in a meticulous report or a time-crunched PowerPoint. Have you spent a few years in the financial services industry and you’re ready to charge forward with your career? Maybe you’ve been a practicing attorney and have found that it’s just not for you. Is accounting your forte, but you want to forge a different path? No matter your background, this job could be your future. Don’t hesitate. Apply now! Job Summary: The incumbent will perform investigations, reviews, and analyses to support MB Mortgage’s compliance with fair lending regulations. They will communicate results and issues to various stakeholders in written reports and oral presentations. They will develop and maintain expertise in fair lending laws and regulations and their impact on the mortgage division, and keep the fair lending team and business lines appraised of changes in laws. They will assist in the development and performance of training and participate in risk assessments of MB’s Mortgage Division. 1. Performs regulatory analyses including (1) reviews, investigations, and assessments of processes, procedures and controls for business units and third parties and (2) tests of bank performance relative to regulatory standards and internal policies and procedures. 2. Communicates results and issues, both orally and in writing, to stakeholders and bank staff. 3. Participates in the completion of risk assessments including reviewing policies and procedures, interviewing business unit and third-party personnel, and documenting and testing of internal controls. 4. Develops and maintains expertise in current fair lending laws, regulations and trends, and their impact on the mortgage division. Educates team members and business units in response to fair lending enforcement actions, regulatory guidance, and industry fair lending litigation. 5. Collaborates with SVP Fair Lending Program Manager to assess fair lending and compliance training needs and develops and presents appropriate training programs and materials. 6. Maintains fair lending program documentation including fair lending policies and procedures. 7. Completes required online training and attends webinars and teleconferences on regulatory changes. 8. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (Integrity, High Performance, Customer Focus, Mutual Respect, Open Communication and Enthusiasm) 9. Performs additional responsibilities as needed Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent. • One or more years in fair lending compliance or related is preferred but not required. • Experience as a lawyer or paralegal is helpful. • Innate curiosity and motivation to learn. • Proven problem solving skills. • Ability to work cooperatively on a team and produce excellent work under time pressure We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Loan Officer
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and you will work independently and with minimal guidance. This position has no formal leadership responsibility. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Funds a minimum of two (2) loans per month. 3. Builds residential mortgage business by working through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 4. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 5. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 6. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 7. Meets with customers in locations other than the personal residence of the loan officer. 8. Acts as a role model and professionally represents Cole Taylor Mortgage at work and in the community; takes action to establish and build our brand. 9. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 10. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. For Remote Loan Officers, the following also applies: 11. Maintain customer information by scanning into CTM’s loan origination system and then shredding, utilizing the CTM-provided shredder and/or shredding service. As a result, customer information will not be maintained at the personal residence of the loan officer. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Processor II
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for obtaining, processing and reviewing all required loan documentation needed for loan approval which includes all applicable income, asset, property information, federal and state disclosures, etc. Facilitates order of all third party services including but not limited to appraisal, title, flood, etc. May originate loans in addition to functions of processor according to the duties listed for a loan officer This is an associate level role that works under moderate guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Processes and/or originates mortgage loan applications and reviews all documentation necessary for loan approval for accuracy and completeness, and enters all data in the Mortgage Loan Origination System. 2. Places third party vendor orders for appraisals, titles and other loan specific requirements pertaining to federal and state guidelines. 3. Ensures the adequacy and accuracy of all consumer loan documentation necessary for loan approval and closing. 4. Assists in responding to questions from consumers throughout the loan process and facilitates scheduling of loan closing. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position • 2 to 3 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Customer service skills and verbal and written communications skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business • Enthusiastic, self-motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis. Working Conditions And Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage Underwriter II - VA Specialist
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Responsible for analyzing and rendering dispositions on mortgage loan credit applications. Works within guidelines set by the CTM, investors, standard guidelines established by FNMA, FHLMC, FHA and VA. This is a senior level role that works under moderate guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1. Performs pre-closing credit analysis on loan documentation submitted for underwriting. Ensures all required documentation is present to validate AUS findings. Performs detailed analysis of property valuation and ensures all additional CTM and investor requirements are met on each loan transaction. Ensures all compliance guidelines and documentation requirements are met. 2. Ensures all third party resources are reviewed to validate critical risk components of the mortgage credit file. Reviews AVM, IRS tax transcripts and any other third party resource utilized to validate accuracy of data in the mortgage credit file. 3. Will be responsible for underwriting VA loans. 4. Promotes our culture by living-out the cultural pillars (People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun) on a daily basis. 5. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • Must have VA designation • 5 or more years of related work experience in underwriting residential mortgage loans • Prefer Underwriter to have VA experience (LAPP and SAR certifications) • Prefer underwriter to have DE CHUMS • Customer service skills and verbal and written communications skills • Strong working relationships with internal and external customers • Ability to independently evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions • General knowledge of mortgage products and processes • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Retail Mortgage VP Branch Manager*
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for managing the branch team activities in originating, processing and closing of residential mortgages. Markets branch to obtain new business relationships and referrals. Controls budget according to guidelines. This is a senior level role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads the branch loan officers (LO) and other team members in all aspects of the loan origination process from origination to closing. 2. Builds new business through contacts with realtors, builders and customer referrals within the branch’s geographical area. 3. Builds relationship and takes steps to enhance the CTM brand throughout the community. 4. Establishes and controls branch budget and production and income goals within the company’s guidelines. 5. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 6. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. If managing Remote Loan Officers, the following would also apply: 8. Requires that initial training of loan officer is done on-sight at the main branch office with processing team present (if applicable). Additional future training may be done through the use of technology and Retail Training team. 9. Schedules and maintain weekly conference calls between leader, processing team (if applicable) and the remote loan officer to ensure consistency in process for both inside and outside of the branch originations. Maintain a log of all discussions with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. 10. Participates in face to face meetings with remote loan officer at home or branch office no less than once per quarter. If remote LO resides in a CTM satellite office, leader is required to visit the remote space no less than once per quarter. Maintain a log of all face to face meetings with remote loan officer including date, time and nature of meeting. During visits, branch leader must ensure that loan documentation and customer information is not stored at the loan officers home office and the LO has a working shred bin and is utilizing it. 11. Creates a weekly reporting system to monitor origination activity (applications taken, source of applications, etc.) 12. Reviews and have regular discussions to ensure the remote loan officer is having customer meetings outside of the remote loan officer’s home. 13. Ensures remote loan officer is equipped with the proper and secure technology to be able to work from home and outside of the home. 14. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 15. Ensures remote loan officer has CTM issued shred bin for document destruction either their home or CTM satellite office. Ensure remote LO record retention is done 100% paperless via CTM image flow / document image system. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 5 to 7 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Demonstrated people leadership skills • Verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills • Excellent business development skills • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage VP Registration Manager
item.description: Details: Join us and work for a high performance culture that rewards and recognizes entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. We like to hire talented people and empower them. Our cultural pillars are People, Integrity, Partnership, Teamwork, and Fun. Job Summary: Managing in a team oriented environment responsible for reviewing forms, disclosures, and other documents to validate information and ensure compliance with applicable RESPA and loan registration requirements. Duties include compiling and analyzing information, reporting results, isolating areas for improvement, creating action plans and working cross functionally with leaders to continuously improve compliance with laws and regulations. Work with members of the Compliance team to understand and implement changes to comply with changes in laws and regulations. This is a professional role that works under limited guidance and has formal leadership responsibility for a team. Essential Job Duties: 1. Leads Operations Compliance and Loan Registration team leaders & team members responsible for loan level registration and compliance ( RESPA). 2. Analyzes the results of the Operations compliance team’s testing & report results to stakeholders. 3. Determines root cause and supports corrective action on monitoring exceptions. 4. Participates in business change initiatives to ensure that compliance risks are assessed, mitigated, and escalated when appropriate. 5. Coordinates with the MB Compliance team and Operations on policies and procedures related to compliance and forms organization. 6. Communicates operational risk requirements and trains affected team members on relevant operational risk topics 7. Seeks opportunities to utilize and enhance automated tools & work flow solutions to create a scalable model to support Mortgage Operations . 8. Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our MB culture and role models within cultural pillars . 9. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience, Master’s preferred. • 5 plus years experience with wholesale and retail mortgage business, preferable in underwriting or credit background • Five or more years of regulatory compliance exposure with regulated financial institutions; or equivalent work history involving significant regulatory/ compliance risk related issues • Thorough knowledge of CTM compliance requirements • Ability to lead multiple deliverables and priorities simultaneously • Relationship leadership skills and ability to interface confidently with team members of all levels • Excellent oral and written communication skills • Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment • Detail oriented and highly organized • Ability to apply regulatory requirements to business processes and new initiatives • Effective analytical skills with ability to identify issues and opportunities to mitigate and minimize risk Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required.

item.title: Retail Mortgage Loan Officer
item.description: Details: Effective August 18, 2014, Cole Taylor Bank, and its mortgage division Cole Taylor Mortgage, merged into MB Financial Bank, N.A. Nothing else about this employment opportunity has changed as a result of the merger. People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Responsible for originating conventional and government residential mortgage loans to customers who qualify based on assessment of financial and credit data. The level of work is considered senior-level and you will work independently and with minimal guidance. This position has no formal leadership responsibility. Essential Job Duties: 1. Originates conventional and government residential mortgages and participates in related business development activities. 2. Funds a minimum of two (2) loans per month. 3. Builds residential mortgage business by working through contacts with realtors, builders and developers. 4. Provides service to customers and prospective customers seeking residential mortgage loans. Interviews applicants to obtain information concerning their needs to assist in determining whether a loan will be an acceptable risk according to their financial situation and obtains pertinent financial and credit data. 5. Ensures the preparation and processing of forms and legal documents required for residential loans and follows the loans to ensure compliance with terms. Negotiates terms and conditions with applicants. 6. Stays informed on trends and developments in the local real estate market, as well as changing rules and regulations pertaining to both conventional and government-insured mortgages. 7. Meets with customers in locations other than the personal residence of the loan officer. 8. Acts as a role model and professionally represents Cole Taylor Mortgage at work and in the community; takes action to establish and build our brand. 9. Supports, enhances and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 10. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. For Remote Loan Officers, the following also applies: 11. Maintain customer information by scanning into CTM’s loan origination system and then shredding, utilizing the CTM-provided shredder and/or shredding service. As a result, customer information will not be maintained at the personal residence of the loan officer. Job Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience • 3 to 5 years of related work experience • Financial services industry experience preferred • Demonstrated ability to exceed established sales goals • Enthusiastic, self motivated with ability to interpret and analyze customers’ needs on a continual basis • Excellent business development skills • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business. • This position requires S.A.F.E. Act registration at the time of employment. The Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) web site (mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org) provides the MU4R questions and registration required for employment in this position. Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. As a part of the MB Financial hiring process all applicants will be required to submit to, and pass, a pre-employment urine drug screening.

item.title: Mortgage IT Service Desk Assistant
item.description: Details: People | Integrity | Partnership | Teamwork | Fun! Have you been seeking intense professional growth and development? Looking for a place that is not only willing to hear your ideas, but craves them? The search ends here. We have a culture that rewards and recognizes an entrepreneurial spirit, thought leadership and innovative solutions to “every day” issues. It’s simple. We hire talented people and empower them. Plus, what other company lists fun as one of its cultural pillars? Make the best decision in your career and join our team! Job Summary: Provides support to end users on a variety of issues as the first line of contact for Information Technology related issues. Responds to telephone calls, email and personnel requests for technical support. Provides some 1st line resolution at a basic capacity, collects information on the specifics, and then escalates tickets to the proper 2nd level groups for more complex resolution or fulfillment. The level of work is considered senior and staff work under moderate supervision. This position has no direct reports and acts as an individual contributor and in a team with work that involves knowledge and understanding of some key business and technical principles. Essential Job Duties: 1. Provides first level support for all telephone calls, emails and personal requests for technical support in a knowledgeable manner and accurately logs all requests into Help Desk software 2. Escalates Help Desk tickets to appropriate second and third level support groups in a timely manner 3. Tracks and monitors Help Desk tickets to ensure a timely resolution 4. Basic troubleshooting of operating systems, computer hardware, applications (software and peripherals, etc.) 5. Provides basic instruction to all users as necessary regarding the use of various pieces of equipment or company deployed software packages 6. Maintains on-line reports of call stats, system down, incidents, survey results and user administration statistics. 7. Communicate with support and user groups to ensure incident management procedures keep up with upgrades, new service offerings and projects. 8. Document and share information – ensure requirements, resolutions, escalation, lessons learned and other Knowledge Management activities are clear, documented and current. 9. Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • Demonstrated proficiency in a customer service environment • Strong verbal and written communication skills • Organizational skills with attention to detail, consistency and follow through • Superior interpersonal skills with the ability to work with end users, teammates, and leadership • A self-driven eagerness to constantly learn new technologies and improve processes • Excellent time management, organizational, documentation and problem-solving skills • Ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently and self-prioritize workload to meet deadlines as an individual and in a team environment • Microsoft products knowledge (Windows OS, Exchange, IE, Word, Excel, Access, Outlook) • Preferred: 1 to 2 years of experience in Help Desk Support and/or Client Services in Banking and/or Financial Services • Preferred: experience with Sharepoint, Mobile Device Support, ITIL concepts We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. This is an intermediate role that works under moderate guidance and has no formal leadership responsibility for a team at this time. Essential Job Duties: 1 Performs pre-closing analysis on borrower’s employment profile, credit strength, financial documentation and all other information pertinent to the credit decision on each mortgage application. 2 Submits loan applications to AUS and validate findings to ensure internal and investor guidelines (FNMA, FHLMC and FHA) are met. 3 Analyzes collateral appraisals to determine value is supported. 4 Reviews documentation for compliance with internal and regulatory guidelines. 5 Ensures all third party resources are reviewed to validate critical risk components of the mortgage credit file. Reviews AVM, IRS tax transcripts and any other third party resource utilized to validate accuracy of data in the mortgage credit file. 6 Supports, enhances, and helps lead within our CTM culture and role models within cultural pillars. 7 Performs additional responsibilities as needed. Job Requirements: • High School Diploma or GED required • 2 to 5 years of related work experience in underwriting residential mortgage loans • Maintains government underwriting designation, if applicable • Customer service skills and verbal and written communications skills • Strong working relationships with internal and external customers • Ability to independently evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions • Proven analytical and organizational skills and demonstrated ability to prioritize and multi-task • General knowledge of mortgage products and processes • Knowledge of systems including Microsoft Office suite and proprietary software products used in support of the business Working Conditions and Demands (If Applicable): Valid and current driver’s license required for travel to meet with prospects and customers We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans. item.title: LEAD ENGINEER POSITION
item.description: Details: LEAD ENGINEER POSITION - Full-time position - Louisville, KY The Lead Engineer should have a strong Mechanical Engineering Background. Candidate should have exposure to Product Development experience, problem solving and creativity. Design knowledge in Mechanical Design would be preferred. Need to have 5+ years in Mechanical Engineering in a Manufacturing Environment. Need 3+ years of experience in managing cross-functional teams and product development teams. Need experience with problem solving situations that include Methodologies in 5y, 8D and 7-step and GD&T and LEAN. Candidate for the role of Lead Engineer should be flexible enough to operate in a team environment with ability to multi-task. Must be able to lead a project team through DFMEA. They are looking for someone that can convert the voice of the customer to product development specs. Compensation for the role of Lead Engineer will range from $70,000 to $80,000 to start.

item.title: VENDING (Machine) MANAGER
item.description: Details: Job Summary: Plans, coordinates, controls and supervises the vending operation at an assigned activity. Responsible for the maximum utilization of services provided by vending machines that are Exchange owned or contracted. Duties and Responsibilities: Personally directs or through subordinate supervisors, supervises the maintenance and repair of Exchange owned vending machine equipment and vehicles, scheduling of adequate supply of products and services, maintaining operating records and reports, security of products, cash and equipment. Ensures that all machines, both Exchange owned and contracted, are maintained in accordance with sanitation regulations and properly filled and serviced. Responsible for achieving the NEXCOM departmental net contribution goal. - Works under the general direction and supervision of the Exchange General Manager (GM) r who outlines policies, procedures and objectives. Operates independently, within established policies, procedures and regulations. Refers unusual or complex problems to supervisor with recommendation for solution. Work is reviewed in terms of objectives met and efficiency in meeting operating goals. - Is directly responsible and accountable for the performance and mission effectiveness of assigned departments, as well as compliance with all operating procedures. Assesses the overall efficiency and integrity of assigned functions with particular emphasis on high risk areas that may be susceptible to loss such as inventory shrink, shoplifting, refund fraud, paperwork error, associate theft and receiving and open purchase order (OPO) errors. Ensures that all directives, policies and regulations relative to the management of cost control and loss prevention initiatives are adhered to, and actively works to create an environment intolerant of internal and external theft, paperwork error and inventory shrink. - Plans, coordinates and supervises all facets of the Exchange owned and/or contracted vending machine operation. - Reviews and analyzes vending machine reports and the preparation of vending machine operating summaries. Identifies machines operating below established goals, requiring excessive repairs, excessive out-of-order periods and similar matters. Investigates deficiencies and initiates corrective actions. Relocates, replaces or phases out machines. - Inspects Exchange owned and/or contract operated vending machines for operational condition, appearance, merchandising and products. Reports all cases of vandalism and machine jackpots and assists in the investigation of such incidents, as directed by higher authority. Initiates corrective action and conducts follow up to ensure compliance. Prepares appropriate vending inspection report. - Responsible for the preparation of appropriate reports on Exchange owned and contract vending machines, contractor(s) cash receipts, accounts and cash records and operational data. Establishes internal control procedures, safeguards and releases cash intakes. - Prepares budget forecasts, including anticipated sales and expenses. Determines payroll expenses to sales, spoilage, shrinkage, expense supplies and other factors and determines areas for improvement. - Responsible for inventory control, warehouse storage, records maintenance, equipment repair, servicing, maintenance and installation of machines at activity and locations. Resolves customer complaints and initiates action to avoid recurrence. - Responsible for initiating requisitions for vending machines. Provides COR support to obtain supplies and spare parts from authorized vendors. Supervises and is accountable for the receipt, storage, stock control, stock rotation, issue and transfer of vending merchandise and supplies. Within authorized limits, effects write-offs of items for consumption/sale. - Responsible for vending equipment repairs, vehicle maintenance and installation and preventive maintenance program. Directs the activities of assigned mechanics to ensure scheduled preventive maintenance and emergency repairs are accomplished in a timely and economical manner. Provides specifications to the Contracting Officer for the requisitioning and consumption of spare parts. - Prepares input to the Contracting Officer in the event that contractor is in non-compliance with contract terms. Initiates proper termination actions when authorized by the Contracting Officer. - Maintains current knowledge of the vending industry including operational procedures, industry trends, equipment, products and legislation; makes recommendations for improvement in equipment and types of product lines to be carried. - Supervises personnel through subordinate supervisory staff. Approves leave and vacation schedules; enforces work rules, establishes internal operating policies and procedures and initiates programs or projects to serve mission needs. Develops safe working conditions and practices and assures adherence to same. Interviews and selects personnel, completes performance appraisals, reviews proposed disciplinary actions, resolves grievances and complaints and otherwise develops a cohesive work force. - Performs other related duties as assigned.

Responds and resolve customer service issues via telephone, fax and email.

item.title: Motorclothes Sales Consultant - Chicago Harley Davidson
item.description: Details: ChicagoHarley-Davidson is looking for MotorClothes Sales Consultant ready for theopportunity to work in a customer-oriented, friendly environment. Candidatesmust be self-driven, results-oriented, with a positive outlook, and a clearfocus on the highest level of customer service standards. Harley-Davidson andmotorcycle knowledge is a plus but not required. Are you a Harley-Davidson enthusiast who loves to help others enjoy the Harley-Davidsonexperience? This could be the job for you! Want to work for a growing company? Fuelthe passion for your lifestyle! Put your career in gear and apply today. Major Duties and Responsibilities: Provide a Remarkable Experience! Greet and serve every customer with a smile, courteously and promptly. Answer questions and assist in identifying and selecting MotorClothes fashion apparel and riding gear that customers might need or enjoy. Develop relationships with customers and determine their wants and needs. Actively solicit sales and suggest products that will fulfill the customer wants and needs. Suggestively selling of products that will fulfill the customers' wants and needs. Merchandising and maintaining the appearance and cleanliness of counters, displays, shelves, bins, and customer contact area by following good housekeeping procedures. Handle customer communication regarding returns and/or problems with orders, return authorizations and maintain related records. Cashiering and some data entry.

item.title: Administrative Specialist III
item.description: Details: One of the largest oilfield services companies, Weatherford operates in more than 100 countries and employs more than 70,000 people worldwide. With a product and service portfolio that spans the life cycle of a well- well construction, formation evaluation, completion and production- and a robust research and development effort, we are well positioned to meet the ever-evolving needs of the oil and gas industry. JOB SCOPE Perform administrative functions in accordance with policies determined by or in conjunction with management. Provide general administrative and clerical support including, but not limited to billing and accounts payable for the location. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES Schedules appointments, gives information to callers, takes dictation, composes and types correspondence, reads and routes incoming mail, and performs other administrative and clerical duties. May assist with billing process for location. May assist with account payable for location. May act as custodian for local documents and records. Prepares memorandums outlining and explaining administrative procedures and policies to supervisory workers. Relieves receptionist as required for breaks / lunch. Trains employees on administrative matters; addressing complaints and assist in resolving problems with Manager or Human Resources advice. Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level. Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job. SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS Good verbal communication skills. 3-4 years of general clerical and administrative experience. Knowledge of billing practices and controls. Prior billing or accounting experience helpful. Proficient typing skills. General computer knowledge. Must have basic reading, writing and math skills. Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedules form. Should be able to work and interact with all levels of personnel. SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS The physical ability to immediately respond to emergency situations

item.title: Funeral Clerk
item.description: Details: We are currently seeking a qualified and professional Clerk at one of our premier locations in Pompano Beach, FL. As a clerk you will coordinate, monitor and complete all necessary paperwork related to funerals or other dispositions of a deceased person from the time of receiving the first call through final disposition. Obtain preliminary information from client families when first notification is received and establish an appointment time for the arrangement conference Advise client families of any required disclosures relating to FTC Funeral Rule Compliance during the initial telephone conversation or any other city, state, or federal requirements (i.e., embalming authorization) Coordinate arrangement conference appointment times, available chapel hours for funeral or other services with Management team and/or Funeral Counselors Arrange for the release of deceased from hospitals or other institutions requiring next of kin signed authorization and arrange for having death certificate signed by the attending physician Complete death certificate and file with County Health Department, secure burial/transit permit and order specified number of certified copies of the death certificate for client family Complete all forms and secure flag for Veterans’ funerals Complete clergy record and issue all necessary checks for third-party vendors and persons (i.e., clergy, police escorts, etc.) Review and monitor arrangement files completed by Arrangements Counselor and confirm clergy or other officiates, cemetery notification, complete outer burial order, place obituaries/death notices with local media and ensure all FTC requirements have been properly satisfied File necessary reports with County Department of Health on a monthly basis and/or requirements mandated by local, state, or federal agencies Advise client families of additional services available to them (i.e., floral arrangements, burial garments, etc.)

item.title: Technical Business Unit Coordinator
item.description: Details: Key Areas of Activity Responsible for ensuring that customer expectations are being met. Support customer product development activity for Diecut products to ensure that Jabil is designed in. Participate in Early Supplier Involvement (ESI) meetings or design reviews. Coordinate prototyping or sampling activity. Communicate customer requirements to Diecut manufacturing sites. Coordinate NPI activity with the manufacturing site and ensure changes to plan are communicated. Develop strong relationships with critical raw materials suppliers. Key Responsibilities in detail Create and maintain a strong relationship with the Jabil BU and with the customer; Work with Jabil customer BU to understand customer new product activity and identify possible Diecut opportunities ; Attend customer ESI reviews, utilise Jabil Diecut Dfx guide to identify opportunities for design or cost improvement; Create and maintain strong relationships with critical raw materials suppliers. Ensure they are aware of Jabil capabilities and work with them to create a win-win in capturing new business; With the Technical Director and suppliers, identify materials options to meet customer application requirements at optimal cost and suggest to customer; Arrange and/or carry out materials testing as required to qualify materials options. Prepare all necessary technical reports and data as required by customer; Arrange prototype products as required. Ensure timely delivery to customer and provide any necessary reports. Capture feedback from customer on test results; Communicate customer requirements effectively to Diecut manufacturing sites and communicate project status to customer and Jabil BU. Ensure clear understanding and agreement of customer requirements with all parties; Participate in ongoing design reviews with customer to ensure that all project deliverables are being met. Capture and communicate any design or specification changes and communicate. Highlight any risks and take action to eliminate / mitigate; Ensure that any customer specific information or reporting requirements are met; Job Requirements Bachelor’s degree in appropriate technical discipline; 5 years manufacturing or technical experience; Experienced in communicating directly with customers; Good project management skills and experience; Excellent communication skills essential; Excellent English language skills; written and oral.

item.title: Nurse Tech (CNA/STNA)
item.description: Details: Purpose of Your Job Position As a Consulate Health Care Nurse Tech (CNA/STNA), the primary purpose of your job position is to provide each of your assigned residents with routine daily nursing care and services in accordance with the resident’s assessment and care plan, and as may be directed by your supervisors. Job Function As Nurse Tech (CNA/STNA ), you work under the direction of licensed personnel to provide quality resident care in accordance with applicable regulations. This position has no supervisor responsibilities. You may be asked by the supervisors or mangers to perform other duties. Duties and Responsibilities Report all complaints and grievances made by the resident. Participate in resident care assessments. Assist in development of resident treatment plans. Provide direct care in accordance with treatment plans. Accompany residents, as needed, to various activities and functions. Participate in restorative nursing program. Report occupational exposures to blood, body fluids, infectious materials, and hazardous chemicals to your supervisor. Report injuries of an unknown source, including skin tears. Turn all medications found in the resident’s room/possession over to the Clinical Nurse. Serve between meal and bedtime snacks. Attend and participate in scheduled training and educational classes to maintain current certification as a Nursing Technician. Participate in appropriate in-service training programs prior to performing tasks that involve potential exposure to blood/body fluids. Immediately notify the Clinical Nurse of any resident leaving/missing from the facility. Clean, disinfect, and return all resident care equipment to its designated storage area after each use. Report all hazardous conditions and equipment to the Clinical Nurse immediately. Report all safety violations. Follow established procedures in the use and disposal of personal protective equipment. Wear and/or use safety equipment and supplies (e.g., back brace, mechanical lifts, etc.) when lifting or moving residents. May be trained and assigned to perform the Customer Care Liaison duties as needed.

item.title: Payroll Administrator
item.description: Details: Aerotek is looking for a Payroll Administrator! Specifically someone who has experience with: - Handling the PAYROLL of large companies...not necessarily the HR or clerical duties within the company. - Using Ceridian, UltiPro, ADP and/or Cronos - Handling things like: Timecard data, earnings, deductions and other payments, processing off cycle checks and any other payroll-related activities - Working in a VERY FAST PACED setting and high volume setting for handling the payroll of a very large company. If this is something that sounds like work you have done before, please apply via email by sending me your most up-to-date resume! About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit aerotek.com .

item.title: Meeting Services Coordinator
item.description: Details: Purpose: Develops effective and efficient web and technology solutions and communication through the analysis, planning, and implementation of web products which support the business objectives of the Meeting Services Team Primary responsibilities to include: - Participate in web registration builds in Cvent software system - Tools used: Cvent Product, and design tools such as HTML, Excel, Word, Flash, and documentation tools. - Deliver approximately 30-60 event web sites per year Participate in app builds in Cvent/Crowd Compass software system - Audit registration reporting in Cvent for monthly billing purposes - Support Meeting Services’ expense reporting requirements to include timely completion of expense reports, providing required pricing and attendee detail, obtaining and maintaining required receipts and backup documentation - Facilitate breakdown of room expenses, food, A/V and other charges with hotel accounting offices - Work within SAP to create vendors, process invoices, and facilitate workflow - Identify process simplifications within expense reporting system - Manage unused airline tickets from group meetings, working with Travel to utilize – unused tickets or receive credit?? - Collect cost savings data for department and maintain in software system - Log total program spend for department in software system Secondary responsibilities to include: - Manage/schedule vendor and client visits per manager’s approval - Act as an information resource. Participate in special projects and ad hoc tasks as assigned - First point of contact for call in line with authority to handle small requests Skills and Experience Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required Web development experience required. HTML, Cvent & flash technology experience required Understanding of Group Travel processes preferred Proficient in Microsoft products (Word and Excel) required Professional oral & written communication skills required Minimum of 2 years hospitality or similar industry experience preferred Willingness to assist with reporting, data entry, and administrative responsibilities related to contracts, financial research, and other client requests related to SMM events

item.title: Customer Service Representative
item.description: Details: Now hiring for a Customer Service Representative on 2nd shift. Will be working approximately 3pm-11:30pm and will need to be flexible to work during the week and weekends. Position will be taking inbound calls as well as performing data entry. Preferred candidates will have at least 6months-1 year of prior Customer Service experience. About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit aerotek.com .

item.title: Tractor Trailer Driver - Haz & Tank Endorsed
item.description: Details: We are seeking a CDL A driver with experience hauling tankers. Must have hazmat and tanker endorsements Expect to spend two or three nights per week out of town Would occasionally be asked to pull a box van and make drum pick-ups Major Medical Dental Vision 401K Paid time off Holiday Pay

item.title: Psychiatric Rehabilitation Specialist
item.description: Details: Named after Dr. Warren E. Smith, a prominent African American psychiatrist who was committed to providing quality behavioral healthcare to the underserved. WES, founded in 1992 has experienced significant growth during the last five years and has created an organizational structure to meet the needs of current and future growth. WES Health System has an exciting opportunity available for a full-time Psychiatric Rehabilitation Specialist in Our Mission Is Yours Program. The work schedule is Monday to Friday from 7:45am to 4pm with Saturdays and evenings as needed. GENERAL OVERVIEW OF KEY ROLES &RESPONSIBILITIES: To provide Psychiatric Rehabilitation Services facility based and/or in the community as assigned. To provide groups/unit to enhance an individual’s knowledge to develop, enhance and retain skills and competencies in living, learning, working, and socializing. To help individuals receive the level of and/or have access to the services/supports they choose, so that an individual can live in the environment of their choice. To monitor and track progress of individual’s in assigned caseload; participate in the development of individualized rehabilitation plans. ESSENTIAL& CORE FUNCTIONS: Provides and facilitates individual’s skill development and support which includes daily living, socialization, educational/vocational supports and opportunities, and leisure/recreation activities planning including community integration and community connections. Maintains and monitors an assigned caseload of individual. Participates in the analysis and identification of service delivery gaps, changes and problems under the guidance of the supervisor. Consistently meets productivity expectations as set by administration, department and funding sources. Participates in the resolution of crisis situations; assist with identifying individuals and resources that can provide direct support and/or immediate intervention during a crisis situation. Completes and assists with required documentation; Develops, reviews, revises forms, procedures and standards of care according to accepted professional practice. Establishes and maintains liaisons with other service providers to promote program coordination and enhance individual services. Participates in relevant training to enhance professional growth, and development with an emphasis on psychiatric rehabilitation services and evidence based practices. May participate in program planning and development sessions as well as practice guidelines and standards. Serves as an advocate and encourages individuals to assume a proactive role in their rehabilitative process, including a mastery of skills. Attends staff and other meetings as they relate to the individuals and their overall growth and development. Assists with special projects, reports and program planning. May provide supplemental coverage and/or fill-in for other programmatic services as needed. Provides transitional employment support/coverage for individuals in various settings. Performs other duties and responsibilities as they relate to the overall enhancement of program service delivery. May require crisis intervention for emergency situations.

item.title: Parts Desk
item.description: Details: Parts Desk We are currently seeking the right individual to fill an immediate need for our Parts Desk at our west Fort Worth location. The ideal candidate will have experience in parts or components sales, inventory control, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and a high level commitment to exceptional customer service. Responsibilities: Understand product applications and operations Maintain an extensive knowledge of all products Process orders and coordinate deliveries Maintain Ideal inventory Levels Forecast, order, receive and stock inventory Assist Customers and technicians with parts orders Benefits: Excellent career opportunity Group health plan Paid vacation Paid holidays

item.title: Quality Assurance Inspector
item.description: Details: Job Statement : Performsin-process and final inspection on finished products for conformance tocustomer specifications and requirements. Verifies specified dimensions ofparts using appropriate measuring instruments. Ability to adhere to stringentstandard operating procedures and familiarity with cGMP and CFR 210 & 211 is a must. Job Responsibilities: Approves incoming materials confirmed to specification, conducts visual measurement testing, and rejects non-conforming materials. Approves in-process and final inspection as relates to folding cartons, plastic thermoformed parts and packaging services. Conducts visual and measurement testing. Documents inspection results including inputting results into a quality data base.

item.title: Project Supervisor - Legal
item.description: Details: We have an exciting opportunity for a temporary Project Supervisor, in Falls Church, VA . This position is projected to last for six months. Responsibilities Manages nationwide projects for the Executive Officer of the Office of the Chief Immigration Judge Reports on progress; documents the work performed; Troubleshoots issues; Performs quality control spot-checking as necessary to ensure that work is of high quality and meets BPA requirements; Coordinates with other federal and contractor support staff;

item.title: Payroll Specialist
item.description: Details: Our Client, a local Tax and Accounting firm is looking for a well-rounded candidate to fill their payroll position. Company offers a very comfortable team atmosphere, clientele that is a mix of very nice individuals and small businesses, and great accessible location. In this position, a concentration of payroll responsibilities along with some clerical accounting duties will keep this person busy year round. Position Responsibilities Payroll weekly and Bi weekly Data entry Client communication Light accounting / Journal Entries Assisting Accountants with Tax prep data entry into Creative Solutions Software

item.title: Financial Analyst
item.description: Details: Job Summary The Financial Analyst will be responsible for the financial reporting, analysis, and communication on key physician practice indicators. The Analyst will assist the Executive Director with reports and analysis of physician practice operations, including the evaluation of physician productivity, physician dashboards, utilization trends and other key operating indicators specific to the Medicare patient population. The Analyst will also participate in the month-end general ledger close process including financial reporting. Principal Job Duties and Responsibilities Provides financial and analytical services to Executive Director, as assigned. Prepare analytical schedules and dashboards required for administrative officers and department leaders on an accurate and timely basis. Develop and provide financial data as required for various task force presentations and committees. Develops and prepares physician scorecards Develops and prepares Daily Statistics Report Identifies utilization trends and opportunities for improvement. Establishes physician/practice benchmarks Responsible for data and reporting integrity. Prepares and uploads all CMS required reporting Prepares and validates reporting to and from vendors through secure FTP. Downloads and formats monthly CMS reports. Assist the Executive Director in preparing ad hoc reports. Financial Reporting. Assist the Executive Director in preparing month-end financial statements utilizing Quickbooks. Responsible for all accounts payable and payment generation. Works collaboratively with members of the executive committee in developing annual budgets. Provides monthly variance reports as needed. Broward Guardian is a Medicare Accountable Care Organization(ACO) operating in southern Broward County. It currently has a contract with CMS to participate in the Medicare Shared Savings Program (MSSP). Broward Guardian is a collaboration between Memorial Health System and community primary care providers in an effort to work together to develop a more efficient health care delivery model. Through this collaboration Broward Guardian will work to align the incentives of the providers and payers and towards achieving the 3 goals of health care reform: expanding access, improving quality and controlling cost. Broward Guardian is currently contracted with 75 Primary Care Providers.

item.title: Sourcing Manager
item.description: Details: HEICO is the parent holding company for a diversified portfolio of over 35 businesses involved in manufacturing, construction and industrial services. Since its founding over 30 years ago, the company has been built by aggressively reinvesting its earnings into both internal growth and new acquisitions. Heico currently operates over 35 businesses. The core operations are organized into four platforms: Ancra Group, Heico Metal Processing Group, Heico Construction Group, and Pettibone L.L.C We are seeking a talented Sourcing Manager for each of our locations in Superior, Wisconsin and Baraga, Michigan (2 separate positions). Relocation assistance is available ! This position leads global strategic procurement initiatives and the management of the full sourcing life cycle process for all direct spend in assigned categories of purchased material. The Sourcing Manager will develop and execute specific commodity/product category strategies and will manage the negotiation of global supply agreements. This position will work with internal and external stakeholders to identify solutions that support operational requirements while reducing the Total Cost of Ownership. Most important, this position will work with the New Product Development Group to provide the best solutions for product manufacturability, price points and quality. The Manager will identify, report and deliver cost savings and have accountability of procurement performance metrics. Accountabilities/Responsibilities Lead the implementation and execution of sourcing strategies for direct spend in assigned categories Develop global, strategic cross-functional teams and engage in enterprise-wide sourcing Evaluate supplier capacity and capabilities and seek new sources of technology to support business needs Track market trends in commodities and report on potential supply constraints. Lead the Sourcing Process, including supplier selection, identifying the 5 key elements in the selection process of price, quality, logistics, innovation and risk Lead sourcing efforts through collaboration with internal stakeholders (manufacturing, engineering, product line management, new product development, facilities management, etc.) to meet operational requirements while focusing on reducing TCO (total cost of ownership) and driving value focus Support all New Product Development sourcing activities as assigned. Drive procurement optimization initiatives, including supplier rationalization, lead time reduction, MOQ (minimum order quantities) and terms optimization, Make vs. Buy analysis, and supplier innovation development Proactively identify and recommend potential alternative sources of supply to support enterprise wide cost savings targets and mitigation of risk to support business continuity plans Apply policies and procedures to ensure that all sourcing activities comply with corporate and regulatory directives as well as ensure compliance with comprehensive contract management and sourcing processes Build and maintain relationships with internal stakeholders and ensure delivery in accordance with agreed-upon terms Collaborate and proactively communicate vendor selection decisions to impacted internal stakeholders Effectively communicate the decision requirements and results to management and employees as appropriate Monitor and resolve supplier dispute, delivery, performance or quality issues as last step Monitor and analyze vendor performance metrics Develop and track global procurement metrics including areas of spend analytics, benefits tracking, and supplier performance Continually seek ways to improve the overall sourcing process. Assist to continually implement incremental improvements across all locations Help monitor prices of major commodities and services from supplier, analyze impact based on annual use and report findings to organization Monitor effects of improvement processes Advance proficiency in performing audits, charting and the setting supply chain benchmarks All other duties as assigned. Skills/Experience Bachelor’s Degree preferred 7 years + of progressive supply chain experience in a global manufacturing environment with proven track record. Global sourcing experience of electro-mechanical or mechanical products Ability to travel 25% of the time including international travel twice per year APICS or ISM certification, membership in Supply Chain Council or American Purchasing Society highly desirable. Expertise in a broad range of procurement activities, including inventory and supply chain management, technical sourcing projects including those involving close interfacing with other functions such as engineering and quality, and leading-edge procurement practices Demonstrated ability to develop and implement robust, creative commodity sourcing strategies which yield measurable reductions in spend Ability to lead and influence change in the face of complexity, with strategic and innovative focus, as well as establish and participate in tactical process Ability to speak and present effectively to peers and Senior Management Strong stakeholder management skills Ability to leverage networks and relationships Capable of influencing and motivating others with new ideas and concepts Proficiency in reading technical drawings and specifications. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Strong contract management and negotiation skills Project management certification preferred Proven leadership skills of building and leading teams Proficiency in ERP systems and MS Office applications

Drive procurement optimization initiatives, including supplier rationalization, lead time reduction, MOQ (minimum order quantities) and terms optimization, Make vs. Buy analysis, and supplier innovation development Proactively identify and recommend potential alternative sources of supply to support enterprise wide cost savings targets and mitigation of risk to support business continuity plans Apply policies and procedures to ensure that all sourcing activities comply with corporate and regulatory directives as well as ensure compliance with comprehensive contract management and sourcing processes Build and maintain relationships with internal stakeholders and ensure delivery in accordance with agreed-upon terms Collaborate and proactively communicate vendor selection decisions to impacted internal stakeholders Effectively communicate the decision requirements and results to management and employees as appropriate Monitor and resolve supplier dispute, delivery, performance or quality issues as last step Monitor and analyze vendor performance metrics Develop and track global procurement metrics including areas of spend analytics, benefits tracking, and supplier performance Continually seek ways to improve the overall sourcing process. Assist to continually implement incremental improvements across all locations Help monitor prices of major commodities and services from supplier, analyze impact based on annual use and report findings to organization Monitor effects of improvement processes Advance proficiency in performing audits, charting and the setting supply chain benchmarks All other duties as assigned. Skills/Experience Bachelor’s Degree preferred 7 years + of progressive supply chain experience in a global manufacturing environment with proven track record. Global sourcing experience of electro-mechanical or mechanical products Ability to travel 25% of the time including international travel twice per year APICS or ISM certification, membership in Supply Chain Council or American Purchasing Society highly desirable. Expertise in a broad range of procurement activities, including inventory and supply chain management, technical sourcing projects including those involving close interfacing with other functions such as engineering and quality, and leading-edge procurement practices Demonstrated ability to develop and implement robust, creative commodity sourcing strategies which yield measurable reductions in spend Ability to lead and influence change in the face of complexity, with strategic and innovative focus, as well as establish and participate in tactical process Ability to speak and present effectively to peers and Senior Management Strong stakeholder management skills Ability to leverage networks and relationships Capable of influencing and motivating others with new ideas and concepts Proficiency in reading technical drawings and specifications. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Strong contract management and negotiation skills Project management certification preferred Proven leadership skills of building and leading teams Proficiency in ERP systems and MS Office applications

Expertise in a broad range of procurement activities, including inventory and supply chain management, technical sourcing projects including those involving close interfacing with other functions such as engineering and quality, and leading-edge procurement practices Demonstrated ability to develop and implement robust, creative commodity sourcing strategies which yield measurable reductions in spend Ability to lead and influence change in the face of complexity, with strategic and innovative focus, as well as establish and participate in tactical process Ability to speak and present effectively to peers and Senior Management Strong stakeholder management skills Ability to leverage networks and relationships Capable of influencing and motivating others with new ideas and concepts Proficiency in reading technical drawings and specifications. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Strong contract management and negotiation skills Project management certification preferred Proven leadership skills of building and leading teams Proficiency in ERP systems and MS Office applications

item.title: Sourcing Manager
item.description: Details: HEICO is the parent holding company for a diversified portfolio of over 35 businesses involved in manufacturing, construction and industrial services. Since its founding over 30 years ago, the company has been built by aggressively reinvesting its earnings into both internal growth and new acquisitions. Heico currently operates over 35 businesses. The core operations are organized into four platforms: Ancra Group, Heico Metal Processing Group, Heico Construction Group, and Pettibone L.L.C We are seeking a talented Sourcing Manager for each of our locations in Superior, Wisconsin and Baraga, Michigan (2 separate positions). Relocation assistance is available ! This position leads global strategic procurement initiatives and the management of the full sourcing life cycle process for all direct spend in assigned categories of purchased material. The Sourcing Manager will develop and execute specific commodity/product category strategies and will manage the negotiation of global supply agreements. This position will work with internal and external stakeholders to identify solutions that support operational requirements while reducing the Total Cost of Ownership. Most important, this position will work with the New Product Development Group to provide the best solutions for product manufacturability, price points and quality. The Manager will identify, report and deliver cost savings and have accountability of procurement performance metrics. Accountabilities/Responsibilities Lead the implementation and execution of sourcing strategies for direct spend in assigned categories Develop global, strategic cross-functional teams and engage in enterprise-wide sourcing Evaluate supplier capacity and capabilities and seek new sources of technology to support business needs Track market trends in commodities and report on potential supply constraints. Lead the Sourcing Process, including supplier selection, identifying the 5 key elements in the selection process of price, quality, logistics, innovation and risk Lead sourcing efforts through collaboration with internal stakeholders (manufacturing, engineering, product line management, new product development, facilities management, etc.) to meet operational requirements while focusing on reducing TCO (total cost of ownership) and driving value focus Support all New Product Development sourcing activities as assigned. Drive procurement optimization initiatives, including supplier rationalization, lead time reduction, MOQ (minimum order quantities) and terms optimization, Make vs. Buy analysis, and supplier innovation development Proactively identify and recommend potential alternative sources of supply to support enterprise wide cost savings targets and mitigation of risk to support business continuity plans Apply policies and procedures to ensure that all sourcing activities comply with corporate and regulatory directives as well as ensure compliance with comprehensive contract management and sourcing processes Build and maintain relationships with internal stakeholders and ensure delivery in accordance with agreed-upon terms Collaborate and proactively communicate vendor selection decisions to impacted internal stakeholders Effectively communicate the decision requirements and results to management and employees as appropriate Monitor and resolve supplier dispute, delivery, performance or quality issues as last step Monitor and analyze vendor performance metrics Develop and track global procurement metrics including areas of spend analytics, benefits tracking, and supplier performance Continually seek ways to improve the overall sourcing process. Assist to continually implement incremental improvements across all locations Help monitor prices of major commodities and services from supplier, analyze impact based on annual use and report findings to organization Monitor effects of improvement processes Advance proficiency in performing audits, charting and the setting supply chain benchmarks All other duties as assigned. Skills/Experience Bachelor’s Degree preferred 7 years + of progressive supply chain experience in a global manufacturing environment with proven track record. Global sourcing experience of electro-mechanical or mechanical products Ability to travel 25% of the time including international travel twice per year APICS or ISM certification, membership in Supply Chain Council or American Purchasing Society highly desirable. Expertise in a broad range of procurement activities, including inventory and supply chain management, technical sourcing projects including those involving close interfacing with other functions such as engineering and quality, and leading-edge procurement practices Demonstrated ability to develop and implement robust, creative commodity sourcing strategies which yield measurable reductions in spend Ability to lead and influence change in the face of complexity, with strategic and innovative focus, as well as establish and participate in tactical process Ability to speak and present effectively to peers and Senior Management Strong stakeholder management skills Ability to leverage networks and relationships Capable of influencing and motivating others with new ideas and concepts Proficiency in reading technical drawings and specifications. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Strong contract management and negotiation skills Project management certification preferred Proven leadership skills of building and leading teams Proficiency in ERP systems and MS Office applications
