item.title: CNC Machinist/Programmer
item.description: Details: Express Employment Professionals as partnered with a local manufacturer to recruit and secure a CNC Machinist and CNC Programmer. Duties Include: Operate CNC machines or machining centers as specified (i.e. – Cutting, drilling, milling, reaming, boring, tapping, turning, facing, threading of metallic and non-metallic work-pieces). Duties: Maintain a safe, clean, neat, accident-free, healthy work environment Notify Production Lead (or appropriate personnel) of any possible safety hazard Read and follow Work Instructions (and refer to them whenever necessary) Report immediately to Production Lead any malfunction, programming error, damaged machinery / tooling / equipment / product, or any other nonconformities Change cutting tools and setup according to required machining sequence or to measure parts for conformance to blueprint specifications Load and unload materials Inspect first run parts and check succeeding production for conformance to specifications During machine cycles, study job packets and organize area for next production run Accurate time keeping parts counts Inspect work output on an on-going basis Ability to safely run CNC equipment and produce acceptable product Understand the Company Quality Policy and the fundamentals of ISO 9000

item.title: Outside Sales Representative
item.description: Details: If you are an ambitious and entrepreneurial individual with a strong interest in sales, join the Champion Windows team! We are looking for a driven and capable Outside Sales Representative to sell our exclusive line of home improvement and remodeling products to potential customers. In your role as an Outside Sales Representative, you will meet with prospective customers in their homes and make sales presentations, with the goal of bringing a steady flow of orders into our factory on a daily basis. You will also occasionally work on the showroom floor and generate new business by talking with walk-in customers. This is a commission-only position, and since all commissions are uncapped this position is a great opportunity for you to control your own income. Job Responsibilities As an Outside Sales Representative, you will be provided with warm, pre-set, and pre-qualified appointments for sales meetings with prospective customers. The majority of your sales will be one-call closes, and your presentation style will focus on the customers’ specific needs. This will involve engaging in active listening, asking probing fact-finding questions, and establishing rapport and trust with customers. You must also always remember to maintain an entrepreneurial mindset and look for any opportunities to hand out business cards and generate referrals. Your specific duties as an Outside Sales Representative will include: Making professional consultative sales presentations and proposals to prospective customers via in-home, face-to-face sales calls Identifying positive features and advantages of our line of home improvement products, including return on investment Conferring with prospective customers to determine their individual exterior improvement needs Measuring all areas to be improved in order to determine appropriate products and pricing Negotiating and closing sales Identifying and acting upon opportunities to cross-sell additional products Following up with customers as needed, including returning to job site during installation process Meeting or exceeding assigned sales quotas on a consistent basis Submitting all job and contract documentation on a timely basis Attending daily sales/training meetings Working showroom floor as required Attending home and garden shows as well as open houses on an occasional basis Maintaining professional appearance and demeanor at all times

Maintain a professional appearance

item.title: Forklift Diesel Mechanic
item.description: Details: Forklift Diesel Mechanic – Charleston, SC Look to Spartan If you’re ready for a rewarding job in manufacturing and logistics, you’ll find it at Spartan. We’ll match you with the perfect assignment, with great potential for a long-term position. Contact Spartan today. We’re looking for people just like you. Spartan is currently hiring Forklift Diesel Mechanic for a temporary to hire position in the Charleston area for a reputable company. If you’re looking for a new opportunity in manufacturing or logistics, contact Spartan today. Job Description Forklift Diesel Mechanic will work on a variety of heavy equipment and will also drive company vehicle to customers’ locations. Duties may include, but are not limited to: Repair and replace damaged or worn parts. Dismantle and reassemble heavy equipment using hoists and hand tools. Operate and inspect machines or heavy equipment to diagnose defects. Test mechanical products and equipment after repair or assembly to ensure proper performance and compliance with manufacturers' specifications. Clean, lubricate, and perform other routine maintenance work on equipment and vehicles. Overhaul and test machines or equipment to ensure operating efficiency. Fit bearings to adjust, repair, or overhaul mobile mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic equipment. Diagnose faults or malfunctions to determine required repairs, using engine diagnostic equipment such as computerized test equipment and calibration devices. Ideal Forklift Diesel Mechanic Candidates 3 years of experience required TWIC Card a plus Committed to safety at all times Excellent attendance Pay Rate: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour Shift/hours: 1st and 2nd shifts available How To Apply Email resume to: Apply online at www.spartanstaffing.com /Charleston Spartan is an equal opportunity employer. Candidates must be willing to submit to a formal criminal background check and drug screen prior to placement. Ask us how YOU can receive WorkAlert text messages for jobs you may be interested in. TrueBlue Companies Centerline Professional Truck Drivers CLP General and Skilled Construction Labor Ready General Labor PlaneTechs Aviation Manufacturing and Maintenance Spartan Manufacturing and Logistics TransTechs Skilled Diesel Mechanics TrueBlue Construction, Manufacturing, Transportation, Services, Logistics

item.title: Maintenance Technician
item.description: Details: Masonic Villages at Elizabethtown is seeking a Maintenance Technician II to work Full Time/Days. This is an excellent, full time opportunity with a stable organization allowing growth and development within your area of expertise! Perform a variety of heating, ventilation, air conditioning, refrigeration, building automation control, mechanical, electrical, general maintenance and preventive maintenance jobs including all facets of maintenance and new construction duties, including leading and directing the work of others as assigned. Essential Functions 1.Installs, troubleshoots, repairs, maintains and evaluates the condition of heating, ventilation, air conditioning, refrigeration, plumbing, electrical (480volt & under), control and communication systems. 2.Complies with the Clean Air Act as it relates to the use, storage, handling and evacuation of refrigerants including the inventory of all types of gas used in all refrigerators, freezers, chillers and related equipment. 3.Maintains, troubleshoots, repairs and evaluates all equipment and systems assigned including, heating, ventilation, air conditioning, refrigeration, mechanical, plumbing and electrical equipment. Coordinates and directs work related to HVAC and R tasks. Assists in the installation and major repair of this equipment, coordinates and directs. 4.Performs preventive maintenance on all equipment including testing and maintaining of emergency generators. Assists outside contractors in their work relating to preventive maintenance of major systems and equipment including but not limited to chillers, major air handlers, fire protection, elevators and other systems on contracted maintenance. 5.Accepts call duty time as scheduled on a daily rotation for Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays and a weekly rotation for weekends including meeting requirements for being available to accept Switchboard calls and to respond to make repair or provide help as necessary. 6.Itemized, estimates and prepares requisitions material for jobs accurately and in accordance with Masonic Village procedures. Assist Maintenance Supervisor in coordination and preparation of labor and material cost estimates. 7.Assists Maintenance Supervisor in coordinating and directing jobs, inspecting work and utilizing the work order system. 8. Able to learn and utilize the entergy management computer system. 9.Maintains professional growth and development by attending educational, technical and training programs, seminars and courses. 10.Maintains work areas in an orderly and clean manner, maintaining a safe work place. Performs tasks in a safe manner. Ensures the proper care and use of tools, equipment and supplies. 11.Maintains an accurate record of time for cost distribution and payroll. Completes computer generated work orders and provides clean documentation of work as required. Generates work orders for additional work or tasks identified in field and completes or submits them as appropriate.

item.title: Cafeteria Staff
item.description: Details: Be a part of the Subway® Group – the world’s largest quick service restaurant franchisor and recognized leader in the Quick Service industry. With more than 41,000 restaurants in over 100 countries we continue to add talent to our team at our global headquarters in Milford, Connecticut. The Cafeteria Staff will work a 6:30am-3:00pm schedule and will be responsible for preparing food on a daily basis to help provide breakfast and lunch to 900+ employees and guests. Clean area and replenish food items on serving line during mealtimes. Complete cleanup routine after breakfast and lunch inside and outside of the kitchen as well as eating areas. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Prepare food on a daily basis. Set up/breakdown of food lines in Cafeteria for breakfast and lunch. Clean cafeteria, kitchen and equipment (soda machines, ovens and walk-ins). Help with weekly food and dry storage deliveries including stock rotation. Monitor inventory and notify supervisor if product is running low. Prep food for special events and Franchisee Welcome Receptions. Work over time for special events on a rotating basis. Help the Research & Development Department with food prep. Assist with special projects as needed.

item.title: MANUFACTURING ENGINEER
item.description: Details: MANUFACTURING ENGINEER - Full-time position The ideal candidate for the Manufacturing Engineer role will have Best Methods teams, and standardization processes and experience in Kaizen and Lean Manufacturing. The candidate will be able to work with cross-functional teams in the departments with manufacturing technology experience & launch support and customer initiatives. Looking for a Manufacturing Engineer with experience in manufacturing, maintenance and set-up. Looking for someone to improve manufacturing processes like cost-reduction, Quality, & efficiency. The candidate should have high levels of training experience. The candidate should have experience in tool and manufacturing processes with knowledge of CAD and/or FEA and GD&T. The ideal candidate will have knowledge in welding, stamping, tubing, and assembly. This person will be able to communicate with all levels of individuals in the company. This position has some travel, including to plants, customers and perhaps over-seas. The Manufacturing Engineer will assist in new product launches and adhere to NPIS guidelines. Compensation ranges from $70,000 to $80,000

item.title: Materials Planner / Inventory Control
item.description: Details: Responsibilities Establish strategies to improve supply chain,solve shortage issues and strengthen supplier relationships. Obtainmaterials, components and equipment, as required by the productionschedule. Plan, schedule, monitor materials through the development,prototype and production cycle. Expedite orders as necessary. Identify actualand potential delivery problems and take proactive steps to inform appropriatepersonnel. Maintain an awareness of materials and procurementconcepts. Verify data accuracy (parts numbers, BOMs, Part Costs) in MRP/ERP;report problems to appropriate parties. Understand and apply MRP reports inordering parts used in production to ensure appropriate deliverydates. Identify problem areas and offer possible solutions. Completespecial assignments for the Materials department as directed by the MaterialsManager/Material Planning Supervisor. Track progress of parts to ensureon-time delivery. Implement improvement processes to reduce inventory andnon-value added work. Perform supplier audits, and ongoing supplierratings. Control incoming freight and handling costs. Responsible foroptimizing material costs through vendor analysis, quality, schedule, costevaluation, etc. Applies cost effective measures as related to support standardcost and make/buy decisions. Service as liaison between the supply base andall internal departments on all matters involving materials and purchases, oraffecting production and achievement of the shipping plan. Ensure allmaterials required to support customer orders on assigned productlines. Ensure inventory targets are met on assigned product lines.

item.description: Details: Looking for a Test Engineer with experience testing IVR and Call Center Systems. This is a long-term contract with an Atlanta-based company. The contract rate is $45/HR If interested, please send your resume directly to Responsibilities of the Test Engineer: -The Test engineer must have experience with integrated system testing that includes Websphere, Mainframe, MQ, Web Services, and Oracle database backend. -The engineer will be responsible for creating the master test plan, test cases, test execution and defect tracking. -The engineer must work with the project team to insure that the correct testing is in place and that the correct metrics are captured for analysis. -Additional information includes: QA for RES IT, Call Center Systems-includes IVR (Voice applications), Kana Email & Chat, Workforce Management & misc Call Center applications &systems.

item.title: Patient Care Coordinator
item.description: Details: PATIENT CARE COORDINATOR BASIC FUNCTION: To provide a high level of customer (patient) satisfaction and to achieve clinic business objectives. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Outlined below. Additional duties may be assigned. CUSTOMER SERVICE/SALES: Ensure that current patients’ needs are met in a timely manner. Manage invoicing and accounts receivables based on patient purchases and insurances claims Recognize and capitalize on sales opportunities through various mediums (walk-ins, customer referrals, telephone inquiries, retention practices, etc.). Conduct effective telephone follow up to reschedule “no shows" and cancellations according to procedures. Maintain basic knowledge of hearing aid technology and be able to perform basic cleaning functions dependent upon requirements. Maintain knowledge of assistive listening devices and ability to demonstrate/recommend appropriate products. Maintain a high level of professionalism when completing the duties and responsibilities of the Patient Coordinator. Identify community events and organizations to promote Helix and identify sales opportunities. Act as a liaison with physicians’ offices to maximize referrals. RESPONSIBILITIES: Effectively handle multiple incoming telephone lines with ability to answer general questions, collect and record patient and marketing information. Assemble, maintain and process patient charts according to policies and procedures. Maintain well organized appointment schedule to optimize patient care and revenue opportunities. A keen ability to maintain and develop physical and electronic filing systems. Understand that various job descriptions of the Audiologist vs. Hearing Aid Specialist for appropriate appointment scheduling. Maintain and process insurance documentation. Follow established procedures for: Compile reports as required. Effectively use the Centre Management System or The Clinician System to enter patient information, transactions, and lead tracking. Attend any scheduled meetings. Meetings may be during or after regular working hours. Maintain an organized and clean working environment. Cash management, receivables, and payables Patient transactions Clinic supplies Clinic maintenance Mail handling Hearing aid clean & checks Follows company work and safety procedures and policies.

item.title: Tax Analyst
item.description: Details: The Tax Analyst will play a pivotal role in the organization’s growing tax department with a strong focus in the lottery origination business line and the compliance requirements for the industry. An understanding of both corporate tax and partnership tax is a requirement with experience in withholding taxes and 1099s. The candidate will also be responsible for the tax processes involved in preparing tax work papers, tax returns, monthly, quarterly, and annual federal and state tax withholding filings, responding to IRS and various state and local tax notices, and ensuring that all compliance needs are timely met.

item.title: Assistant Director of Nursing (ADON)
item.description: Details: Prefer long-term care nursing home experience. General Purpose: Manage administrative and functional areas or programs within the Nursing Department. Assist the Director of Nursing (DON) in overall operation of the department in accordance with Company policies, and standards of nursing practices and government regulations, so as to maintain quality care. Essential Job Functions This facility expects their employees to promote an atmosphere of teamwork with other employees and hospitality and comfort for its residents. Therefore, the following list of duties is not all-inclusive: Assist the DON in planning, developing, organizing, implementing, evaluating and directing the day-to-day functions of the nursing department in accordance with current rules, regulations, and guidelines. Make written and oral reports/recommendations to the DON as necessary/required, concerning the operation of the nursing department. Assist in developing methods for coordinating nursing services with other resident services to verify the continuity of the residents’ total regimen of care. Assist DON to monitor day-to-day operation of the nursing department and establish priorities and manage records, budgets, or supplies. Confirm that all nursing personnel are following their respective job descriptions. Participate in the development, maintenance, and implementation of the facility’s quality assurance program for the nursing service department. Participate in facility surveys (inspections) made by authorized government agencies as requested by the Administrator or Director of Nursing. Participate in developing, implementing, and periodically updating the resident’s written discharge plan. In the absence of the DON, serve on, participate in, and attend various committees of the facility (i.e. Infection Control, Quality Assurance, etc.) Assist the DON in determining the staffing needs of the nursing department. Assist with interviewing, orienting, training, evaluating, and supervising the nursing department personnel as directed by the DON. Delegate to the Charge Nurses and Nurse Supervisors the administrative authority, responsibility, and accountability necessary to perform their assigned duties. Make daily rounds of the nursing department to verify that all nursing personnel are performing their work assignments in accordance with acceptable nursing standards. Report findings to the Director. Monitor absenteeism to verify that an adequate number of nursing personnel are on duty at all times. Report problem areas to the Director. Review complaints and grievances made or filed by department personnel. Make appropriate reports to the Director as required or as may be necessary. Conduct departmental disciplinary action fairly and without regard to race, color, creed, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, or marital status. Confirm that all nursing personnel participate in the facility’s TB testing program. Provide the Director with information relative to the nursing needs of the resident and to the nursing department’s ability to meet those needs. Inform nursing service personnel of new admissions, their expected time of arrival, room assignment, etc. Make rounds with physicians as necessary. Inform the Director when physician visits are not made in a timely manner. Review nurses’ notes to verify that they are informative and descriptive of the nursing care being provided, that they reflect the resident’s response to the care, and that such care is provided in accordance with the resident’s wishes. Schedule daily rounds to observe residents and to determine if nursing needs are being met. Monitor medication passes and treatment schedules to verify that medications are being administered as ordered and that treatments are provided as scheduled. Report problem areas to DON. Assist in developing and implementing corrective action. Comply with, support and enforce Company policies involving all safety and infection control procedures to include the proper use of mechanical lifts and gait belts. Monitor nursing personnel to verify that they are following established safety regulations in the use of equipment and supplies. Verify that all resident care rooms, treatment areas, etc., are maintained in a clean, safe, and sanitary manner. Participate in the development and implementation of the procedures for the safe operation of all nursing equipment. Verify that all equipment is operated in a safe manner. Monitor nursing procedures to verify that nursing supplies are used in an efficient manner to avoid waste. Participate in the development of written preliminary and comprehensive assessments of the nursing needs of each resident. Assist the MDS/Care Plan Coordinator in planning, scheduling and revising the MDS, including the implementation of RAPS and Triggers. Participate in the development of a written care plan (preliminary and comprehensive) for each resident that identifies the problems/needs of the resident, indicates the care to be given, goals to be accomplished, and which professional service is responsible. Verify that all personnel involved in providing care to the resident are aware of the resident’s care plan. Verify that nursing personnel refer to the resident’s care plan prior to administering daily care to the resident. Review nurses’ notes to determine if the care plan is being followed. Develop and maintain a good rapport with all services involved with the care plan to verify that a team effort is achieved in developing their resident’s comprehensive care plan. Review complaints and grievances made by the resident and make a written/oral report to the Director indicating what action(s) were taken to resolve the complaint or grievance. Follow facility’s established procedures. Maintain a written record of the resident’s complaints and/or grievances that indicates the action taken to resolve the complaint and the current status of the complaint. Regularly inspect the facility and nursing practices for compliance with company, federal, state, and local standards and regulations. Report and investigate all allegations of resident abuse and/or misappropriation of resident property. Verify that nursing personnel honor the resident’s refusal of treatment request. Confirm that such requests are in accordance with the facility’s policies governing advance directives. Develop positive relationships on behalf of the company with governmental regulators, families, health care community and the community at large. Fill in as acting DON, Charge Nurse or other nursing position, as needed. Attend in-service education programs in order to meet facility educational requirements. Be familiar with Standard Precautions, Exposure Control Plan, Fire Drill & Evacuation Procedures and know how to use the information. Maintain confidentiality of resident and facility records/information. Protect residents from neglect, mistreatment, and abuse. Protect the personal property of the residents of the facility. Others as directed by the supervisor or administrator.

item.title: Payroll Test Specialist
item.description: Details: Role Description: The Payroll Test Specialist will augment ADP’s test case documents, plan and organize testing workshops, coordinate vendor interactions including third party service providers and produce management reports. This role reports directly to the Director – HR Project Management Office. Key Responsibilities: Test Case Augmentation Build on existing test case documents from vendor ADP and not recreate the wheel to ensure End to End test coverage. Determine the best approach for coordinating test execution across multi-functional/multi-ownership areas i.e. collaboratively test at one time across domains (Time & Labor, Payroll), test independently up to hand-off steps, etc Determine strategy for retesting of fixes and enhancements Confirming test scenarios and detailed test cases are identified and documented to test all requirements per design document e.g. clearly identified instructional steps, roles, expected results Within each domain – Time & Labor, Payroll E2E integrations Create or confirm required data conditions or pre-work in ADP systems as necessary to support scenario execution exists Identify test groups/roles within and outside each domain Testing Workshops Outline sequencing and coordination of test execution – availability to test, scheduling test resources, times, locations, facilities, resources and support Coordination of test execution and handoffs of test cases through each sub team Assign emp ID, manager ID, HRBP ID, Administrator ID, etc as appropriate for each scenario Test coordination with Technical & Vendor Partners Coordinate test assignments equitably and as appropriate to application of subject-matter expertise Create a process for validating failed scenarios to ensure not user error; capture failed-test supporting documentation; evaluate failed test severity level Defect Management Review defects for clarity/completeness Coordinate support to log test results and defects into testing system of record(s) Coordinate defect resolution and retesting Testing Status Reports Collate, compile and produce daily, weekly reports by function. Execute ad-hoc reports as needed to meet management needs. Analysis and Summary of Testing Status of test completion Open defects & scheduled completion Impacts / Risks to Integration & E2E test Required Skills & Qualifications: 7+ years of related Payroll/Time & Labor Management as an Analyst, Tester or Systems Administrator. Prefer ADP implementation experience Demonstrated success in managing matrix project teams. Excellent relationship skills and an ability to influence leaders and HR colleagues at all levels Excellent communication, coaching and influencing skills Strong business acumen and solid analytical skills; tool expertise with Excel to run pivot reports/charts. Flexibility to work across time zones. Ability to travel to New York, Chicago, Phoenix and Salt Lake as needed. Education Requirement: Bachelor degree in Information Systems, Human Resources or related field.

item.title: Full Time Business / Management Positions
item.description: Details: Business Administration Degree or Management Experience Wanted for Marketing & Sales Company- College Grads Apply!! This is an Entry Level Sales Position with Training into Management. We Will Provide Full Training. item.title: Counterparty Credit Analyst - Hedge Fund Group- Job ID 047664
item.description: Details: We Offer... The Hedge Fund Group within the Credit Risk Management Division is looking for an Analyst/AVP level counterparty credit analyst in our New York office. The purpose of the roll is to manage the credit risks to a portfolio of Hedge Fund clients engaged in various activities with the firm, including but not limited to, Prime Brokerage, OTC and listed derivatives, and structured financing. I am specifically looking for a candidate that is currently performing this role at a competitor. The primary responsibility of the role is to analyze and assess the credit quality/counterparty recourse value of our Hedge fund clients by analyzing fund's investment strategy, performance history, portfolio exposures and risk management practices. The analyst will be responsible for assigning an internal rating based on a proprietary model, document the analysis through written reviews, and monitor ongoing investment performance. The role involves direct interaction with our Hedge Fund clients and the various trading/business units engaged in business activities that generate credit exposures. The analyst will be responsible for analyzing/approving transactions, negotiating trading/financing documentation, and monitoring credit exposures using VaR and scenario based risk measures against established credit limits on a regular basis.

item.title: General Manager (Novi)
item.description: Details: General Manager Continental Services has grown to become Michigan’s largest independent food management company and one of the nation’s top 50 food management providers. Beginning in 1989 as a small Detroit-based coffee and vending business, Continental has deep Michigan roots. Now a leader in the industry, serving more than 650 clients spanning business, education and nonprofit sectors, Continental operates with partner brands to offer customized dining and refreshment packages, business and industry dining, premier catering services, luxury yacht charters, and full-spectrum planning expertise for social and corporate events. The General Manager is primarily responsible for business development, people leadership, and culinary preparation within their assigned account. This includes ensuring all production and service is executed in accordance with company standards, and that customer needs are met if not exceeded on a consistent basis. This position will be overseeing multi units of business at one centralized location. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Business Development Inspire preferred status through exceptional client experiences. Earn respect and build rapport with clients. Identify and exploit opportunities within assigned accounts. Achieve financial objectives. Create, monitor and review progress for each account. Design, develop and execute changes that perpetuate the achievement of both short and long term objectives. Participate in new account openings. People Management Actively engage in the selection, training, development, and leadership of the team. Regularly coach, direct and evaluate talent. Provide recognition to team members excelling in their work. Provide open, honest and timely coaching as needed. Identify knowledge gaps and partner with appropriate parties to implement training and performance plans. Optimize the workforce. Ensure each shift is properly staffed and responsibilities are completed. Implement and maintain effective communication to ensure clear and timely flow of information to and from team members. Culinary and Service Excellence Lead the successful execution of food preparation and client service for assigned locations. Anticipate client needs, uphold quality expectations, and embrace service standards. Plan, organize, direct, coordinate, and delegate responsibility to ensure goals and objectives are met on a daily basis. Be a catalyst for continuous improvement. Review team performance, identify opportunities and implement change. Standardize operating procedures and maintain site-level accountability. Maintain culinary quality control at all times. Create and maintain Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). Ensure food is properly prepared, packaged and served in a way that is appealing while upholding the integrity of the recipes. Inventory: Monitor and maintain proper levels of inventory for all food and supplies. Ensure proper rotation and efficient stocking. Plan for proper break down and utilization of leftover items.

Supervise the certified nursing assistants and QMA’s that are on duty during your shift of duty. Continually assess goals and discharge plans throughout the resident’s length of stay. About Us: Hickory Creek operates 16 skilled nursing homes in Indiana and Ohio with one home in Indiana dedicated to the care of adults with developmental disabilities. Core Values We are a service company committed to the highest standards of professionalism and to continuous improvement in the quality of service we provide to those entrusted to our care. Our goal is to inspire confidence, provide stability and render quality resident care. We will never knowingly fail to follow any state or federal rule or regulation regarding quality of care; potential abuse; or reimbursement or payment systems. We strive to hire and retain personnel of ability, character and dedication by providing good working conditions, training and leadership, and personal growth opportunities. We strive to serve as a responsible citizen to our residents and to the communities we serve.

item.title: SRM IB Policy and Governance Management and Assurance - Job ID 044663
item.description: Details: We Offer... Strategic Risk Management IB (SRM IB), the market risk department of Credit Suisse, is looking for a VP to join its COO team in New York. The SRM IB COO team is responsible for departmental governance, management, operational risk and control processes, for risk limit and risk flag processes, for financial management processes, for human capital and staff development processes, for departmental communication and for providing miscellaneous regulatory, operational and administrative support to the department. The SRM IB COO Risk & Controls Group helps to ensure compliance with Credit Suisse policies and procedures. The primary responsibilities of the Risk and Controls Group include supporting the department on ensuring the appropriate policies, governance and overall controls function within SRM IB, as well as facilitating the understanding and implementation of policies and procedures in SRM IB. SRM IB is looking to strengthen its Policy, Governance and Controls function. This role will be primarily responsible for designing and documenting key processes and controls, updating departmental policies, control testing and supporting the SRM IB department as a whole in ensuring the appropriate policy, governance and controls are in place and are effective. Additional responsibilities include project and other COO tasks in line with the broader mandate of the SRM IB COO function. Accordingly, this new role is particularly suitable for people at VP level with a strong ability to interpret processes and write policy documentation, a good understanding of front to back processes relating to the Bank's global trading activities. A good understanding of market risk and market risk management processes is an advantage. The role will be based in New York. It offers a great opportunity for people interested in continuing their career in the CRO Division. The role requires extensive interaction with senior managers in and outside of SRM IB as well as the front office, the ability to present and discuss various topics, achieve results and/or escalate as needed. The main duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Establishing and maintaining the Policies and Control processes within the SRM IB & US CRO departments. Ensuring all relevant policies, procedures and other documents are in place to meet LE requirements and maintainence of such documents thereafter. Establishing and maintanence of control processes within SRM IB & US CRO to address LE regulatory equirements and best practices. Supporting the US CRO COO on any regulatory requests received from Regulatory Coordination and CRO policy team. Increase resources dedicated to reg. responses and initiatives. Refine agendas and mandates for risk committees. Define roles and responsibilities for 3 lines of defense in the U.S. Project management of the policies and controls update process.

item.title: Maintenance Technician
item.description: Details: Position Purpose Installs, maintains and repairs machinery, equipment, building, and related infrastructure systems following specifications, blueprints, manuals, and schematic drawings, using hand tools, power tools, hoist, crane, and measuring and testing instruments. Key duties and responsibilities Performs preventative maintenance according to the PM schedule and administers the ERP module. Visually inspects and tests machinery and equipment, using electrical and mechanical test equipment. Listens for unusual sounds from machines or equipment to detect malfunctions and discusses machine operation variations with Team Leaders or other employees to diagnose problems or repair machine. Dismantles defective machines and equipment and installs new or repaired parts, following specifications and blueprints, using precision measuring instruments and hand tools. Installs and repairs electrical apparatus, such as transformers and wiring, and electrical and electronic components of machinery and equipment. Lays out, assembles, installs and maintains pipe systems and related hydraulic and pneumatic equipment, and repairs and replaces gauges, valves, pressure regulators, and related equipment. Repairs and maintains building and grounds. Installs machinery and equipment according to blueprints and other specifications. Fabricates and repairs counters, benches, partitions, and other wooden structures. Clean outside grounds, walks, and driveway from snow, debris, and other material. All other duties as assigned.

item.title: Delivery Representative
item.description: Details: A meri G as Propane is the nation's largest propane distributor, serving over 2 million residential, commercial, industrial, agricultural and motor fuel propane customers in all 50 states. We have more than 9,000 employees whose spirit, enthusiasm and dedication are displayed every day in the hundreds of cities and towns that we serve across the nation. The company’s focus on employees and our employee’s dedication to customer service will confirm our position as the industry leader. AmeriGas is listed on the New York stock exchange [NYSE: APU]. For more information visit our website at www.amerigas.com At AmeriGas Propane, a Delivery Representative is a key point of contact for our customers. They are dedicated and responsible people that can excel in a fast paced work environment and posses exceptional people skills. A Delivery Representative drives an AmeriGas Bobtail propane delivery truck and fills tanks for residential and industrial customers at their site. A Delivery Representative makes 15-25 customer stops on a typical day working in all weather and driving conditions. AmeriGas drivers use a rotating “on call" schedule to cover any off hour customer emergencies. Responsibilities: Drive a bobtail delivery truck to customer sites and fill empty customer tanks of all sizes by pulling the hose from the truck to the tank location Customer tanks may be located indoors or outdoors. Outdoor tanks are filled by using the hose from the truck; inside tanks are carried outside to the truck to be filled and then returned inside

item.title: Grain Merchandiser / Cross-Country Trader
item.description: Details: Grain Merchandiser This client is a fortune 500 company currently searching for a senior grain merchandiser capable of moving 30-50 million bushels of corn and other commodities. There are positions available throughout the corn belt, so if you have experience in grain merchandising and are seeking a better company that can expand and accelerate your career, this is a great opportunity. This company's grain group has expanded by 50 percent over the last few years and their company is expected to be worth more than $6 billion in the next year. With all that on the table, isn't it worth taking a look?

item.title: A&P Mechanic - Aircraft Mechanic - A & P Mechanic
item.description: Details: A&P Mechanic LAUNCH Technical Workforce Solutions is seeking A&P Mechanics with corporate jet experience for an opportunity in Ft. Lauderdale, FL. Job Duties and Responsibilities: A&P Mechanics will maintain, inspect, repair, modify, overhaul and troubleshoot corporate aircraft in compliance with policies, manuals, procedures and requirements.

item.title: Maintenance Technician
item.description: Details: Ruskin Company, a leading manufacturer of HVAC air dampers, has an immediate opening for an experienced 2 nd Shift Maintenance Technician. NO RELOCATION PROVIDED.

item.title: Work At Home! Travel Sales!
item.description: Details: Do you love travel? Like to sell while providing top notch customer service? Would you enjoy working in your own home office? Then International Cruise & Excursions, Inc. (ICE), a travel industry leader, is looking for you!!! We are expanding our sales force and have opportunities for motivated professionals with a passion for sales to join our Inbound Travel Sales Team ! ICE is an award winning leader in the Travel & Leisure Industry! BEST PLACES TO WORK in 2010, 2011,2012, and 2013 & MOST ADMIRED COMPANY!. Our employees have reason to be PROUD! In this position you would be booking travel vacations, while providing the highest level of quality service on all calls. This position has an earning potential of 30k - 40k for successful sales consultants (hourly & commission). Top producers earn even more! If you are interested in joining us, here's what you need to do first: 1. Send us your resume. We are located at 15501 N. Dial Blvd. Scottsdale, AZ 85260 (we are one traffic light east of Scottsdale Rd off the Greenway-Hayden Loop) Please contact Jarrett @ 602-635-5139 or Melody @ 602-626-2609 for more information! Local residents only!

item.title: Systems Engineer Senior-EW
item.description: Details: The Alion Electronic Warfare (EW) team in Dayton Ohio is seeking an experienced systems engineer to provide support to a variety of aircraft programs with emphasis on EW systems, sensors, and weapons system integration. Experience related to EW system integration is of particular interest. Position requires in-depth knowledge of USAF acquisition of aircraft weapon systems. Knowledge of DOD 5000 series, AFI 63 series, and JCIDS requirements process as it applies to electronic warfare is preferred. Experience working with system engineering and weapon system integration tasks related to acquisition programs is required. Knowledge of the practical application of engineering science and technology to include applying principles, techniques, procedures and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services. Responsibilities range from providing systems/specialty engineering and technical analyses for assigned acquisition activities to ensuring consistent interpretation/application of policy and guidance to meet system/subsystem requirements; to include compliance with OSS&E and life cycle systems engineering requirements. These efforts include close technical coordination with government laboratories, program offices and their suppliers in all areas of subsystem design, development, integration and test.

item.title: Structural Engineer Sr
item.description: Details: Alion Science and Technology is seeking a Structural Engineer to plan the production and maintenance processes and procedures for KC-46 depot maintenance. Applicant determines conditions under which inspection and test tasks are to be conducted. Applicant will analyze information for depot maintenance engineering requirements; provide structural systems expertise for customer evaluation and resolution; and develop technical reports associated with depot maintenance inspection and repair activities. Applicant will support senior technical level personnel and program managers in the planning, oversight, and execution of complex processes related to system and technical product development and will provide technical guidance and mentoring to lower level technical staff. Applies advanced technical concepts, techniques, and procedures to support project teams in the development of technical processes. Performs complex engineering analysis, evaluation, planning, testing and operation in support of depot-level system development. Carries out complex assignments requiring the improvement of current techniques and procedures. Analyzes technical data, customer usage data, customer maintenance practices, customer operation characteristics, and related reports to validate engineering requirements. Assists in the development of policies, guidelines, and procedures to ensure quality and cost control for engineering and maintenance processes. Supervises and reviews activities of staff, scheduling, and assigning work to meet program/project completion dates. Works closely with senior customer personnel in providing solutions to complex problems and advice on technical issues. Educates and advises more junior technical staff members in the technical aspects of their efforts. Prepares and reviews input to major technical reports, status reports, letters, technical memoranda, contract reports and formal briefings. Complies with applicable quality and security procedures in the performance of duties.

item.title: Procurement Buyer
item.description: Details: Reduce costs through bidding spot buys, negotiations and substitution of items to attain optimum total cost. Recommends stocking levels for inventory to ensure availability while controlling working capital investment. Works closely with manufacturing, maintenance, planning and finance functions Commodities managed to include some minor raw materials, MRO, repairs and on-site services. Perform cost analyses and propose productivity programs. Work with suppliers on pricing, availability and quality issues. Responsible for solving Logistics / Trucking issues as the first point of escalation. Lead meetings with key suppliers and internal stakeholders. Place, maintain, and expedite orders for goods and services to support production and maintenance in SAP. Maintain Source Lists and add/maintain item master data.

item.title: ASSISTANT STORE MANAGER
item.description: Details: At Johnston & Murphy we believe that attributes are as important as experience and that who you are is as important as what you know. We believe that it’s the intangibles that make people and organizations special. Towards that end we have created a culture around an attributes based people model called P.R.I.D. E. Key Responsibilities of an Assistant Manager Passion – Personally dedicated to being the best; conveys enthusiasm for the organization with a “can do" attitude; never gives up. Consistently meet deadlines Use J&M sales tools to implement and obtain sales objectives Utilize all available resources to improve performance and to further educate yourself and your sales team Represents the Brand – Acts as an ambassador for the brand to the outside world; creates a store environment representative of a premium brand; adheres to an appropriate and effective set of core values. Effectively Network and Recruit Assist in interviewing and hiring personnel using the PRIDE model Assist in the implementation of visual guidelines, window changes and maintaining store appearance Adhere to personal presentation guidelines Consistently deliver World Class Service and use proper phone etiquette Interpersonal Skills – Effective communicator within the organization; builds lasting and productive relationships with co-workers. Build lasting and productive relationships within the organization Assist in the implementation , utilizing and certifying the team in all training programs Effective communication skills Assist in coaching and counseling performance to achieve company standards Assist in the implementation and adherence to all company policies and procedures Assist in the creation and administering PRIDE Performance Plans and Evaluations Delivers Results – Achieves financial goals; manages profitability through personal and team performance; executes company priorities. Meet and exceed sales plans, both store and personal Meet and exceed sales metrics, both store and personal Assist in protecting company assets including accurate inventory and cash management Assist in the creation and maintaining of weekly work schedules to utilize talent and maximize sales Edge – Can effectively initiate and manage change; makes good decisions based on analysis and knowledge; conveys sense of urgency and moves issues to closure. Ability to: Assist in managing ALL performance, from exceptional to deficient Identify trends through shopping the competition and other trend resources Effectively use all merchandise reports to assist in analyzing, identifying and communicating merchandising needs to maximize your business Partner with HR to move issues to closure .

item.title: RN Unit Manager
item.description: Details: Grace Healthcare of Lake Wales is currently seeking a RN Unit Manager. General Purpose: Responsible for supervision of the delivery of care to residents on assigned Unit. Assess resident needs, develop care plans, administer nursing care, evaluate nursing care, and supervise CNAs and other personnel in the delivery of nursing care. Essential Job Functions This facility expects their employees to promote an atmosphere of teamwork with other employees and hospitality and comfort for its residents. Therefore, the following list of duties is not all-inclusive: Attend therapy meetings. Complete assessments of residents at admission and discharge from unit. Supervise nursing personnel assigned to the Unit. Document services rendered to residents in Unit for billing purposes. Write admission notes or evaluate admission notes and chart additional essential information. Identify and prioritize primary nursing problems. Place charting profile of prompters in front of chart. Develop care plan addressing immediate nursing problems. Attend weekly meetings, working with therapy and nursing department to optimize reimbursement and make decisions regarding decertification and discharge. Make daily rounds on the unit to monitor resident care and status or residents. Implement care plans for residents on the unit in compliance with physician’s orders. Implement established nursing policies and procedures on the unit, educating nursing support staff according to facility guidelines. Notify resident or legal representative of pending discharge 24 hours in advance. On date of discharge, chart complete discharge summary, to include discharge planning and referrals. Keep complete and accurate record of sign in/out sheets for staffing hours. Assign duties to LPNs and nursing assistants working on the unit, as directed. Work closely with the Director of Nursing in resolving grievances with nursing staff, family members, and residents. Promote favorable working conditions and relationships with the administration, medical staff, consultants, other departments, residents, family members, volunteers, agencies, and any other individual or group affiliated with Unit and the facility. Handle and report disciplinary action that requires immediate attention during your tour of duty in the absence of the Director of Nursing, Assistant Director of Nursing and Administrator. Review charting on a weekly basis for accuracy and completeness. Verify that nurses’ charting correlates with what therapy is charting. Document in resident’s chart pertinent information about significant change in resident’s condition. Maintain a safe working environment, complying with infection control and body mechanic procedures. Respond to need for staffing shortages by arranging for replacement staff. Supervise and perform treatments or venipunctures, as needed. Track infection control, exposure control, and resident care trends to provide proactive improvement. Identify areas of concern and offer recommendations and suggestions to the Director of Nursing. Fill in as Charge Nurse when necessary. Audit nursing charges as instructed by Director of Nursing. Inform Central Supply of any supplies that are needed for the Unit. Attend in-service education programs in order to meet facility educational requirements. Be familiar with Standard Precautions, Exposure Control Plan, Fire Drill & Evacuation Procedures and know how to use the information. Maintain confidentiality of resident and facility records/information. Protect residents from neglect, mistreatment, and abuse. Protect the personal property of the residents of the facility. Others as directed by the supervisor or administrator.

item.title: B2B Telesales Specialist
item.description: Details: B2B Telesales Specialist Manufacturing sales team needs enthusiastic person for building customer relationships in Ithaca, NY! Generate and close new sales leads through a variety of sources such as: outbound telesales and telemarketing campaigns, straightforward technical advice and solutions, assisting external sales staff, qualifying prospect accounts, telemarketing follow-up activities, marketing service contracts and extended warranties. Duties Gain overall knowledge and application of business area’s product lines and services offered. Perform outbound telesales and telemarketing campaigns utilizing professional selling skills. Accurately manage and record sales leads and pursuits. Select open leads for closure. Qualify sales leads. Effectively nurture sales leads. Provide weekly updates. Be proactive – suggest an alternate sale offer and/or approaches. This is a long-term position. Hours are Monday to Friday 8 am to 5 pm. Pays $12.00+ per hour based on experience.

item.title: Marketing Content Manager (6710-284)
item.description: Details: The Global Marketing Communications Manager contributes to raising the visibility of the Ingram Micro Cloud brand, therefore driving both sales and market share, particularly through the creation and implementation of proactive and integrated marketing communications programs. Reporting to the Senior Marketing and Communications Manager, this position is responsible for building, supporting and executing product-specific and event-specific marketing campaigns tailored for audiences aligned with that particular technology. As such, this role will strategize to create and then manage the media plan for designated cloud products as well as Ingram Micro as a whole, ensuring consistent messaging and appropriate coverage and that aligns with the needs of individual regions. This position collaborates closely with the Global Cloud marketing team, Ingram Micro marketing managers, and product managers to support and coordinate product launch activities. Key responsibilities include the development and execution of an optimal mix of traditional and digital marketing options to drive engagement and awareness of the Ingram Micro brand, including collateral creation and content development. This position partners closely with colleagues to build creative marketing campaigns and drive timely execution of those plans. This role will also measure the effectiveness and return on investment of marketing activities which includes establishing metrics, analyzing results of activity, and presenting findings with recommendations to marketing leadership. The Global Marketing Communications Manager also manages the approved expenditures included in the marketing communication budget, securing approval for unplanned projects or charges and delivers quarterly updates of plan vs. actual to the Senior Marketing Communications Manager.

item.title: SRM IB COO Limit Management Analyst- Job ID 044661
item.description: Details: Strategic Risk Management IB (SRM IB), the market risk department of Credit Suisse, is looking for an AVP/VP to join its COO team in New York. The SRM IB COO team is responsible for departmental governance, management, operational risk and control processes, for risk limit and risk flag processes, for financial management processes, for human capital and staff development processes, for departmental communication and for providing miscellaneous regulatory, operational and administrative support to the department. SRM IB is looking to strengthen its regional Risk Limit, Flag, Governance and Control functions. This role will be primarily responsible for strengthening and expanding the departments Limit and Flag processes, for designing and documenting key processes and controls, for developing and producing ad-hoc reporting, administration of the Global Limits and Flags, control testing and supporting the line manager in the role out of the updated FLEX system. Additional responsibilities include project and other COO tasks in line with the broader mandate of the SRM IB COO function. Accordingly, this new role is particularly suitable for people at AVP/VP level with a good understanding of front to back processes relating to the Bank's global trading activities. A good understanding of market risk and market risk management processes is an advantage. The role will be based in New York. It offers a great opportunity for people interested in continuing their career in the CRO Division. The role requires extensive interaction with senior managers in and outside of SRM IB as well as the front office, the ability to present and discuss various topics, achieve results and/or escalate as needed. The main duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Coordination and maintainance of the Limits and Flags Framework processes and FLEX system; inclusive of performing limit changes, entry of new limits, flag changes, entry of new flags, creation and generation of limit and flag reporting. Flag Tags definition and calibration Supporting Migration from Flagtool to Flex Assisting in defining test cases for additional functionality Assisting in new FLEX for flags phase 2 UAT testing and cluster by cluster phased roll-out Supporting local Flex Flags users in the US after UK hours Maintaining ongoing book of work for flagtool improvements and bug fixes alongside IT and project team support. Work closely with clusters to incorporate new flag types and Entity Specific flags. Assist in building training materials for Flex for Flags Support and perform training of updated FLEX system to clients Coordination with Limit and Flag owners and support them on all aspects regarding Limits, Flags and the FLEX system. Quality assurance of new limit, change limit, new flag and change flag requests to ensure a timely and accurate population of limits and/or flags into the FLEX system. Development and maintainance of the departmental Limit and Flag procedures. Preparation/creation of PowerPoint presentations for meetings and committees. Ability to interpret processes/proposals and compile slides to represent the status/ proposals/ direction for a senior audience. Responsible for creation/generation of reports and management MIS within the SRM IB COO department. High degree of front office and senior management interaction in order to maintain effectiveness of Flex for both Limits and Flags

item.title: Behavior Analyst
item.description: Details: Job Description Job Title: Behavior Analyst GENERAL SUMMARY Provides leadership and direction for the behavioral services programs within Attendant Care Companies. Oversees all behavioral therapies of the multiple service lines within the company. Works with management team to development new programs and expand current programs within each service line. TYPICAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Responsible for developing and managing comprehensive behavioral approaches for clients residing at The Estates of Rochester, The Estates of Macomb and in the Progressions program with the goal of encouraging good mental health, reducing behavioral issues, creating effective skills for functioning in the community and providing co-workers with suggestions to positively assist clients. 2. Responsible for development of environmental and behavioral plans for clients residing at The Estates of Rochester and The Estates of Macomb and clients within the Progressions program. 3. Create data trackers for all clients residing at The Estates of Rochester and The Estates of Macomb, as well as clients within the Progressions program. 4. Responsible for training house managers at The Estates on the implementation and documentation of clients’ environmental and behavioral plans. 5. Responsible for training home health aides and as needed the nursing case manager on the implementation and documentation of Progressions clients’ environmental and behavioral plans. 6. Provide at minimum weekly monitoring of behavioral plan goals for Progressions clients. 7. Provide at minimum monthly monitoring of behavioral plan goals for The Estates of Rochester and The Estates of Macomb clients. 8. Provide behavioral specialist representation on behalf of Attendant Care Companies at care conferences for all clients residing at The Estates of Rochester and Macomb, as well as clients within the Progressions program. 9. Submit quarterly progress reports on behavior therapy to the Billing department for all clients residing at The Estates of Rochester and The Estates of Macomb, as well as clients within the Progressions program. 10. Conduct skills acquisition, social skills and functional assessments for all clients residing at The Estates of Rochester and Macomb, as well as clients within the Progressions program. 11. Create recommendations to house managers and clinical director for identified needed comprehensive services for Estates and Progressions’ clients. 12. Create and present behavioral management programs for Attendant Care Companies as a whole as needed. 13. Provide initial assessment visit to all new Estates and Progressions clients within 48 hours. 14. Serve as a liaison for Progressions clients, attending appointments as needed and communicating with client’s guardian, case manager, treatment team. 15. Model and promote good communication and positive representation of the program to clients, customers, Attendant Care Companies associates and the public. 16. Complete daily activity logs to be submitted to the payroll department weekly on Mondays by 5PM along with mileage reimbursement log. 17. May work flex schedule and provide after-hours on-call services if needed for clients having behavioral issues. 18. Participate in committees, task forces, and other related meetings and activities as assigned by leader. 19. Perform other duties as assigned by leader.

item.title: Retail, Hospitality, & Restaurant Experience Wanted - No Nights or Weekends
item.description: Details: Customer Service - Marketing - Sales - Entry Level Our rapid expansion has created opportunities for growth andadvancement for our Entry Level Sales and Marketing Associates. We develop theminto future Sales and Marketing Directors through our training program. They will then go onto lead and manage our new offices. We are looking to select motivated individuals to work in a fastpaced sales and marketing environment. This is an Entry Level Sales and Marketing Position with advancement into aMarketing Director role. Role Overview: 1. Learning and executing the standard sales and marketingsystems. 2. Managing and developing other sales & marketingassociates within a team oriented environment. 3. Branch and Market Management: The individual transitions fromlearning the entry level sales functions to managing the marketing needs forone of our clients. Extensive training is provided and we will continue your education throughoutyour career with us. . Candidates that we have been selected for this position in the past have comefrom very diverse backgrounds that include marketing, business, sales, customerservice, hospitality, retail, public relations and the restaurant industry.

item.title: Immediate Hire - Entry Level - Full Time - Sales & Marketing
item.description: Details: Greenwood Concepts, Inc. is looking for quality full time entry level individuals to train and advance through our sales and consulting team.​ This entry level full time person must have a positive and enthusiastic demeanor and work well in a strong entry level team environment.​ Our position involves one on one sales interaction with customer’s full time.​ This is an entry level, full time outside sales position.​ We are looking to train in: outside sales, campaign development and business operations from entry level.​ Greenwood Concepts, Inc. ​ is now offering full time positions at the entry level for outside sales and marketing.​ We are looking for full time entry level people with diverse backgrounds.​ If you are tired of working in the restaurant, hospitality or retail business, use your experience and switch fields.​ We are only meeting with candidates that want a full time entry level career, so please only apply if you are serious about making the change.​ Responsibilities at the entry level include: Assisting in the daily full time operation of our company Assisting in new business acquisition for our client Developing strong leadership skills among our employees Managing external customers' needs Retail sales and consulting We are constantly looking to surround ourselves full time with the most profitable clients, the most charismatic people, and the most ambitious entry level full time managers.​ We treat our full time entry level employees as future partners and we know we are all more effective when we are equipped with the right training and knowledge.​

item.title: Sales & Marketing - Entry Level - Paid Training
item.description: Details: Entry Level Sales and Marketing Reps Wanted! Sales and Marketing Firm Seeks Entry Level Professionals Greenwood Concepts, Inc. is now offering positions at the entry level for sales and marketing. Our firm has a very high success rate of developing SPORTS MINDED individuals into TOP PERFORMERS in a management capacity. We are seeking inexperienced professionals that would like to take their “Winning Mindsets" and apply them to lucrative marketing and business careers. We want to develop our own people (starting in entry level) rather than hiring people with habits counteractive to our mission. Entry Level Account Representatives will work in the following areas: Sales & Marketing. This job involves one on one sales interaction with customers. (NO telemarketing - NO direct mail) Public Speaking and Presentations Recruiting Campaign Management Teaching and Development of Teammates Medical Benefits Available – Blue Cross Our field of expertise is executing customer acquisition campaigns for Fortune 100 companies. We are not an employment or temp agency. We are an outsourced sales and marketing team. Our clients need us to communicate with their customers since their telemarketing and direct mail channels are struggling. We provide the human interaction our clients so desperately need.

item.title: Speech Langauge Pathologist- SLP
item.description: Details: OPENING FOR A FULL TIME STATE LICENSED SLP AT OUR 5 STAR, SKILLED NURSING/SUB ACUTE/LONG TERM CARE FACILITY! Select Medical Rehabilitation Services has a proven track record as a results-oriented partner to skilled nursing facilities, assisted living facilities, hospitals and school systems. Perform and assist in troubleshooting of equipment failure to determine root causes.

item.title: Dining Room Host/Hostess
item.description: Details: At Chick-fil-A, the team member role is more than just a job, it's an opportunity. In addition to working directly for an independent Operator, team members gain life experience that goes far beyond just serving a great product in a friendly environment. Chick-fil-A is a great opportunity for people of all ages and backgrounds, and no experience is necessary. Please consider visiting your local Chick-fil-A restaurant if you'd like to learn more about the team member experience. Work in a Chick-fil-A restaurant A job at Chick-fil-A is more than just a job. It's a stepping-stone to a successful future in the world of business. Here are some of the great benefits of working at Chick-fil-A. Flexible Hours You probably have commitments to your family, friends, school or sports teams. We will try to arrange your work schedule around them. Closed Sunday’s All Chick-fil-A restaurants are closed on Sundays so you can have a day off to spend with family and friends. Work Directly With A Chick-fil-A Operator The Operator is an independent business person, responsible for the operation of the restaurant, who invests time in his or her employees, teaching them important business skills for the future.

item.title: Occupational Therapist
item.description: Details: Job Title: Occupational Therapist FLSA: Non-Exempt GENERAL SUMMARY Provides services to home care patients in accordance with the Plan of Care. Services are provided under the direction of the attending physician with participation of the family and other members of the interdisciplinary team, as indicated. TYPICAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1) Performs occupational therapy assessments, diagnostic tests, skilled treatments, and ongoing evaluation of clients who are receiving services under a medically approved Plan of Care. a. Completes assessments in a timely manner adhering to company policy. b. Develops a treatment program and establishes goals for improved function. c. Provides assessment findings and goals to assist in developing the client care plan and obtains specific physician orders as needed. d. Documents all findings, plans, interventions, and client progress (outcomes) on designated forms and submits per company guidelines. 2) Guides and instructs the client in prescribing therapeutic self-care and creative activities that are directed toward improving independence and physical and cognitive functioning. 3) Advises, consults, and teaches appropriate treatment procedures and supportive activities to clients, family members, and other Agency staff. 4) Designs and/or orders appropriate adaptive/assistive devices and/or splints to promote optimal level of functioning. 5) Instructs clients and their families in the client specific program. 6) Performs job in compliance with Agency policies and procedures and professional and community standards. a. Provides services in accordance with applicable state, federal, and Joint Commission standards. b. Attends meetings and required educational programs. c. Accepts responsibility for personal and professional development and identifies learning/developmental needs to supervision. 7) Attends care conferences, initiates interdisciplinary referrals and participates in care coordination as needed. 8) Serves on the Clinical Record Review Committee, if needed. 9) Performs other related duties and responsibilities as deemed necessary.

item.description: Details: Make a difference in millions of lives every day by utilizing your sales, marketing and public relations skills both in your community and across the country by joining the MDA team , as a Fundraising Coordinator . Identify new corporate sponsors and maximize fundraising opportunities through various business development techniques including cold-calling, following up on warm leads and attending networking events; consistently research ways to create partnerships with local businesses. Deliver organized, structured, and persuasive presentations; using effective written and verbal communication. Coordinate targeted advertising, sales and marketing initiatives to communicate MDA’s healthcare and research programs in the local community Effectively engage donors of all levels. Advise and assist in the development of a local fundraising strategy, plan and budget..

item.title: Outside Sales - Metro DC & Northern Virginia (983-425)
item.description: Details: Hajoca Corporation is the nation’s largest privately held wholesale distributor of plumbing, heating and industrial supplies. The company has more than 350 locations across the United States and carries the premier product lines in its industry. Outside Sales Person | Full-time | Commission-based Position | Washington DC Metro Area J&H Aitcheson, a division of Hajoca Corporation, is looking for an aggressive sales associate with experience in the commercial construction supply arena, who is a maniac about customer service, has a passion to win and wants to make some money at the same time! This motivated, self-managed professional will join our growing Alexandria, VA team. You will be responsible for initiating and growing sales from current and new customers by promoting the service capabilities of J&H Aitcheson, sharing industry knowledge and delivering top-notch customer service. Must be fueled by an unquestionable work ethic and desire to build a successful enterprise. In this fast-paced environment, you must possess strong problem-solving skills, professional written and verbal communication talents and a ridiculous sense of urgency. About J&H Aitcheson, A Division of Hajoca Corporation J&H Aitcheson is the premier distributor of plumbing, heating, and mechanical products in the region, serving Northern Virginia, Washington D.C., and Central Maryland. We offer one of the most comprehensive range of products in the industry. With our knowledgeable team’s technical expertise, we ensure the success of our partner’s residential and commercial projects, both large and small. In 1999, J&H Aitcheson became part of the Hajoca family, the largest privately owned plumbing wholesaler in the United States with more than 200 locations nationwide. Our Mission and Vision We Will Be The Premier Plumbing Distributor in the Metro DC Market by doing the following: We will conduct ourselves with honesty, integrity, and fairness in our dealings with our customers, suppliers and fellow employees. We will provide quality products, excellent value, and outstanding service to our customers. We will constantly strive to be innovative and progressive with our product and service offerings. We will strive to be a company with whom customers like to do business, and an organization which reflects the values of our owner. Each of us will strive, as a member of this TEAM, to uphold the ideals of this organization in order to enhance our opportunities for continued growth, both personally and professionally. Essential Duties Create sales and business outreach plans so as to meet and surpass company’s sales goals and profit projections. Develop relationships with current customers to drive and expand sales and build company’s reputation as an ethics-based market leader. Initiate new sales leads and prospects through market and account research, networking, and external events with the goal of new customers and orders. Serve as lead point of contact for customer service concerns so issues are capably and expediently handled to the satisfaction of the customer. Maintain effective records for sales contacts, estimates, orders and invoices. Promote Hajoca through a variety of networking, business and community-oriented meetings and events. Maintain and build on current competencies of industry and product knowledge to better assist customers and enhance company’s leadership standing. Assist with merchandise delivery where needed to assure customer satisfaction. Work with team to build company’s reputation and success. Must have valid driver’s license and reliable transportation. Must be able to lift 25+ pounds. Compensation Package Aggressive commission plan Competitive benefits program Professional development opportunities Company vehicle
