The Library seeks a Library Support Generalist staff member to oversee and supervise all public service library operations during evening and weekend hours in the absence of other library personnel. Responsible for building security and enforcing policy. Facilitate the use of the Library’s computer resources, including the online catalog, webpages, instructional support, and other computing resources; providing reference services and library instruction as needed. Perform stack maintenance; respond to department email regarding patron requests; run daily reports; compile statistics. Minimum Qualifications: High School diploma, two years college coursework and one to two years of related experience and knowledge of computer applications (email, Internet, web browsers, Windows) and hardware required. Effective communication and customer service skills required. Desirable Qualifications: Experience in an academic and/or health sciences library setting. Knowledge of basic library resources. Special Conditions: Weekend work required, 2nd Shift (Shift differential applies.) For further information on these positions and others currently available, or to apply on-line, please visit our website at: www.uvmjobs.com; Job Hotline #802-656-2248; telephone #802- 656-3150. Applicants must apply for positions electronically. Paper resumes are not accepted. Job positions are updated daily. The University of Vermont is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Applications from women, veterans and people from diverse racial, ethnic, and cultural backgrounds are encouraged

item.title: Network and Computer Systems Admininstrator
item.description: Details: NETWORK AND COMPUTER SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR / INFORMATION ASSURANCE TECHNICIAN LEVEL II (IAT-II) LB&B Associates Inc., in preparation for a pending contract, is currently seeking a Network and Computer Systems Administrator / IAT-II for the LCS COMS contract in San Diego, CA scheduled to be awarded in February 2015. The Network and Computer Systems Administrator will possess a minimum of two (2) years experience administering and maintaining computer networks. This person shall install, configure, and support an organization’s local area network (LAN), wide area network (WAN), and internet systems or a segment of a network system. Monitor network to ensure network availability to all system users and may perform necessary maintenance to support network availability. May monitor and test Web site performance to ensure Web sites operate correctly and without interruption. May assist in network modeling, analysis, planning and coordination between network and data communications hardware and software. May supervise computer user support specialists and computer network support specialists. May administer network security measures. The IAT-II shall at a minimum possess a current IA Technician Level II certification (as identified in DOD 8570.01-M/Appendix 3, Table AP3.T1). The IAT-II shall have graduated from a two (2) year computer/software-related course of instruction at an accredited technical institute or equivalent in specific training and/or experience, be able to perform hardware and software installation in a client/server environment and be able to perform routine maintenance, to include diagnostic testing an operation. The IAT-II shall coordinate and implement software backup and antivirus IA requirements. The administrator shall possess a working knowledge and familiarity with applicable IA instructions and practices. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be able to successfully complete a drug/alcohol test and criminal background check. May be required to obtain and maintain a security clearance, including successfully completing a thorough background screening. Must have a valid driver's license and safe driving record within the past 36 months, as defined by Company policy. EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disabled

item.title: Industrial Engineer
item.description: Details: Industrial Engineer Hart & Cooley, Inc., the leading supplier of grilles, registers, diffusers and vent systems to the heating, ventilating and air conditioning industry has a Industrial Engineer position at our corporate office in Grand Rapids, MI: This position will analyze and develop manufacturing methods, labor utilization standards, and cost analysis systems to promote efficient staff and facility utilization. Major responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Plan utilization of facilities, equipment, materials, and personnel to improve overall efficiency of manufacturing operations and product design. Study functional statements, organization charts, and project information to determine functions and responsibilities of workers and work units and identify opportunities for improvement. Establish work measurement programs and analyze work samples to develop standards for labor utilization. Conduct time and Motion studies (MOST). Analyze work force utilization, facility layout, and operational data, such as production costs, process flow charts, and production schedules, to determine efficient utilization of workers, materials, tooling and equipment. Plan and develop productions processes and product costing. Recommend methods for improving worker efficiency and capital equipment utilization; reducing waste materials, tooling and utilities; improving product quality and delivery; restructuring job duties; reorganizing work flow; relocating work stations and equipment; and purchasing equipment and tooling. Confer with management and engineering staff to implement plans and recommendations. Develop management systems for cost analysis, financial planning, wage and salary administration, and job evaluation. Assist in maintaining product engineering documentation. Assist in internal efforts associated with product review, product improvement and new product development. The ideal candidate will possess the following: Engineering Degree - BSIE, BSME, BSMT preferred. 5+ years of experience in manufacturing operation, including metal stamping, rollforming, welding, painting/finishing, assembly, packaging and distribution. CAD experience. Knowledge of product costing. ERP experience (Oracle preferred). Lean/Six-sigma and/or Black Belt certification preferred. Willing to travel up to 40% of the time. Hart & Cooley, Inc. offers an excellent salary and benefits package, including health, dental, and life insurance, along with a 401(k) savings plan, retirement and educational assistance programs.

item.title: Marketing Analytics Manager
item.description: Details: Marketing Analytics Manager Seacaucus, NJ 07094 Duration: Full Time with an established Retail Store System Job Description/ Responsibilities/ Day to Day Activities Job Description: Our client seeking an analytics power-house, an individual that will support Client’s efforts to create a strong and advanced analytics team focusing on their customer. This role requires passion for data mining, machine learning algorithms and leveraging it for customer insights across all channels. This position will be responsible for two main areas: a.) monitoring, measuring and reporting of customer metrics; b.) support the building of advanced segmentation models to increase customer frequency and spend, as well as drive customer acquisition strategy. Key Accountabilities: • Develop statistical and optimization models to provide insights and helps optimize customer segmentation. • Develop models to predict customer lifetime value, churn. • Construct promotion/content forecasts for customer clusters. • Support design, set up and evaluation of hypotheses testing. • Develop reporting on customer metrics. • Track and analyze model parameters and estimates over time. • Collaborate closely with Marketing, Merchandising, and IT teams to improve data pipelines. • Execute ad hoc data analyses in response to business requests. Education and Experience: • Master’s degree in mathematics, statistics, economics or closely related field. • 5-7 years in analytics role including experience in advanced analytics (statistical modeling). • Experience working with transaction level, email, and customer data strongly preferred. • Ability to manage external resources. • Proficient in SQL. • Strong working knowledge in SAS. • Working knowledge in python, weka. • Retail experience preferred. • Ability to analyze, interpret and develop insights from complex data structure • UNICA experience a plus.

item.title: Physical Therapist
item.description: Details: Job Title: Physical Therapist FLSA: Non-Exempt GENERAL SUMMARY Plans and provides physical therapy services to clients in their homes in accordance with Plan of Care and Agency policies and procedures. The Physical Therapist performs functions that require substantial specialized knowledge, judgment, and skill and must be able to make judgments accordingly. TYPICAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1) Performs physical therapy assessments, diagnostic tests, skilled procedures, and ongoing evaluation for clients who are receiving services under a medically approved Plan of Care. a. Completes initial assessments within forty-eight (48) hours of referral unless other arrangements re made. b. Completes comprehensive assessments including OASIS data within forty-eight (48) hours of referral for speech therapy services unless other arrangements are made. c. Develops a therapy care plan to provide direction to other health team members involved in the plan of care. Reviews and updates per Agency policy and client need. d. Documents all findings, plans, interventions, and outcomes and submits documentation to the Agency within seven (7) days or per Agency policy. e. Communicates plans and changes to the physician and to the client Case Manager and other caregivers through the care plan, progress notes, and participation in care conferences. f. Communicates changes in schedule and physician orders to the office on the day the changes are made. 2) Implements teaching appropriate to the client’s needs and within the context of his/her environment and learning ability. a. Assesses knowledge level of client and identifies learning needs. b. Plans, teaches, supervises, and counsels clients about their physical therapy needs to promote improvement or recovery, symptom management of disease process, and community resources. c. Evaluates the effectiveness of the teaching plan and establishes care plan for others to follow in teaching the client. a. Attends and actively contributes to interdisciplinary team or other required meetings. b. Shares areas of expertise among and between teams. Initiates interdisciplinary referrals. c. Participates in discharge planning and documents this in client record 3) Assists in the development, implementation, and evaluation of the ongoing quality improvement process. a. Serves on the Clinical Record Review Committee, as needed. b. Uses OASIS assessment tool and outcome reports to improve therapy services and client outcomes. c. Participates with interdisciplinary team to assure consistency in data collection methods. 4) Promotes personal safety and a safe environment for clients and coworkers. a. Demonstrates knowledge of safety/infection control practices by compliance with agency policies and procedures. b. Recognizes and responds to potentially unsafe situations. c. Demonstrates safe practice in the use of equipment d. Assesses safety of environment and takes initiative to help prevent accidents and promote safety. 5) Supervises applicable home care team members. a. Performs in-home supervision of home health aides and physical therapy assistants as directed and according to Agency policy. b. Evaluates employee performance and provides timely reviews as delegated. 6) Performs other related duties and responsibilities as deemed necessary. 7) Performs job in compliance with Agency policies and procedures and professional and community standards. a. Provides services in accordance with applicable state, federal, CHAP, and Joint Commission standards. b. Attends meetings and required educational programs. c. Accepts responsibility for personal and professional development and identifies learning/developmental needs to supervisor.

item.description: Details: My client, an industry leader in food manufacturing, with locations across the US, has asked me to assist them in filling a full time Maintenance Coordinator position for their facility located in Newark, NJ. item.title: RESPIRATORY THERAPIST - Home Medical Equipment

item.title: Entry-Level Strategic Account Manager
item.description: Details: State Industrial Products, founded in 1911, is a $125 million 4A1 rated company. We manufacture and distribute a wide range of specialty chemical, maintenance and repair products and services across the United States, Canada, and Puerto Rico. Our customers range from office buildings to manufacturers, from hospitals to utilities, from schools to universities. We provide an extensive line of chemical solutions and inventory control systems to maintenance and repair operations. This includes our full line of ‘Ecolution’ Green Cleaning products which have been recognized by independent organizations such as EcoLogo as well as Federal recognition from the EPA. The quality of our products and service has helped to make us one of the largest privately held manufacturers of specialty chemicals, with the nature of our products resulting in high repeat sales and strong customer loyalty. We are an ISO certified company and we sell GSA approved products. Join the State Industrial Products team and come grow with us! Position Responsibilities: • Direct sales efforts to achieve sales & profit goals by securing long-term, profitable business with selected multi-location customers. • Meet / exceed sales and profit goals. • Identify target multi-location customers as Large/Corporate Accounts to continually expand in State Chemical Products. • Establish and maintain relationships at the corporate level with select customers. • Design and implement innovative customer sales programs to create unique customer value and build sales. • Establish and implement sales growth plan for each customer and each location. Includes corporate selling and partnership with our local sales reps and managers to sell / service each location. • Work closely with sales management and associates as needed. • Manage all aspects of complex, multi-faceted programs including the process and key personnel. • Establish and maintain relationships at the corporate level with select customers.

We offer a wide range of core and specialty programs that focus on prevention and rehabilitation. Select Medical Rehabilitation Services has a proven track record as a results-oriented partner to skilled nursing facilities, assisted living facilities, hospitals and school systems. We are looking for motivated and talented candidates to join our team. At Select Medical Rehabilitation Services, we work closely as a team at all levels-locally, regionally and nationally. The universal goal that unites our team is to make a positive difference every day for our patients, customers and each other by providing excellence in clinical care and customer service. In this role, the Developer will be working with business stakeholders and project managers to understand the requirements, formulate technical designs, lead a technical team to implement and test the solutions to ensure compliance to requirements and technical standards. The Developer will also provide development support to production web sites. Candidates applying for the Digital Application Senior Developer are proficient in areas that are consistent with the Java EE architecture. Candidates should be comfortable formulating technical solutions that adhere to development standards while satisfying stakeholder requirements and exceeding expectations. A successful candidate has a proven track record for defining and delivering high quality solutions that are the result of working within a fast-paced Agile environment. Primary Duties/Responsibilities Participate in Back Log grooming and Sprint Planning sessions Design and develop EE application components with minimal supervision Participate in technical reviews as part of the development process Collaborate with the global team in continuous improvement efforts Senior level, hands-on experience with Software development methodologies Troubleshooting the EE stack OO design and development EE integration with SOAP and REST Databases and data modeling Sever and network infrastructure

item.title: Occupational Therapist - OT
item.description: Details: Paragon Rehabilitation is a subsidiary of Trilogy Health Services, LLC . Paragon provides therapy services to all of our company owned Trilogy campuses. At Paragon, our success begins with hiring the right employees. We believe that if we treat our employees like royalty they will treat our customers like royalty. Our customer-oriented culture places the emphasis on Customer Service, Teamwork, Attention to Detail, and Customer and Satisfaction. Employment with us is more than just a job. It's an opportunity for professional and personal growth. We believe that our success is the direct result of providing outstanding service that exceeds expectations to our residents, family members and our more than 7,000 employees. When you join our team, you work with dedicated healthcare professionals who extend a spirit of caring to our residents and co-workers alike. Begin advancing your therapy career today and enjoy the personal satisfaction that comes from working in a compassionate, progressive environment.

item.title: GENERAL EDUCATION INSTRUCTOR / Speech Communications
item.description: Details: Job Overview Job Title: GENERAL EDUCATION INSTRUCTOR Speech Communications Job Type: Part-Time/Full-Time Location: US-TN-Memphis Department: Academics Supervisory: No Travel Req’d: No Job Description If you’re a dedicated, enthusiastic, experienced speech communications professional, preferably with teaching experience, who believes in the power of sharing your knowledge, motivating others, and putting students first, we want to hear from you! We’re looking for a talented general education instructor to join the academic team at our Memphis Campus; Split Shift M-Th 8:00 am-1:00 pm; M-Th 5:30 pm-10:30 pm. This individual will report to the Campus’s Degree Program Department Chairperson. Essential Duties/Responsibilities: Educates and trains students in his or her field of expertise using accepted and approved instructional methodology. Prepares lesson plans using industry-standard approaches (e.g., multimedia, adult learning methodology). Teaches courses as assigned, instructs and evaluates students, develops students’ skills and encourages growth, and tracks their attendance, performance, and grades. Participates in various administrative activities (e.g., attends faculty/staff meetings or in-service meetings). Participates in graduation ceremonies, as assigned. Participates regularly in continuing professional development activities. Performs other duties or special projects as assigned. Learn more about us at Remington College – Memphis Campus . We offer a competitive salary, along with a comprehensive benefits package that includes health, dental, disability, life, vision, 401K, and flexible spending accounts, for full-time employees. How to Apply Help us train tomorrow’s work force! Qualified candidates: Please click the APPLY NOW button. We provide reasonable accommodation where appropriate to applicants with disabilities.

item.title: SALES ASSISTANT
item.description: Details: SALES ASSISTANT Needed. As a Sales Assistant, you will be actively involved in supporting the Financial Advisor(s) in the sales and service of investment, fiduciary, and insurance products through a full service brokerage platform to customers and prospects. You will be responsible for thorough research and resolution of client inquiries. These are job requirements but other duties and responsibilities may be added or revised. Qualifications: At least two years of business knowledge is necessary At least two years of sales experience is necessary BA or BS degree preferred Excellent PC skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and Access are required Good analytical skills Extremely detail and control oriented Excellent oral and written communication skills is necessary Highly organized Self-motivation and demonstration of initiative Knowledge of investments, insurance, trusts, financial planning Compliance experience Send Resumes to: Box H100 c/o The Sun Herald P.O.Box 4567 Biloxi, MS 39531. 1550475 Source - Sun Herald

Coaches internal and external subject matter experts to enhance tehir training and facilitation skills. item.title: Private Duty Home Heath Aide
item.description: Details: Job Title: Home Health Aide/Certified Nursing Assistant FLSA: Non-Exempt GENERAL SUMMARY Provides personal care services under the direction of the Registered Nurse or Physical Therapist Case Manager. The home health aide is assigned to specific patients by the Registered Nurse or other professional and performs services for clients as necessary to maintain their personal comfort. TYPICAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1) Performs personal care activities, including but not limited to: a. Bathing b. Shampooing c. Skin care/nail care d. Oral hygiene e. Shaving f. Dressing 2) Performs simple procedures as an extension of therapy services under the direction and supervision of the therapist. a. Range of motion exercises b. Assistance in ambulation or exercises 3) Performs household services essential to health care at home, including but not limited to: a. Meal preparation/feeding b. Laundry c. Light housekeeping Assists in the administration of medications that are ordinarily self-administered under the direction and supervision of the Registered Nurse (per state nurse practice laws and agency policy). Provides care that minimizes the risk of skin breakdown by being attentive to the client’s hygiene, proper positioning and injury prevention. Observe and report the presence of skin breakdown to nurse on the case or the clinical director. Performs tasks that may include, but is not limited to, providing wound care (including wet to dry dressing changes), catheter care and ostomy care. Reports any observed or reported changes in the patient’s condition and/or needs to the Registered Nurse or Therapist. Follows reporting guidelines in the Care Plan. Documents care provided and completes the forms required for the patient’s records. Completes the appropriate records to document care given and pertinent observations. Submits documentation per agency requirements. Promotes personal safety and a safe environment for patients by observing infection control practices, following agency guidelines, and reporting unsafe situations to the Case Manager / Clinical Director. Demonstrates safe practice in the use of equipment. Does not use equipment until orientation about its operation has been provided. Notifies Clinical Director of educational needs. Communicates effectively with all members of the interdisciplinary team through verbal reports, participation in staff meetings, and team conferences, as requested. Maintains confidentiality in all aspects of the job. Attends in-service programs to meet compliance requirements. Identifies learning needs to Clinical Director. Performs other related duties and responsibilities as deemed necessary.

item.title: Inventory Analyst
item.description: Details: About Us: Olympus Corporation of the Americas, with headquarters in Center Valley, PA is a precision technology leader, creating innovative opto-digital solutions in health care, life science and consumer electronics products throughout North America. Olympus works collaboratively with its customers and its affiliates worldwide to leverage R&D investment in precision technology and manufacturing processes across diverse business lines. These include: gastrointestinal endoscopes, accessories, and minimally invasive surgical products; advanced clinical and research microscopes, digital cameras and voice recorders. Position Description: Center Valley, PA - The Inventory Analyst position is responsible for performing Asset Management functions in support of all aspects of the Loaner and Demo sphere of influence to include: coordinating repairs, budgeting and forecasting, report creation, maintenance of databases, write offs, inventory adjustments, monitoring demo inventory levels, demo requisitions, and other duties as required. The incumbent's main objective is to support the sales force with adequate levels of inventory and fixing any discrepancies. EOE M/F/D/V Requirements and Responsibilities: * Conduct budgeting and forecasting for all aspects of the loaner and demo (Medical Systems Group and Scientific Equipment Group) pool to include: demo additions, replacement of beyond economical repair items, repair costs, accessories, refurbishment for used sales, and other areas as needed. * Coordinate repairs for all divisions of Asset Management, which includes working with RA/QA and the various repair facilities. * Work with Internal Audit, Field Audit, and Compliance to ensure that all procedures and policies are being followed in regards write offs, asset retrieval, and many other facets of the business, which includes assisting with the reconciliation of Sales Reps inventory. * Perform analysis of safety stock levels for current demo and loaner pools and adjusts as required to optimize levels based on criteria of minimizing carrying costs and stock-outs. * Research and correct discrepancies in physical inventory ranging from incorrect stock levels, duplicate items, invalid serial numbers, etc. that requires extensive research and documentation. * Coordinate smooth transition of new product introduction by working with Product Managers to deplete stock of old products and coordinating with Inventory Planning for ramping up stock of new product prior to the launch date in order to maintain optimal level of inventory. * Perform research, execution, and follow up of write offs to include destruction orders, field destruction, and other transactions as needed. * Perform weekly/monthly analysis/reports of various aspects of the loaner and demo pool that includes customer backorders by item, asset retrieval results, evaluations past due, write off summary, competitor trade orders and other reports as needed. * Develop and execute Showcase queries (ad-hoc and routine) in order to collect JD Edwards and/or Metrix data for analysis and reporting purposes. * Perform other related duties as assigned. Qualifications: (ONLY QUALIFIED CANDIDATES WILL BE CONSIDERED) * Bachelor's Degree with a Business concentration or equivalent knowledge is required. * Minimum of 2 years related experience is required. * Must be well-versed in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and Access). * Excellent analytical and organizational skills required. * Must have the ability to design and run reporting language queries/programs, preferably utilizing JD Edwards (Showcase). * Must have excellent oral and written communication skills. * Must be detail oriented with excellent follow-up skills. * Must work well independently. * SQL Experience recommended but not required.

item.title: QUALITY CONTROL INSPECTOR - API & NACE Codes
item.description: Details: QUALITY CONTROL INSPECTOR – Chemical Plant The Quality Control Inspector will ensure that daily QA/QC Inspections, including Non-Destructive Examinations, are performed. THE COMPANY Our client is a global leader in manufacturing and distribution of specialty chemicals. The company owns and operates world-class production complexes and serves agricultural and industrial customers with a renowned distribution system. THE OPPORTUNITY Our client is seeking a Quality Control Inspector who will work closely with both Engineering and Maintenance Department with planning, execution, organization as well as project mechanical to assure compliance with established quality standards. The Quality Control Inspector will ensure that daily QA/QC Inspections are performed. The Quality Control Inspector will also be responsible for Non-Destructive Examinations (NDE). The Quality Control Inspector will develop and implement procedures to monitor material tracking/receiving, fabrication/testing activities and final turnover documentation meet plant requirements. This position is located in the Midwest US. RESPONISBILITIES INCLUDE: Ensure safety and reliability of fixed equipment. Inspect all equipment and piping in the plant. Make recommendations for repairs, materials selection, and other remedial action in support of long-term reliability. Develop and implement risk-based piping and fixed equipment inspection plans, in accordance with API 510, API570 and API 653. Develop, implement and adopt effective inspection techniques to provide reliable assessment of the remaining useful life of plant equipment. Interpret and evaluate inspection and Non-Destructive Examination (NDE) data. Develop, implement and maintain fixed equipment inspection procedures. Review design/fabrication drawings and perform fabrication shop/field inspections to ensure conformance to specifications. Provide technical support to production team on Quality Assurance/ Quality Control related issues. Report on the activities of contractors and the quality of their work in conjunction with their QA/QC representative. Direct the daily activities of outside inspection contractors during turnarounds and special activities. Maintain complete and accurate records during inspections so they can be transferred to the permanent files.

item.title: Warehouse / General Labor Associate
item.description: Details: Warehouse / General Labor Associate Great Pay Rates! Remedy Intelligent Staffing is proud to work with some of the finest companies in the Cedar Valley. Many of our clients require warehouse/packaging/manufacturing support for their operations. The duties may vary by site or client, this list is by no means complete. Our associates may be assigned to a variety of client locations working with food or retail products and other consumer goods. Remedy Associates play a major role in ensuring that the client’s customers receives the correct product in a timely manner. General Duties for the General Labor Associate may include but not limited to: Receive in product, open boxes, sort products, repackage material and fill orders for end users Assembly of product packaging, pick and pack tasks or other similar warehouse/production type duties. Review products and procedures to ensure quality Some jobs may involve bagging, hanging or boxing product Other jobs may involve emptying bags or boxes, feeding mixing machine and other process steps as required for the position Some client assignments involve palletizing, manifest and other shipping procedures Depending on client, data entry skills may be required. Other duties as assigned

item.title: Associate Tax Consultant
item.description: Details: DuCharme,McMillen & Associates has an immediate opening for an Associate TaxConsultant in our State Income Tax division. The Associate Tax Consultant analyzes corporate state income andfranchise tax data for domestic and foreign-based corporations to determine andimplement tax savings and provide current year compliance assistance as needed. • Collects and organizes client data. • Inputs tax returns and relateddocuments. • Prepares amended returns and finalreports. • Analyzes state income and franchisetaxes for domestic and foreign-based corporations. • Reconciles apportionment data, stateadjustments and federal return information. • Conducts basic to intermediate taxresearch and identifies basic tax opportunities and exposures. • Maintains general knowledge ofallowable state modifications and adjustments used to calculate taxable incomefor all states. • Maintains efficiency in currentyear state income and franchise tax compliance software applications. • Assists with special projects asrequested, including unclaimed property, and current year compliance.

item.title: GIS Analyst
item.description: Details: Avineon, Inc. is looking to add a GIS Analyst to our dynamic team of professionals. Duties & Responsibilities: Perform GIS analysis, data processing, and quality control tasks, primarily in GE Smallworld. Perform consulting/needs assessment tasks with customers. Work with software development staff to define requirements and test software. Define and implement processes for landbase and utility data processing tasks such as conversion, migration, conflation, and maintenance. Coordinate activity between production staff, project management, and client personnel. Assist in the development of new GIS solutions. Candidate should demonstrate: Must have extensive GIS analyst experience (4+ years) with GE Smallworld. GE Smallworld software development experience preferred. Familiarity with ArcGIS, AutoCAD, and other GIS/CAD applications preferred. Familiarity with electric, gas, water/sewer, and/or telco utilitydata preferred. Strong communication (verbal and written) and listening skills. Strong analytical, organizational, problem-solving, and time-management skills. Ability to work effectively with minimal supervision. Self-motivation, adaptability, and the ability to meet aggressive deadlines.

item.title: Registered Nurse
item.description: Details: Job Title: Registered Nurse FLSA: Non-Exempt GENERAL SUMMARY Provides services to patients/clients in accordance with the State Nurse Practice Act, company policy and the accepted professional standards of practice. Provides nursing services utilizing a comprehensive base of nursing base of nursing theory and nursing process, and communicates / documents observations and assessments. Coordinates patient care and provides case management services to patients TYPICAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1) Assumes responsibility and accountability for the practice of professional nursing in accordance with the State Nurse Practice Act and standards for home health care nursing. a. Performs comprehensive assessments of patient status, including physical, psychosocial, and environmental parameters. b. Completes comprehensive assessments including OASIS data set within forty-eight (48) hours of referral. c. Develops and/or follows an individualized Plan of Car that incorporates analysis of data and current scientific findings. d. Provides skilled interventions with a focus for achieving realistic patient outcomes within a specified time period. e. Reports changes and information necessary to modify and update the care plan to reflect progress towards goals. 2) Consistently demonstrates competency with technical nursing skills according to personal and legal scope of practice: a. Assessment skills as spplied to the patient, caregiver/support system, and environment. b. Teaching skills according to the client’s needs and within the context of the client’s environment, value system, and physical / emotional status c. Medication administrations. 3) Practices nursing with respect for individual, culture, and spiritual differences. 4) Communicates properly and in compliance with company requirements. a. Reports significant changes in client status to physician and other members of the team in a timely manner consistent with patient needs. b. Maintains patient records showing systematic assessment, planning intervention and evaluation c. Participates in team meetings and clarifies individualized reporting responsibilities with all new assignments. d. Documents legibly and according to company’s submission of documentation policy e. Follows company guidelines for completion of forms, reflecting the orders and care plan. 5) Initiates actions to improve the quality of patient care. Takes appropriate actions independently and responsively in home health care situations. Initiates referrals as needed to other health care team members when identified or delegated by the case manager. 6) Maintains confidentiality in all aspects of the role. 7) Promotes personal safety and a safe environment for patients and co-workers. a. Demonstrates knowledge of safety/infection control practices by complying with established policies and procedures b. Recognizes and responds appropriately to potentially unsafe situations. c. Demonstrates safe practice in the use of equipment. d. Assesses environmental safety and takes initiative to prevent accidents and promote safety. e. Notifies clinical director of need for review and/or training related to equipment, procedures, or safety/infection control practices. 8) Participates in ongoing, professional self-development. a. Participates in all mandatory education per company guidelines. b. Identifies needs for personal professional growth. c. Demonstrates competency in areas of assignment or identifies the need for additional training (wound vacs, infusion, specialized equipment, etc.) 9) Performs other duties as assigned.

item.title: Health Service Administrator - RN - Registered Nurse
item.description: Details: PrimeCare Medical is currently looking for a Registered Nurse (RN) to work as the Health Service Administrator (HSA) in the medical department at the Bucks County Prison. In this role the HSA is the designated health authority whose responsibility is administratively overseeing the health care delivery system at the local facility. RN - Charge Nurse - Management - Registered Nurse RESPONSIBILITIES: • Recruit, orient, supervise and evaluate performance of mental health, nursing and clerical personnel. Final approvals for hiring must be received from Director of Human Resources prior to employee starting. • Administrative supervision of physicians, physician assistants, nurse practitioners and nursing staff. Assign and direct employees. • Approve the nursing schedule and aid the nursing supervisor in recruiting replacement staff. • Counsel, discipline, suspend and/or terminate employees who violate established policies/procedures of PCM or the facility in accordance with PCM’s Corrective Discipline Policy. • Complete annual Personnel Action Notice on all directly supervised employees. Report to and meet with Regional Coordinator on a regular basis (quarterly at a minimum). • Prepare required reports as requested. • Maintain a professional administrative attitude at all times. • Maintain a professional working relationship with facility staff, unit staff, contracted providers, outside service providers, and corporate staff. • Is tactful and diplomatic at all times. Function as a role model for staff. • Make use of established Corporate and facility policies and procedures in decision-making. • Must use factual data and sound independent judgment in meeting the responsibilities and performing the duties of this position. • Ensure compliance with established standards of PCM. Checks with Vice President of Operations or appropriate Corporate Staff on policy and contract interpretation issues. • Ensure valid licensure, insurance coverage, CPR certification, and TB testing on all medically licensed personnel (employees and contracted). Audit payroll time sheets, calculate and approve total hours, monitors and reports overtime to Regional Coordinator. • Monitor services provided by contracts and maintain statistical information as required. • Ensures that all necessary paperwork is completed on newly hired staff and forwarded to Human Resources in the Corporate Office. • Maintain Accreditation manuals for each established standard-updates when needed, file appropriate documents into each manual, reviews local policies and procedures annually. • Maintain accurate up-to-date PCM Policy Manuals. • Ensure that all manuals are current. • Ensure that the proper flow of relevant information (policies, procedures, in-services, problems) is disseminated to supervisor and supervised personnel. • Prepare and submit required statistical, narrative summary and/or operational reports according to schedule (monthly, quarterly, annually). • Maintain security of all medical records. • Audit medical records per Quality Assurance audit criteria and reports deficiencies to QA committee. Suggest an outline for Quality Improvement for facility and implement plan. • Screen all requests for copies of records and in collaboration with Corporate staff and approve or disapprove. • Review status of inmate/patients with serious acute and/or chronic health problems and ensure that necessary intervention and treatment is rendered. Handle, in writing, all inmate/patient complaints/grievances. Report information to the Corporate Risk Manager. • Monitor inpatient hospitalizations for length of stay and duration of follow-up. Activate early release procedure when indicated. • Administratively monitor and evaluate medical services to avoid the inappropriate use and/or duplication of services. Evaluate referrals to outside consults for applicable security restrictions and intervenes when necessary. • Identify financial responsibility for inmate/patient incurred expenses and report to Corporate Office. • Monitor any potential catastrophic illnesses/injuries and research appropriate channels to limit PCM and facility liabilities. • Monitor, evaluate and recommend methods to improve operational efficiency and cost containment effectiveness. • Monitor and ensure strict compliance to all applicable pharmacy regulations. • Maintain stock inventories and order supplies and equipment when indicated. • Monitor and evaluate physical safety requirements for inmates/patients and staff to ensure a safe working environment. • Plan, implement, and monitor disaster plan and coordinate drills with facility at least annually. • Coordinate and/or provide in-service programs which are aligned with the medical program (at least monthly). • Attend scheduled meetings, and provide minutes as well as follow-up to identified problems areas. • Chairperson for monthly health care staff meetings, and Chairperson for quarterly meetings with administration and Corporate staff. File agenda of minutes one (1) week prior to meeting and submit meeting minutes to Vice President of Operations. • Oversee with the facility Medical Director the operation of the peer review program. • Maintain unit operations at ALL times to meet accreditation standards. • Attend seminars, workshops, and conferences at the direction of PCM. • Conduct sanitation inspections on a regularly scheduled basis. • Flexibility in work schedule is required. Unpredictable circumstances may warrant additional work hours and overnight travel to other facilities. • May be required to relocate (temporarily) to meet the needs of PCM. Adhere to established PCM and facility policies and procedures. • Is operationally responsible and accountable for the medical unit within a facility. • Review all incoming bills to insure proper provider of care is being billed. If it is PCM’s responsibility, it must be stamped, approved, and mailed to Fiscal Clerk. • Conduct mortality reviews within thirty (30) days of an inmate’s/patient’s death. • Any /all other duties and responsibilities as assigned or delegated. RN - Charge Nurse - Management - Registered Nurse

item.title: Coating / Spray Technician
item.description: Details: Great Part-time opportunity!!!! We are now hiring a part-time daylight (first shift) industrial manufacturing position, located in Johnstown that pays $8.50 / hour starting wage. You will be working 4 hours a day / 5 days a week and still have plenty of time left in the day to do what you would like to do. Title: Coating / Spraying Technician Responsibilities: 1. The ability to paint high tech electronics to the exact specifications that are called for. 2. Knowledge of the various coating mediums used for a variety of the customers. 3. Job requires the ability to stand for long periods of time during the coating operation. 4. Ability to work with spray guns and adjust them accordingly based upon the type of coating as well as mixing the right amount of thinner to give the best overall coverage and protection. 5. Also demonstrate the coating removal methods based upon the material type being used 6. Must possess good time management skills 7. Must possess good computer skills in order to run Precision Coat automated spray machine. 8. Must be able to read and interpret directions associated with the particular customer's specifications. Qualifications / Requirements: High School Diploma / GE equivalent Preferred Skills: Basic computer skills to include but not limited to: Microsoft Office, Excel, Word. If you are interestn this position apply below and send me a resume to Kelly Services is an equal opportunity employer including, but not limited to, Minorities, Females, Individuals with Disabilities, Protected Veterans and is committed to employing a diverse workforce.

item.title: Data Analyst - III
item.description: Details: Description of the Position: Data Analyst for FRB project…Candidate will be responsible for many aspects of data analysis, quality control and product testing of several large data warehouses. Candidate will create processes and reports to reconcile data with clients, execute processes, distill detailed information into clear communications with clients and develop procedures for resolving differences in data. Must be prepared to take on both process management and hands-on work to get the job accomplished. Works closely with customers and design teams in prioritizing data and information requirements. Determines how Decision Support Systems (DSS) and Executive Information Systems (EIS) will provide the information required to make effective business decisions; translates requirements into applications that employee appropriate decision support and reporting tools. Involved in the design, development and maintenance of DSS. Performs modeling of data sources and flows, works with the data management staff to define an operational framework that will define, develop and implement DSS, EIS, policies and security frameworks to ensure precise and secure delivery of knowledge and information. Monitors system performance, implements changes to optimize performance. Involved in the selection of new products. Needed skills and knowledge includes process and data modeling, DSS architecture and tools, development life cycle methodologies, IT planning methodology, extensive knowledge of the enterprise's data and decision-making processes. Core Functional Responsibilities: Under general direction, performs complex research and analysis to support business operations and presents findings to manager or project leader. Determines best practices and suggests how to improve current practices. Develops recommendations to solve problems and issues related to business operations. Analyzes data sets and creates "dirty" versions of reports. Interfaces with clients to discuss needs and/or results with client. Education/ Experience Guidelines: Bachelor degree or equivalent experience. 5+ years of related experience. Must have mortgage industry or credit risk analysis experience Comfortable working with and analyzing data. Must have strong Access and Excel experience SQL skills necessary Key Distinctions: This is a senior individual contributor level and a master of analytical skills. May provide input into hiring decisions and performance evaluations but lacks the authority to hire, discipline or deliver appraisals. EEO/AA Employer

item.title: Licensed Practical Nurse or Certified Medical Assistant
item.description: Details: Seeking a position with a quality employer? Consider The University of Vermont, a stimulating and diverse workplace. We offer a comprehensive benefit package including tuition remission for on-going, full-time positions. This opening and others are updated daily. Licensed Practical Nurse or Certified Medical Assistant - Student Health Services - Per Diem Position - We are looking for a clinical staff team member responsible for patient screening and tasks associated with maintaining efficient patient flow and quality health care in our busy outpatient office. Excellent interpersonal skills, proficiency in basic nursing procedures (i.e. immunizations, office laboratory tests, EKGs), history taking and patient education, a must. 25 to 40 hours per week, including some Saturdays. Successful candidates will work as part of a strong, supportive, and fun clinical team providing health care for students attending the University of Vermont. Desired qualifications: Knowledge of developmental issues of adolescents and young adults and experience working with college age population. Computer skills sufficient to maintain proper medical records and complete clinicallyrelated administrative tasks via our electronic medical records. Ability to communicate clearly in person, via phone, and in writing with students, families and other student health staff of a variety of disciplines. Commitment to providing quality, respectful and confidential health care to all patients, valuing differences in race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, and disabilities. We offer competitive hourly wages. Per Diem employment does not include UVM benefits. For more information about Student Health Services, visit www.uvm.edu/health. Applications will be accepted until the positions are filled. To apply, email cover letter and resume to Mary Bucher at Mary.D. For further information on these positions and others currently available, or to apply on-line, please visit our website at: www.uvmjobs.com; Job Hotline #802-656-2248; telephone #802- 656-3150. Applicants must apply for positions electronically. Paper resumes are not accepted. Job positions are updated daily. The University of Vermont is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Applications from women, veterans and people from diverse racial, ethnic, and cultural backgrounds are encouraged

item.title: Senior Accountant
item.description: Details: Senior Accountant As part of the Corporate Accounting/Consolidations team, this role will assist in the monthly process of consolidation and reporting of world-wide operating results and financial position. The position will also be involved with the quarterly preparation of subsidiary financial statements as required for purchase price basis (PPA) of accounting. Responsibilities will include creating and updating journal entries for input in the Outlooksoft (BPC) consolidation system as well in the Oracle general ledger system. The position must also be able to effectively communicate with others inside as well as outside the Finance organization. Specifically, the job responsibilities include: Update various recurring monthly consolidation elimination journals as well as preparing non-standard journals as required. Review and analyze international subsidiary financial statements as translated into US dollars. Communicate with other internal accounting departments (Fixed Assets, Real Estate Accounting) with regards to relevant transactions accounted for on a PPA basis. Responsible for preparation of various Balance Sheet account analysis. Prepare and review of journal entries as part of the monthly general ledger closing process using Oracle system. Assist with the preparation of various quarterly and annual data requests as received from other TRU departments such as Financial Reporting, P&A or Tax. Assist in the preparation of various schedules and other supporting analysis in support of the Company’s annual external audit.

item.title: Admissions Representative (sales)
item.description: Details: If you love sales but are looking for more meaning in your career, this is the opportunity you’ve been waiting for. Application processing and follow-up Recruiting students for our school requires a customer-focused attitude and an ability to meet challenges head-on; you would be servicing people who are creating opportunities in their lives. Requirements for the position include: * A Bachelor Degree is preferred, however we will consider candidates with an equivalent combination of education, experience or training. * Preferred two years of education recruitment or sales experience - Individuals with call center, customer service, social service, recruitment or financial services will be given additional consideration. * Strong telephone skills * Dynamic people skills. * Professional Image is a must! * Possess excellent verbal communication, presentation and interpersonal skills with an ability to establish rapport with a diverse customer base. * A strong goal-oriented approach We believe in rewarding success and offer: * A comprehensive benefits package including 401K. * Outstanding career potential in an organization that is rapidly growing. For more detailed information about Branford Hall Career Institute and curricula offered, please visit our website at www.branfordhall.edu An equal opportunity employer.

item.title: Human Resources Consultant
item.description: Details: FrankCrum - A family of employer solutions FrankCrum contributes to a company’s success by minimizing the amount of time and money needed to manage services related to employees. Our personal touch has been one of the hallmarks of FrankCrum during more than 30 years of serving employers across the nation. That unmatched experience enables us to help companies guard against risk and attract and maintain an effective workforce with quality benefits and expert payroll services. Deep experience and broad company resources aren’t the only reasons you can trust FrankCrum. Clients have stayed with us for decades because they can tell we’re driven by the Golden Rule and that approach makes good business sense for everyone. We value relationships, keep promises and make integrity a priority in everything we do. In addition to our dedication to our clients, FrankCrum is committed to our neighbors. The company is deeply involved in helping the less fortunate in our communities. Whether a company needs employer services for a staff of two or a thousand, the only name they need to know is FrankCrum. Our highly trained and experienced team can process their payroll accurately and on time, lower a company’s HR expenses, provide great rates on workers’ compensation insurance, plus a whole lot more. Ours is a family-oriented business and having our name on the door influences how we do business. We believe in taking the time to understand a company’s needs and provide employer services with a personal touch. You’ll find that FrankCrum is guided by a commitment to integrity in everything we do. Are you ready to be engaged in something big? Continue reading to learn more about the job, our excellent benefits package, and how to apply! Essential Duties Advises clients with employee relations issues by analyzing circumstances, anticipating problems, considering Federal, state and local laws, and then recommending steps for successful resolution. Advises clients in the development and maintenance of employee handbooks, job descriptions, and policies and procedures. Advises clients regarding recruitment and termination practices. Maintains awareness of the changes in Federal and state employment laws and how the laws affect the PEO and the client. Assists in processing EEOC and wage claims including composing a response and gathering and analyzing related documentation. Assists clients and departments with various needs including questions regarding child labor law and FLSA issues. Assists in the sales process by meeting with prospective clients to demonstrate the company’s human resource expertise. Addresses SSN mismatch issues by communicating with clients and employees to obtain resolution. Assists in the preparation of the client newsletter. 10. Prepares and files the EEO-1 report.

item.title: Trinity Marine - Welder B (2640)
item.description: Details: Trinity Industries, Inc. , headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is a diversified industrial company that owns market-leading businesses which provide products and services to the energy, transportation, chemical, and construction sectors. Trinity reports its financial results in five principal business segments: the Rail Group, the Railcar Leasing and Management Services Group, the Inland Barge Group, the Construction Products Group and the Energy Equipment Group. Trinity’s businesses provide industrial products and services ranging from railcars, barges, storage containers, and aggregates to highway products, structural wind towers, railcar parts, and railcar leasing and management services. Trinity’s vision is to be a premier, diversified industrial company that owns market-leading businesses which provide superior products and services to customers while generating high-quality earnings and returns for shareholders. Trinity Marine Products is searching for a talented team player to fill the open position of Welder B in our Caruthersville, Missouri plant! We welcome your ideas and your outstanding work ethic. Join our team today and be a part of Helping to Build America. ™ In this role, you will GENERAL FUNCTION: Welds metal parts together to fabricate or repair products according to specifications. Completes daily hoist report. Inspect all equipment used daily to ensure proper working order. Complies with all company safety rules and procedures. Wear all required PPE. TYPICAL DUTIES: The following statements describe general duties and should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities. Welds and repairs casting defects using both gas welding or brazing and any combination of arc welding processes. Visually inspects castings for needed welds. Performs related task such as thermal cutting and grinding. Follow AAR required weld procedures. Performs general housekeeping /clean up in work area. Complete daily required logs. Performs other duties as assigned. "B" Able to recondition and repair castings. Must be able to perform "C" level position.

item.description: Details: PROGRAM NAME: GRADE: A/B 22, Salaried OBJECTIVE: To manage the daily operations of a program and supervise direct service and support staff; coordinate service delivery so that client needs, program goals and contract objectives are effectively met. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS MAY INCLUDE: • Supervise program staff including regular individual and group staff meetings and case consultation; oversee proper client to staff ratio. • Approve admission of clients to program; assign cases to program staff and oversee service delivery. • Provide support with in-crisis or problem cases; provide on-going assistance to program staff in coordinating services for clients. • Review and monitor case files for both internal and external quality assurance standards. • Oversee services provided comply with contractual requirements. • Liaison to community agencies such as Dept. of Children and Families, Department of Juvenile Justice, etc. and attend closure or conference staffing. • Oversee program staff completes all documentation and reports in a professional and timely manner. • Assist in grant writing, contract negotiating or re-accreditation preparation. • Maintain and generate necessary reports and paperwork in a timely manner. • Provide direct case work in the absence of program staff. • Provide BHOS services including group counseling, individual counseling, social skills training and documentation. • Participate in treatment team meetings. • Oversee BHOS services are provided as part of the facility's daily programming. • Participate in four hours per month of supervision by a licensed clinician. • Maintain appropriate documentation of all BHOS services. • Perform supervisory responsibilities specified in COA Standard TS 3: o Delegate and oversee work assignments so that service delivery is performed according to the organization's mission, policies and procedures and service philosophy o provide case consultation and in-service training, as appropriate o identify unmet training needs o conduct performance evaluations o support and enhance staff's ability to perform their jobs by teaching and modeling technical knowledge and skills, work management and communication skills and conflict management skills • Participate in the quality improvement process. This list of essential functions is not intended to be exhaustive. Children's Home Society of Florida reserves the right to revise this job description as needed to comply with actual job requirements.

item.title: Mgr-Accounting
item.description: Details: An Accounting Manager with Waldorf Astoria Hotels and Resorts is responsible for managing the audit function in hotelÆs continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability. What will it be like to work for this Hilton Worldwide Brand? What began with the worldÆs most iconic hotel is now the worldÆs most iconic portfolio of hotels. In exceptional destinations around the globe, Waldorf Astoria Hotels & Resorts reflect the culture and history of their extraordinary locations, as well as the rich legacy of Waldorf Astoria. Simply stated, Waldorf Astoria embodies timeless elegance. We are bringing that legacy to life every day, with fresh, modern expressions of the essence of Waldorf Astoria. We are providing guests the exceptional environments and the personalized attention that are the source of those unforgettable moments that create a singular experience. Waldorf Astoria Hotels & Resorts is one of Hilton WorldwideÆs ten market-leading brands. For more information visit www.hiltonworldwide.com. If you understand the value of providing guests with an exceptional environment and personalized attention, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Team Member with Waldorf Astoria Hotels & Resorts. What will I be doing? As an Accounting Manager, you would be responsible for managing the audit function in hotelÆs continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability. Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards: Reconcile General Ledger accounts, review discrepancies and problematic accounts and guide staff to follow-up on such accounts Ensure processing and accuracy of reports including, but not limited to, month-end closing, monthly forecast and variance, etc. Control and track inventories of operational, departmental and team member meal budgets Ensure the correct downloading of data into timekeeping systems Manage weekly submission of time and attendance data, including gratuities Calculate and produce daily deposit transmittals for received checks Conduct monthly payroll audits and issue pay checks Monitor and develop team member performance to include, but not limited to, providing supervision and professional development, scheduling, conducting counseling and evaluations and delivering recognition and reward Recruit, interview and train team members What are we looking for? Since being founded in 1919, Hilton Worldwide has been a leader in the hospitality industry. Today, Hilton Worldwide remains a beacon of innovation, quality, and success. This continued leadership is the result of our Team Members staying true to our Vision, Mission, and Values. Specifically, we look for demonstration of these Values: H Hospitality - We're passionate about delivering exceptional guest experiences. I Integrity - We do the right thing, all the time. L Leadership - We're leaders in our industry and in our communities. T Teamwork - We're team players in everything we do. O Ownership - We're the owners of our actions and decisions. N Now - We operate with a sense of urgency and discipline In addition, we look for the demonstration of the following key attributes in our Team Members: Living the Values Quality Productivity Dependability Customer Focus Teamwork Adaptability What benefits will I receive? Your benefits will include a competitive starting salary and, depending upon eligibility, a vacation or Paid Time Off (PTO) benefit. You will instantly have access to our unique benefits such as the Team Member and Family Travel Program, which provides reduced hotel room rates at many of our hotels for you and your family, plus discounts on products and services offered by Hilton Worldwide and its partners. After 90 days you may enroll in Hilton WorldwideÆs Health & Welfare benefit plans, depending on eligibility. Hilton Worldwide also offers eligible team members a 401K Savings Plan, as well as Employee Assistance and Educational Assistance Programs. We look forward to reviewing with you the specific benefits you would receive as a Hilton Worldwide Team Member. The above information is provided as a highlight of the major benefits offered to most full-time team members in the United States. All benefits listed may not be offered at all locations. This is not a summary plan description or official plan document. EOE/AA/Disabled/Veterans

item.title: HEALTHCARE QA TESTER / QA MANAGER ROLES - 100% travel required
item.description: Details: **Below is a description for a QA tester role. We have QA Manager and director needs as well in the same space** Please apply if interested in any of these... This is with a Fortune 500 Company and will be based out of NJ. MUST be based out of NJ to APPLY. This is a contract-to-hire, must work W2. Quality Consultant, you would work as a part of a dynamic team involved with New Jersey Delivery Center and supporting State HIX projects, and other testing for new systems and/or enhancements with a focus on both manual and/or automated testing tools, test script and test plan creation and maintenance, defect tracking and reporting. Responsibilities include: * Analyze and dissect system requirements and technical specifications to create and execute test cases for NJDC State Exchange (HIX) projects * Ability to write test cases and execute testing * Product test and driving defect resolution * Assist business users in defining User Acceptance Testing, test cases and plans * Establish and maintain test cases and test data * Create and maintain test cases in Quality Center * Actively participate in walk-through, inspection, review and user group meetings for quality assurance * Work with business users, system analysts, designers and programmers to create and analyze various required project documents * Participate in production implementation verification and being accountable for validating system quality * Plan, document, evaluate and track testing results to ensure system applications are free from defects * Communicate and interact with appropriate areas on problems, changes and enhancements that may impact data, workflow and /or functionality within Information Technology software * Comply with standards of the software development life cycle and follow strategies, plans and procedures within information Technology software * Comply with standards and strategies of the software development life cycle * Design and develop detailed test cases from complex business requirements * Prepare test data to support test cases * Execute test cases * Record and prioritize test defects * Troubleshoot and isolate problems encountered during testing; triage and root cause analysis * Coordinate with Release Manager to ensure environments contain proper code release and data for testing * Communicate testing status and escalate testing issues to the Project Manager * Coordinate with PM on matters of test data and test plans to maximize efficiency across test phases * Work with PM and Business to select/create test scenarios from user stories for User Acceptance Testing * Support UAT testing execution, data requirements, and defect resolution * Ability to travel to customer and client sites. About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Sr. Speech IVR Developer (121-111914)
item.description: Details: Our IT Core Development team is seeking a Senior Speech IVR Developer. As the IVR Developer you will work with other TracFone and third party resources to build speech recognition capable solutions. You will have the opportunity to work directly with internal clients to understand their needs, explain the solutions proposed, and answer any questions they may have. Once a solution is agreed upon you will work with a team to implement that solution ensuring quality and consistency. TracFone currently uses AVAYA Orchestration Designer and Nuance NDM so you will spend a significant portion of your time working with this tool set. Responsibilities: Develop and modify Speech IVR applications using Orchestration designer - Development of bi-lingual applications in English and Spanish, including administering bi-lingual speech through applications. Review call flows and UI specifications and create technical designs, system requirements and specifications. Work with basic Java and J2EE technology with basic understanding of Application Server such as Weblogic. Troubleshooting post-production problems and suggesting and implementing quick solutions. Fast reaction to issues, providing technical input for rollback decisions.

item.description: Details: Receptionist/Human Resource Assistant Description The US spends $160 Billion per year on highways. Every new car model costs at least $1 Billion to develop. Yet cars spend only 5% of their time driving. Where do these cars spend the other 95%? PARKED! LAZ Parking is one of the largest operators in the growing multi-billion dollar US parking industry. Founded in 1981, LAZ operates hundreds of thousands of parking spaces from offices all across the country. When it comes to parking, we’re the experts! Most importantly, LAZ is a PEOPLE FIRST company with a mission to “create opportunities for our employees and value for our clients". If you’re looking to join a growing company led by passionate people committed to being the best – contact us today! The Spirit of the Position: The Human Resources Assistant/Receptionist will support the Human Resources Manager in establishing and meeting professional and compliant employment practices. As a company devoted to promoting an employee-focused servant leadership culture, the Human Resources Assistant will act as a liaison between the programs and initiatives originating from our home office and help to support the individual needs of our operational teams throughout their assigned region. RESPONSIBILITIES: Providing Administrative Support to the Human Resource Manager & Receptionist Duties for the Main Office Team Answering & screening and direction phone calls. Assisting with the recruiting and interviewing process. Assisting in the preparation of employee files. Must be able to multi-task on a daily basis. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a MUST. * Assist with compliance in all state and federal laws in regions; updating forms, policies, procedures as needed in coordination with the home office. * Assist with leaves of absence including FMLA, disability leaves, others as needed in coordination with the home office HR and payroll. * Back up for bi-weekly payroll processing

item.title: Patient Care Technologist (Certified Medical Assistant/EMT/Paramedic) (145-074)
item.description: Details: Physicians Immediate Care is a Midwest leader in urgent care and occupational health services with more than 30 locations in four states and growing rapidly! No appointments are required and most clinics are open seven days a week, up to 12 hours a day, to treat non-life threatening illnesses and injuries. JOB SUMMARY: Working under supervision of various providers and/or General Manager, in an outpatient setting, provides basic and routine assistance with patient care delivery within the medical assistant scope of practice and required certifications in accordance with Physicians Immediate Care policies, practices and procedures and applicable regulations DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Welcomes Physicians Immediate Care patients and visitors by greeting them in person, answers inquiries and directs them through registration process and prepares patients for health care visit. Always positively affects the patients and visitors perception of the visit experience. Assists patients with insurance documentation and billing questions. Guides patients in providing required information and completing paperwork. Professionally obtains patient information necessary for processing medical charges, including a copy of an insurance card, a copy of a driver license or other form of photo identification, and other information related to each patient situation. Obtains medical history. Prepares, assists and accurately completes all forms. Supports patient care delivery. Assists providers during examination and treatment. Takes vital signs and performs all ancillary tests appropriate to skill level, certifications and state regulations. Performs ancillary testing and tasks as ordered by the Provider (PFT, EKG, injections, audiograms, blood draws) and as certified. Dispenses medications and DME within scope of practice and as ordered by the treating provider and in accordance with state regulations. Applies bandages, dressings and splints as ordered by the treating provider. Educates patients. Completes records. Maintains supplies, cleans rooms and decontamination of equipment, and stocks rooms with required supplies. Maintains and operates all clinical equipment, including calibration and record keeping in accordance with current policy and procedures. Maintains safe, secure, and healthy work environment. Conducts business in a service-oriented manner that is attentive, cooperative, sensitive, respectful and kind with dealing with patients, visitors, the public and all colleagues. Assists in maintaining a neat, clean and orderly appearance in the lobby and overall clinic throughout the day. Performs drug screen collections for both DOT and Non-DOT drug screens, according to DOT guidelines; ensures preparation for pick-up and shipment to appropriate laboratory. Attends clinic staff meetings as required. Completes required certifications; becomes proficient in clinic systems and procedures, and maintains currency in all policies, practices and procedures. Performs duties to achieve or exceed established service standards. Performs other duties, as assigned.
