item.title: Director of Purchasing
item.description: Details: Job Description Position: Director of Purchasing Position Summary: Manage all aspects of purchasing, inventory, shipping and receiving. Design and executes strategies and plans to meet company short-term and long purchasing management requirement. Responsibilities/Duties: • Overseas material requirement planning, warehousing, and receiving areas. • Plan and coordinate activities to schedule, procure, receive and store materials. • Monitor inventory availability and movement of materials, supplies and service to meet production and delivery schedules. • Develop short and long-range materials management programs to minimize inventory cost and meet schedule requirements. • Monitor operations in assigned areas to keep expenditures within acceptable limits. • Provide for alternate plans in the event of unforeseen contingencies. • Evaluate inventory and production capacities and plans in relation to current and long-range commitments. • Prepare reports of order status, forecast, and inventory and production control activities. • Maintenance and accuracy of data in MRP system (input and issuance from inventory). • Negotiate with vendors for goods and services, negotiating the best possible price and service guarantee. • Implement Lean Manufacturing concepts and techniques. • Negotiate large capital expenditures. Qualification and Specific Skills: • Solid analytical skills, excellent communication skills (oral and written) • Negotiating skills. • Proficient in SAP. • Proficient with MS Office, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access. • Solid decision making skills. • Manage Buyer, purchasing clerk and inventory planner. Physical Demands/Work Environment: • Regularly required to sit or stand and move about the facility. • Required to be able to read documents and computer screens. • Exposure to shop elements. Experience/Education: • 4-year degree. • Minimum 5-10 experience. • Experience with purchasing, expediting, MRP systems. • Quality/continuous improvement initiative. • Manufacturing safety practices • MS office applications

item.title: RN Staff Educator-Delmar Nursing and Rehabilitation Center (242-442)
item.description: Details: Delmar Nursing and Rehabilitation is seeking a Staff Educator. Must have RN License. Please read the description below: Under the direction of the Director of Nursing, the Staff Educator's primary function is to assess, plan, implement, and evaluate the educational and infection control programs and services for this facility. In addition, this position will be responsible for providing appropriate orientation programs for all newly hired facility employees. The Staff Educator shall assume the responsibility for instituting and enforcing the facility's Infection control Program. The individual in this position will be responsible for monitoring infection control practices throughout the facility, to identify, evaluate and record data related to nosocomial infections. In addition, the individual is directly responsible for initiating infection control measures as directed by the Infection Control Committee and in accordance with the institution's policies and procedures, current rules, regulations, and guidelines for long-term care facilities. The individual is also responsible for supervising the employee health program. The Nursing Educator shall also be responsible for providing educational programs to residents, residents' family members and other responsible parties based on identified needs and knowledge deficits. DE or MD RN License and Long Term Care experience is required. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Orientation Plans and coordinates orientation program for all facility employees. Ensures all department directors/managers have developed appropriate content for new employee orientation and ongoing required in-services. Ensures current job description and departmental competencies are current. Assists all new facility employees in their assimilation and orientation to the nursing home. Plans, coordinates and evaluates orientation process for clinical staff including theory, technical skills, clinical experience, and critical thinking skills to facilitate successful performance. Assures that all new clinicians and staff are scheduled to complete training and follows up. As a role model, instills in each employee an appreciation of their individual contribution in delivering optimum quality care. Education/Training/ In-Service Plans, coordinates and oversees all educational activities within the nursing home based on an assessment of staff needs: develops an annual schedule for presentation of mandatory in-service programs. Confers with management and supervisory personnel in order to determine educational needs. Establishes criteria for all in-service education programs, creates and writes the curriculum, course outlines, objectives, teaching methods, examinations, and evaluation tools for each program Develops, facilitates and implements education programs and in-services to enhance the clinical skills of the nursing staff. Works closely with Corporate Nursing Leadership, operations and IT to develop clear and concise project plans and implementation timelines Coordinates and administers technology and clinical competency evaluations to licensed and non-licensed nursing personnel: reviews assessments to identify educational needs of staff. Evaluates effectiveness of educational presentations designed to meet the assessed needs for all personnel, including outcomes regarding competencies at quarterly Quality Assurance meetings. Clinical Informatics Acts as technology SuperUser and maintains the clinical and technological competency of clinical staff to ensure a safe and effective care environment. As the clinical expert, works in collaboration with corporate to develop policy and procedures that reflect evidenced base practices. In concert with the Director of Nurses and nursing management staff, educates clinical staff on best practice and assure assimilation of these into nursing practice. Proficient use of computer technology with the ability to support the teaching and implementation of the components of an electronic health record. Oversees the competency process and assists clinical staff in incorporating technology into their daily work and the overall management of resident care Assures that technology competencies are completed for all nursing home personnel. Understands basic concepts related to information system applications, networks and interfaces. Identifies staff needs related to education and training in the areas of computer skills and competencies in the use of electronic tools for patient care. Works with Clinical, Operations and IT Clinical Systems Specialists to review and revise current policies and procedures to reflect the integration of technology; this includes the development of best practice guidelines. Recommends enhancements to system based on on-site observation and training Ensures that training is provided on software upgrades and monitors implementation of these upgrades into daily work routines. Assists in the design and implementation of Quality Improvement activities that utilize the content of technology applications to establish safer, higher quality resident care. Infection Control/Employee Health Plans, coordinates and implements the Infection Control program by performing surveillance rounds, tracking all infections, investigating and responding to breakouts and reporting monthly to the Director of Nursing; oversees the TB prevention and Vaccines programs for residents and staff. Develops and implements problem-solving techniques and procedures to decrease nosocomial infections, improve infection control practices throughout the facility and comply with OSHA regulations Maintains current knowledge concerning principles of epidemiology and infection control through literature review and seminar attendance; maintains statistical data as required by regulation & reports. Monitors and implements employee health programs including TB, Hepatitis and Flu Vaccines, investigation of employee illness, and blood borne pathogen exposure control plan Quality Improvement Responsible for interdisciplinary collaboration for quality improvement through ongoing support to department heads, committees and quality improvement teams. Responsible for the promotion and support of systems and processes to achieve high quality safe, cost-effective healthcare integrating the principles of risk management, quality, care management, health information management and regulatory compliance. Coordinates effective measurement and analysis of resident care and services With Director of Nursing and Nursing Home Administrator, identifies the major opportunities for improvement and develops a strategic quality improvement plan Provides direction and coordination for the development and implementation of the quality improvement plan for the nursing department in concert with the Director of Nursing; directs the program with the goal of ensuring that improvement occurs as a result of quality improvement activities. Provides oversight to ensure that quality improvement efforts are coordinated for all nursing departments. Responsible for guiding nursing management in their performance improvement efforts Coordinates the integration of performance improvement processes with leadership to review and improve overall patient care outcomes, policy and procedure implementation and the peer review process Utilizes analytical, statistical and research skills and interpretive abilities to analyze data and make recommendations for improvements or changes. Utilizes change management skills necessary to lead initiatives that will result in significant changes to work flow processes throughout the nursing home Leads and directs process improvement activities that provide more for more efficient and streamlined workflows.

item.title: PT Dockworker- Inbound, 5am Start Tue-Sat
item.description: Details: PITT OHIO , a $430 million, high service, highly profitable, transportation solutions provider offering SUPPLY CHAIN, GROUND, LTL and TRUCKLOAD services is seeking a Part Time Inbound Dockworker, 5am Start Tue-Sat at our Allentown, PA Terminal . PITT OHIO has received countless safety, service, and carrier of the year awards and our highly acclaimed Safety Department is a leader in the transportation industry. Dedication to quality and excellence is our goal at PITT OHIO. We offer competitive wages, 401K, profit sharing, pleasant work environment, and much more! QUALIFICATIONS: A minimum age of 18 years of age. No record of a driving license suspension or revocation for more than 30 days, covering the 36-month period prior to the order date of a Motor Vehicle Record (MVR). A suspension for failure to pay and or failure to appear will be considered provided that there was no conviction for driving while suspended during this time period. No record of citation or conviction for any serious traffic violation during the 60-month period prior to the order date of a Motor Vehicle Record. No past pattern or record of citations or convictions for more than three motor vehicle violations during the 36-month period prior to the order date of the Motor Vehicle Record (MVR). No past pattern or record of involvement in more than one at-fault traffic accidents and no more than two motor vehicle violation during the 36-month period prior to the order date of the MVR. Must pass a NON -Department of Transportation (DOT) physical examination. Must consent to a pre-employment drug screen. PITT OHIO must receive a negative result. Must have the ability to read and write the English language and also perform simple mathematical calculations Must consent to a ten-year check on work history. Any gap of 30 days or more must be indicated and explained, and you may be asked to provide documentation. Discrepancies may prevent your application from being processed and job offer withdrawn. You will be an at-will employee throughout your employment with PITT OHIO. Nothing in these guidelines, your application or in the employee handbook guarantees employment for any period of time or is intended to be a contract of employment. JOB DESCRIPTION: Must have command of English language with the ability to read, write, and communicate effectively with internal and external customers, perform simple mathematical calculations, handle receipts, read shipping labels and follow loading instructions. Will be responsible to load and unload freight according to DOT requirements on and off of trucks by hand or by use of hand truck or dolly. Sort and secure items in position on trucks according to DOT requirements or on dock to prevent damage. Lifting various types of materials will be required: cartons, bags, cylinders, boxes, crates, drums, pipe, bars, rugs, etc. Common material handling tools will be used: carts, dollies, pallet jacks, and tow motors. Standing, walking, pushing, pulling, twisting, carrying, bending, reaching, and lifting both above and below waist level will be required. Heavy lifting will be required. Work in a safe and professional manner so as to reduce personal risks and risk to fellow employees. Comply will federal, state, and company regulations. Process all paperwork daily associated with the execution of the job. Be available and willing to work; exceptions require management approval. Work in a positive, supportive, and cooperative way at all times. Perform other duties as directed or requested. PITT OHIO is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, religion or other legally protected status. To navigate to the PITT OHIO Career Center and apply for this position, please go to pittohio.balancetrak.com . We offer competitive compensation, an excellent benefits package, 401(k), profit sharing, paid vacations, a pleasant work environment, and much more.

Application developers typically work as part of a project team, and also communicate progress, technical issues and their resolution. Responsibilities: The primary responsibility of this position is for the design, implementation and maintenance of web application. Collaborate with IT and Business partners to design, develop, and troubleshoot end to end technical solutions Perform coding to written technical specifications Perform system design and specification development, program logic and flow-charting that meets the stated project objectives Contribute to design review meetings with other members of Application Development Identifies and manages dependencies and downstream impacts of the project to minimize adverse effects on other projects and / or programs Test the resulting components in accordance with company standards and as defined in approved testing plans Analyze run time profiles to debug errors that may exist Perform maintenance programming and correction of identified defects Requirements: 6+ years of demonstrated experience designing, developing and testing real-world enterprise applications. 5+ years of hands-on experience in Java/J2EE development. 3+ years of experience using Spring MVC Framework, JDBC, JPA, RESTful services using Jackson; must have solid understanding of IOC and AOP concepts. 5+ years of relational database experience with a solid understanding of SQL and modeling concepts. e.g. Oracle, SQL Server Ability to work with minimal supervision and effectively manage multiple task assignments Excellent communication, teamwork and customer service skills. Ability to troubleshoot issues. College degree or equivalent experience required. Desired Skills: Data management experience preferred Experience any other metadata technologies would be a plus. Experience using Gradle, Rational Team concert, Rational Asset manager is preferred. Experience using Scrum and following Agile best practices. Position 6: Job Title : Senior Java Developer Location: Charlotte, NC - 28262 Duration: 6 Months + High possibility of extension Key Skills : Java, J2EE, Spring MVC Framework, SOA , API Qualifications: • Strong knowledge of computer programming languages and code proven experience in developing functional applications and systems of medium to high technical complexity • 5 yrs development experience in Spring MVC and REST web services • Experience with J2EE APIs, protocols and development of multi tiered applications • Comprehensive experience using Weblogic Workshop and other Eclipse based development tools • Experience aligning to SOA standards, best practices and design patterns Responsibilities: • Responsible for assisting in customization and development of application systems • Designs, programs, and codes software in response to specific business requirements • Understands how to optimize joint development efforts through appropriate project design, database use, code creation, and software architecture • Develops design specifications in compliance with IT Architecture Resolves user issues and suggestions Position 7: Job Title : Front End Developer (UI) Duration : 12+ Months Required Skills: AngularJS, jQuery, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Java Preferred Skills : Bootstrap, Foundation

item.title: Regional Sales Manager
item.description: Details: Come join an industry leading company! We are Interline Brands and we are seeking a Regional Sales Manager to join our growing organization in Jacksonville, FL. We are a leading direct marketer and distributor of broad-line maintenance, repair and operations (MRO) products. We serve a diversified client base ranging from facilities maintenance and professional contractors to government properties, hardware retailers, locksmiths and more. Under the guidance and leadership of the General Manager, this position is responsible for providing sales direction and management to a group of Maintenance USA Inside Sales Account Managers. The primary responsibilities include assuring the attainment of company sales and gross profit goals, sales coaching through all facets of the sales cycle, team motivation and personnel development. The Regional Sales Manager will develop short and long-range sales strategies that will increase sales and company profits through a combination of new account creation, increasing wallet share of existing customers, and maintaining customer retention levels. This position will also focus on improving customer satisfaction while enhancing overall Account Manager efficiency while generating sales growth at acceptable gross margins for any and all assigned business segments.

item.title: Sr. Specialist- Human Resources
item.description: Details: Eurofins is the world leader in the food, bio/pharmaceutical product testing. It is also number one in the field of environmental laboratory services and one of the global market leaders in agroscience, genomics, discovery pharmacology, and central laboratory services. With over $1 billion in annual revenues and 13,000 employees across 170 sites in 35 countries, Eurofins is a leading international group of laboratories providing an unparalleled range of testing and support services to the pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, food, environmental, and consumer products industries and to governments. Consider joining Eurofins National Service Center at Lancaster Laboratories where people are the most important element in our chemistry. Senior Specialist responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following : Ensure legal compliance with all labor laws Perform due diligence on potential acquisitions and prepare written reports for Merger & Acquisition team Support integration programs across all business units, research state laws and ensure systems are in place to comply with all regulations. Assist Business Unit leaders with employee issues, disciplinary actions, review and approve terminations, reductions in force, investigate and defend legal complaints filed by employees. Administer FMLA/STD/LTD/ADAA for all Eurofins US employees to ensure compliance with regulations. Design and deliver training to current Eurofins leaders and following acquisitions. Create and oversee Affirmative Action, EEO and Veteran plans. Perform FLSA audit on all new acquisitions. Perform all functions in support of and in compliance with the Equal Opportunity Employment laws Provide support and assistance as needed within all areas of Human Resources The ideal candidate would possess : Strong computer, interpersonal, and organizational skills Excellent communication (oral and written) and attention to detail Ability to work independently and as part of a team, self-motivation, adaptability, and a positive attitude Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, keep accurate records, follow instructions, and comply with company policies Proficient in Microsoft Office; advanced Excel skills preferred Basic Minimum Qualifications : Bachelor's degree in related field and minimum of five years related experience in Human Resources with strong focus on regulatory compliance or equivalent combination of education and experience preferred Demonstrated proficiency with project skills including analysis, planning and organizing, and implementation of new programs Must be able to maintain confidential information Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship Ability and willingness to travel as needed Position is full-time, Monday-Friday, 8 a.m.-5 p.m., with overtime as needed. Candidates currently living within a commutable distance of Lancaster, Pennsylvania are encouraged to apply. We offer excellent full-time benefits including comprehensive medical coverage, life and disability insurance, 401(k) with company match, paid holidays and vacation, and dental and vision options. To learn more about Eurofins, please explore our website www.eurofinsus.com. Eurofins is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. As a Eurofins National Service Center employee, you will become part of a company that has received national recognition as a great place to work. We offer excellent full-time benefits including comprehensive cafeteria plan medical coverage, life and disability insurance, 401(k) with company match, paid holidays and time-off, and dental and vision options. To learn more about Eurofins at Lancaster Laboratories, please explore our website www.eurofins.com. Eurofins at Lancaster Laboratories is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

item.title: Maintenance Worker-Part Time
item.description: Details: POSITION TITLE: Maintenance Worker JOB NUMBER: 100-004 DEPARTMENT: Executive ____________________________________________________________________________________ GENERAL PURPOSE: The Maintenance Worker is responsible for maintaining the buildings and grounds of all the Company’s properties in the Tampa area as directed by the Manager. Performs preventative, routine and scheduled maintenance in an effective and timely manner. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Maintenance duties include, but are not limited to, weekly light bulb/ballast replacement and recycling, furniture repair, external property and warehouse clean-up, monthly scheduled filter changing/vent cleaning, and moving staff/equipment to new locations. Evaluates and recommends to Team Lead and Manager any new work accessed while working at all properties, vendor service needs, all verbal staff requests and emergency work. Responsible for all thermostat time changes/temperature changes as needed/battery check and changes along with smoke detector battery changes at all properties. Responsible for security of all keys to all locations each day in lock boxes. Keys should not leave the property at the end of the day. Makes required purchases in a timely manner of supplies/equipment/tools using the Company credit card as requested by Team Lead and/or Manager; keeps track of receipts for items purchased with credit card or petty cash for each job/location, notating on each receipt the office location. Turns in receipts each Friday prior to leaving for the day. Responsible for securing in proper rooms/maintenance gated cages all maintenance equipment/tools and keeping up to date inventory recordings. Coordinates with Team Lead when time for corrugated pick-up. Provides completed/working on updates at 11:30a and 3:30p to Team Lead. Takes inventory of janitorial supplies on Tuesdays at locations assigned and turns in supply list to Manager by afternoon. Uses personal truck and/or rented moving vehicles for transportation between offices and for delivery/pick-up of furniture and supplies as required. Notification to Team Lead and Manager via phone any absences within 1 hour of scheduled arrival time followed by an email. Keeps all records and paperwork in proper order and up-to-date. Performs other duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS : To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: High school diploma, minimum of two years’ experience in maintenance at an established company and any specific training in electrical or plumbing; or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. NECESSARY KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Ability to: work from designated office for collaborative/interactive fulfillment of duties; appropriately and directly interact with other staff members and/or outside associates; operate office equipment such as computer to sign in and out and to take web courses as assigned; ability to use cell phone to communicate via email, text and use of camera if requested; copier/scan machine; attend and participate in meetings via phone and in person. Ability to read and interpret written assignments, service tickets and other documents provided. Good oral and written communication skills including good grammar, voice and diction. Ability to think thoroughly through each assignment and verbally follow-up with Team Lead and Manager with any questions, suggestions, etc. Knowledgeable of all safety standards and procedures of performing assigned work; understand and implement proper techniques for lifting and/or moving light, medium and heavy weight objects. Clean driving record. Ability to manage time to successfully complete tasks by deadlines. Skill in using hand tools (hammer, screwdrivers, ladders, painting equipment, etc.). Basic knowledge of carpentry. Skill in maintaining positive work relationships. Basic mathematics skills (add, subtract, multiply, divide, fractions, decimals). Available for short notice overtime daily and on weekends. LICENSING AND CERTIFICATION: Valid Florida driver’s license and proper insurance PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that should be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, bend, kneel, stoop, climb, reach with hands and arms, sit, climb up to 12 ft. ladders as needed, and balance. The employee frequently is required to manipulate or use objects, equipment, tools, and/or controls. May require specific vision abilities to perform this job. Ability to lift and/or move heavy objects; use of a dolly when needed. WORK ENVIRONMENT : The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Attendance at employer worksite is an essential job requirement. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate and occasionally loud if using power tools. Ambient room temperatures and lighting for indoor work. Exposure to weather elements when working outside or traveling from location to location. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the employer and employee and is subject to change by the employer as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change. The duties listed above are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work that may be performed. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related or a logical assignment to the position. We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

item.title: Linux Security Engineer *Remote Work*
item.description: Details: One of TEKsystems top clients, a leader in technology protection, is currently seeking a strong Linux Security Administrator to join their growing team in Sterling, VA. This company is continuing to dominate the market and grow their presence across the globe. While bridging the gap between the Linux team and the Security team, this unique role will play a crucial part in serving as a liaison between two critical aspects within the technical environment. This team will continue to expand over the next 2 years, so if you share a passion for teamwork and innovation and are looking to join a growing, opportunistic company; this is the job for you! The ideal candidate will have/be: 3-5 years of experience supporting Red Hat Linux in an enterprise environment (at least 100-200 servers) Experience with automation/state management tools (they use CFengine). So any prior experience with Redhat Satellite Server, Puppet, Chef etc. Well versed in OS Security (OS Hardening) using PCI compliance or HIPPA compliance to secure the Linux environment on all business models. Experience with Shell scripting and/or Perl, virtualization, and Apache. Not only will you get hands on experience with cutting edge automation tools, you will be a part of a growing global team where there is great room for advancement and upward mobility- not to mention the ability to work remote! About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Learning Center Office Manager (312-008)
item.description: Details: At Lindamood-Bell, We Create The Magic of Learning! About Us Lindamood-Bell is an internationally recognized leader in the research and remediation of learning difficulties for children and adults. Our research-validated programs develop the underlying skills for reading, spelling, language comprehension, and math reasoning. Lindamood-Bell strives to enhance learning for all people, for all ages…for life.Lindamood-Bell owns and operates more than 60 learning centers across the United States, the United Kingdom, Australia, and Canada. In our learning centers, we provide one-to-one instruction for children and adults with a variety of learning difficulties. We are looking for a responsible, energetic, detail-oriented Learning Center Office Manager who is passionate about customer service to join the management team at our Learning Center. This position is full-time with benefits. The Learning Center Office Manager reports to the Center Director and is responsible for overseeing all aspects of daily office operations primarily through the management of client accounts, scheduling, and collecting and processing payments for a busy Learning Center. S/he is also responsible for the organization and completion of marketing details and events for their center. S/he will develop relationships with students and parents to model the Lindamood-Bell ® culture of friendly customer service in a warm and welcoming environment. Ideal candidate must be professional, possess strong problem solving, organizational, and customer service skills, and be computer literate (Excel and MS Word for Macs). Responsibilities: Manage and respond to all of the operational needs of the center Generate and maintain the weekly student/clinician schedule, coordinate clinician and consultant schedules, and communicate and handle all schedule changes Answer all questions about Lindamood-Bell operations, schedules, accounts, financial aid and billing procedures Manage accounts receivable: creating invoices, processing credit card and check payments, and making bank deposits Complete accurate payroll bi-weekly Answer phones and provide general information about Lindamood-Bell services Oversee and maintain the appearance and upkeep of the center and its technology Schedule and maintain appointments for Center Director, Associate Center Director, and Consultants Organize screening and interviewing of potential employees Oversee and organize all safety procedures Communicate with corporate departments regarding center or corporate requests

item.title: RN Registered Nurse (Home Healthcare / Nursing) (202820)
item.description: Details: Mississippi HomeCare of Picayune part of the LHC Group As a Registered Nurse, you will educate patients and their caregivers on their conditions and the steps needed to ensure proper recovery. Additional responsibilities of our Registered Nurse include: Provide admission, case management, and follow-up skilled nursing visits for home health patients. Administer on-going care and case management for each patient, provide necessary follow-up as directed by the Clinical Manager. Confer with physician in developing the initial plan of treatment based on physician''s orders and initial patient assessment. Render hands-on care, management and evaluation of the care plan and teaching of the patient in accordance with physician orders, under Clinical Manager''s supervision. Revise plan in consultation with physician based on ongoing assessments and as required by policy/regulation. Coordinate appropriate care, encompassing various healthcare personnel (such as Physical Therapists, Occupational Therapists, MSW, Home Health Aides and external providers). Report patient care/condition/progress to patient''s physician and Clinical Manager on a continuous basis. Implement patient care plan in conjunction with patient and family to assist them in achieving optimal resolution of needs/problems. Coordinate/oversee/supervise the work of Home Health Aides, Certified Home Health Aides and Personal Care Workers and provides written personal care instructions/care plan that reflect current plan of care. Monitor the appropriate completion of documentation by home health aides/personal care workers as part of the supervisory/leadership responsibility. Discharge patients after consultation with the physician and Clinical Manager, preparing and completing needed clinical documentation. Participating in the Quality Assurance/Quality Improvement Process Preparing accurate, orderly and timely reports and documentation Adhering to all practice standards as they apply to patient care Required Skills: Associate''s of Science degree in Nursing Valid RN license in state of employment Valid driver''s license and one year clean driving record Ability to drive within 30-60 miles daily Ability to successfully complete required background check and drug screen Excellent writing and charting skills, experience with electronic medical record preferred Required Experience: Minimum 1 year acute care nursing experience, home health experience preferred At LHC Group, you’ll find the support and resources you need to keep learning, achieve work-life balance and be recognized for your achievements. Your ideas can take root among a talent team of healthcare professionals focused on providing quality patient care. The quality of care we deliver is a direct result of our 10,000-person strong work force that brings clinical innovation to life each day. At LHC Group, we are committed to investing in the growth and development of our employees – from an industry-leading internal credentialing program to a state of the art learning management system. Benefits packages for qualified employees include: • Flexible schedule• Competitive compensation• Health, dental, and vision coverage (health coverage for part time employees)• Short- and long-term disability• Disability buy-up gap plan• Life insurance• Cancer insurance• Critical illness insurance• Medsupport insurance• Accident insurance• Flexible spending accounts• Employee assistance program• 401(k) with company match• Employee stock purchase plan• Bereavement pay• Orientation period• CEU’s through online management systems• Paid time off• Holiday pay• Company vehicle program available for qualified employees The LHC Group difference With hundreds of locations across the nation, we partner with local physicians, nurses and therapists to provide high-quality and compassionate care to nearly 100,000 patients annually. Our commitment to innovation and service excellence influences every facet of patient care and is the cornerstone of our industry-leading clinical programs, like T3 and Beyond Balance. We are proud to be the preferred post-acute care partner for leading hospitals and health systems around the country – operating more than 100 joint venture locations nationwide. Strength, stability and clinical expertise – that’s the LHC Group difference. LHC Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and drug free workplace.
